story:
Short Summary

My name is Jared Sartin and I am the DM for Here Be Dragons, a Dungeons & Dragons series on Twitch. The cast on the couch for our main storyline is my wife Lindsey Sartin and our friends Lauren Byrd, Nathan Ondracek, and Austin Schumacher. We came together to start a Dungeons & Dragons Campaign in early 2019. Our initial run consisted of a bunch of cobbled together tech that we had - and each week it differs slightly.

Our goal for this Indie GoGo is to build a set, improve our tech, and focus on the story weekly - not set-up and tech issues.

What We Need

We are looking to build our set and tech, we are hoping to raise $1000+ to offset the costs for the set build. To get the full set and tech upgrades our estimates put us closer to $2000 in total costs.

Our set will be about $750+ of supplies:

  • Stage flats from Ecoset LA, estimated $0-$100 (depending on what they have)
  • Transportation of flats, estimated $100
  • Paint, estimated $50
  • Fake fur blankets, estimated $60
  • Lighting, estimated $200
  • Fake torches and candles, estimated $150
  • Sound dampening, estimated $100
  • Misc building supplies, estimated $75
  • DM Chair, estimated $30 (second hand!)

We are also looking to improve the tech after we get a set built, which totals around $900+:

  • 4x Shotgun mics for the players, estimated total $200
  • 4x Mic Stands, estimated total $150
  • 6x XLR Cables, estimated total $50
  • 8-channel USB sound board, estimated $150
  • 2x Tripods, estimated total $50
  • 2x High-end web-cam, estimated total $275
  • Misc cables/hubs, estimated total $25

Rough rendition of the set (for context, we currently have the blue couch against a plain, tan wall and a dark wood table).

The Impact & What You Get

We want you to see, hear, and experience our story in an even better way! Artistry and story telling are something we are passionate about and we want to share our talents with you and our other #InnMates. 

We want you to be a part of our story. Everyone who supports us will have their name inscribed in our guest book on set. Whenever we set-up for a show, we want to remember our story is made for sharing and you help us do so! Additionally, if you support early, you will benefit from our limited perks. Take a look to the right, or below, or... wherever they show up for you.

Risks & Challenges

Dungeons & Dragons is making a comeback. We have many other "competitors" - some big names and others newer like us - they are all great. Our challenge is creating a network fans and follower who join for our adventures, shenanigans, and unicorns. There are many ways to enjoy D&D. We do not want to be a firehose of content, but rather provide creative and consistent entertainment on a regular basis.

TSBI will continue, regardless of how much funding we receive. We will keep playing and continuing to improve the quality of our show. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute, that's okay. We simply ask you support us by sharing our pages, and liking, following, and engaging with us through our social and our stream. New friends and #InnMates make us happy!

story:
Short Summary

Get ready for some glamour, drama and sass!

My name is Jamie Smith and I am the creator of The Real Gays of Vancouver. Our show is a mock reality show with heart. It's about six ultra-rich LGBTQ friends and the shenanigans they get up to. Through playfully addressing issues that affect the community, our intention is to make people laugh while empowering us all.

This project is important to us because it follows and explores the experiences of a group of confident, successful friends in a unique way. This is first and foremost a comedy, while exploring serious issues that impact our community: stereotyping, gender pronouns, trans bullying, addiction, and much more.  Your contribution can help us create a show that will make people laugh and also empower us!

 

Where will your funds be going?

We are committed to ensuring that all our collaborators are adequately compensated in producing a polished, professional show. Here are the costs for the show:

 

Paying & Feeding our Actors

Renting Camera Equipment

Hiring a Sound Team

Locations & Transportation 

Props

Post-Production & Score

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give any money right now, you can still help us! Spread the word to anyone you think would enjoy our campaign- use the share tools at the top, or tell your friends in real life to check it out! 

 

Follow us on social media:

www.Facebook.com/RealGaysofVancouver

 

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
What Is No Checkpoints? 

You know that movie you’ve seen a million times, or that game that you’ve logged countless hours into, or that entire show you just binged last weekend?  Have you ever wondered, "what went into the things that we love?"

Join Antwand Pearman as he attempts to answer these questions in the two centers for entertainment: New York and Los Angeles.  Antwand will explore these two cities and meet up with the people that make these things possible – from the actors to the writers, producers & indie artists.

No Checkpoints with Antwand Pearman is an eight episode series that peeks behind the curtain of the entertainment industry.  In each twenty-minute episode, Antwand goes deeper in the interviews, not only to find out what people do, but what makes them tick. To see what makes them laugh and cry, or their guilty pleasures.  Along the way, Antwand will explore the places, history, and impact of the Entertainment Industry.

My Story

                                                    

Growing up I always knew what I wanted to do.  I wanted to work in entertainment and produce my own show.  As a child on the mean streets of South Florida, it wasn't easy to see a path from my neighborhood to New York or Hollywood.  I lost my way a few times, but I was determined to succeed.  Ten years ago, I packed up and moved to New York and got a job as an assistant at MTV Networks.  Every chance I got, I would talk to people in the office about what they were working on and how they do what they do.  One day, I struck out on my own and started GamerFitnation.com.  It was an online magazine devoted to gaming and health, because I knew that most gamers did not fit the stereotype of living in their mom's basement.  GFN was the success that inspired me to start ‘Producers Vs Show,’ an online site with webseries and media.  I have been fortunate, in both ventures, to interview extremely talented people from film, television, music, sports and gaming – including Hall-of-Famer Shaquille O'Neal, Grammy® Award Winner Rihanna, as well as cast members from shows like Luke Cage and Gotham, and many more.

To get here, I did not use a booking agent.  Instead I just called managers and told them my story and they agreed to do my show.  Now my team and I are ready to take our program to the next level with 'No Checkpoints with Antwand Pearman'.  NCWAP takes you on a journey through my passions for both the video game and film industries.  My goal is to explore the world of entertainment with the celebrity guests and friends I’ve met along the way, and in doing so show you the ups, downs, ins and outs of that world.  We will share live moments with you while learning and discussing and getting-to-know the places you love – or maybe have never heard of.  Most shows follow a predictable template with limited interaction, but we go beyond the talking points by showing another side of our guests.  The interviews are fun, authentic, and full of a refreshing level of honesty that we know you – the fans – will love.

This crowdfunding campaign is to help my team launch and increase the production value of our new show.  I have a great team of people who believe in this vision and are dedicated to making it successful.  All we need is a little help from you!  For me, this is a journey over 20 years in the making, and I would be grateful for your support. 

             

                         What We Are Going To Show

                           

Why We're Doing This Campaign

This crowdfunding campaign is to help us launch this new show.  We have a great team set up, but we want to make sure they can put dinner on the table while delivering something fantastic and unique.  We also want to explore the entertainment industry to the fullest.  The key expenses are travel costs and  post-production – which is the final major expense that will bridge the gap between "good" and "excellent". This season of No Checkpoints With Antwand Pearman will be on the Producers Vs Show YouTube channel.

About the Host and Director

            

Antwand Pearman, known in the gaming world as BlackBible, was the creator of GamerFitnation  inc. a digital media company focused on producing gaming, health, and fitness content.  GamerFitnation.com has grown into a well-know name in gaming.  As head honcho at GamerFitnation, Antwand has interviewed a bevy of A-List celebrities, Video game developers, influencers, experts, and executives such as Leonardo DiCaprio, Denzel Washington, Tyson Beckford, Noel Lee, Nick Cannon, Carmelo Anthony, and Shaquille O'Neal – among many others.

Jeffrey Schimmer is a filmmaker and producer based in New York.  He has produced and directed short films and podcasts, as well as worked with companies like CBS and MSNBC.  Jeffrey met Antwand about a year ago, going on to write for Antwand Pearman Vs The Interview and the Producers Vs Show blog.  Jeffrey has produced and directed some of the more recent episodes of Antwand Pearman Vs The Interview and is ready to take the next step!

            

               Our Work Has Been Featured On                      

             

              What Celebrities Have Said About Antwand                                             

    Perks You'll Receive 

           

          

             Plus much, much more see perks list ->->->

          

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
WELCOME TO THE JUMP START CAMPAIGN!

Hello, my name is Skinny Corleone. I am the owner of 49th Parallel Films and a seasoned Director and Editor.  I've been in shooting films since 2007.  My team and I are looking to start this campaign to help fund the web-series for a Short film that we shot in 2019, called JUMP START. JUMP START (the short) was produced by myself and independent filmmaker Robyn Jones.  

JUMP START 

Also in 2019, the short film version of JUMP START won Best Special Effects in the DC 48 Hour film festival. This inspired us to expand on the concept and produce a web series. 

I'm excited about creating our first web series; furthermore with it being an urban sci fi drama which there are not many of in the film industry.

About the Campaign

We want to raise $6,500 to produce Season 1. 

All monies raised will be used for production, equipment (such as audio and lighting), location fees, cast and film crew. As well as paying for marketing, promotion and advertising.   

About JUMP START

The short was about a young female and her family taking a trip to enjoy themselves. The older sister is kidnapped and taken mysteriously.  The woman responsible for taking her has  information and a secret that she wants to reveal to the teenager.  The father and mother track down the mysterious woman who took their daughter and a fight ensues. 

View the original short film below which reveals a surprise ending. You'll see why there is good enough reason to continue and create the action-packed web series!


What makes JUMP START so important? Why Now?

We are living in a time where filmmakers of all backgrounds can't be ignored. It's time for black culture to be represented in all genres of film; especially science fiction. Black sci fi (or afro futurism as some call it); show how combining culture and the advancement of technology are combined to create limitless possibilities.

With the popularity of Urban Sci-Fi Dramas such as Netflix's "Raising Dion", Spike Lee's "See You Yesterday " and Misha Green's "Lovecraft Country".

We ask, why not 49th Parallel Films?
 

How You Can Help Make This A Reality

We have lined up some gracious perks with benefits for you once you donate. 

For instance you and a guest can attend a live and/or private virtual premiere screening, get a walk-on role in one of the web series episodes, or become an associate Producer. 

Donate Today!

Help us make this a success and show your support by donating and sharing this campaign.

Please browse through the perks and see how you can support JUMP START The Web Series. A contribution of any size is greatly appreciated. Donate and share the campaign link with friends and family today!  

SKINNY CORLEONE, Director, Editor, Producer, Showrunner 

 

ROBYN JONES, Producer

 

PARIS BOYNES, 1st AD, Project Manager

 

SHA'RON LYNN, Starring as KATE PALTRAN

 

EMANUEL GALLMON, Starring as KEVIN PALTRAN 

 

BRANDI DYER, starring as AGENT

 


WHAT THE MONEY WILL BE USED FOR?:

Every penny donated will go towards the making of the Webseries:

Below is a list of things that will be paid for to make this Web Series a success. 

Location + Permits. 

SFX (Special FX)  

Crew. (Make up, AD, Boom operators, Sound Mixers, etc)

Food. Catering crew will be on hand to situate, serve and clean up after production

Equipment and Insurance:  For cameras, lights, G&E equipment, trucks, etc.

Art. Prop weapons, set decorations, costumes., etc.

Post Production: Film Editing, Color Correction, sound/audio mixing, and music clearances. 

Actors

Promotion/Marketing 

Production Design

Transportation

Hair & Make up... and more

We're ready and determined. And want to produce this webseries with great success. Anxiously Looking forward to getting started after the campaign.

story:
The Short Summary

The Mile High Chronicles (MHC) production team has over 50 years of combined experience in television and video production. We realized that important stories unfolding in Denver were being passed over, treated like “flyover country” by the cultural centers on both coasts. The expansion of online and mobile video make cultural centers ubiquitous - they can be anywhere now.

Our aim is to create original, compelling web series that give voice to perspectives that wouldn’t otherwise be seen.

Mile High Chronicles follows Kassandra, a twenty-something visionary with trust issues. A new arrival to the Mile High City after being conned out of a job and a work visa, Kassandra drives for Dryft, an extreme-bargain ride-share service. But her real passion is to create a ground-breaking mobile App. In each four-to-six minute episode, Kassandra comes into contact with colorful local characters - their favorite "products" (wink-wink) - and slightly hallucinatory scenes from movie classics.

By the end of the first season, Kassandra will learn that it’s easier - and more fun - to do something important with a group of people you can trust. She’ll also plant the seeds for building IRL community, and help confront a group of violent, Trump-embolden neo-Nazis.

This campaign is critical  not only for raising production funds, but also for bringing Mile High stakeholders into the process. We want to build community by empowering people tell their own stories.

You are part of the Team! A Co-op with Altitude!

Our goal for this campaign is to make sure that actors and crew get at least a small stipend for their hard work on Season One. If we were in New York or Los Angeles, we’d need to raise $30,000. To help our actors pay for babysitters on shoot days, we think $8500 is a reasonable target. And more important than the total number of dollars, we want to identify and grow the number of people in Colorado who are into the idea of supporting local artists - even if the contribution is what you might pay for a ticket at the Multiplex.

We have some amazing perks in exchange for your support, such as subscriptions to our Patreon channel which will include behind the scenes specials.

What happens if we don’t reach our financial goal? Basically the cast and crew will receive smaller stipends, and we'll have fewer resources to promote the series. If we exceed our goals, your contribution will be used to ensure that subsequent seasons go into production.

The Impact

The arc of season one addresses the very real threats that women, people of color, and LGBTQ communities face on a daily basis even here in Colorado. Through humor and strong storytelling, we hope these and other relevant themes will help raise awareness and create a dialogue.

This is about more than just making another webseries. We also want to build the capacity for other untold stories to make it onscreen. We hope our “webseries toolkit” will bolster the ranks of Denver’s content producers.

And through this campaign, we hope to fuel a growing community interested in fostering fun, no-holds-barred storytelling.

What Lies Ahead

There are significant challenges ahead. Distribution is one of the biggest. It’s all well and good to post something on Youtube, but we want to reach a viewership that rivals successful web content produced on the coasts. Here’s how we intend to tackle this issue, with the help of great backers like you.  

Our many years of experience in promotion give us an inside track in harnessing the power of social media platforms like Facebook. We can identify people with specific interests using a wide array of engagement techniques.

We’ve also created partnerships with several local businesses and grassroots groups who share an interest in the topics covered in season one. With their help, we can extend the circle of potential influence-makers and translate that into increased viewership.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, we get it. But you can still be a member of the team. Remember, for us it’s as much about growing community as anything else. Here’s what you can do if you don’t have cash today:

Please help us get the word out and make some noise about the campaign. Join our Facebook group (https://www.facebook.com/groups/milehightvseries/)

Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word to people in your network.

We are eternally grateful to all the support & feedback we've received from the Denver content community, and interested people like you! We can't thank you enough!

story:
ABOUT THE WEBSERIES

JUST SAYING... is a comedy webseries. It all starts when ALICE, a beautiful sassy Frenchy, is struggling big time to find her perfect flatshare match for her trendy Shoreditch flat until... BEA, a fun loving party girl from Brazil, comes along to shake it all up. 

Together they go through the good, the bad, the ‘too drunk to remember’ and let’s not forget the ‘what happens in this house stays in this house’ shenanigans. 

As much as our flat mates annoy us when they eat our favorite food and mistake shower time for a bad Xfactor audition.. we love the fuzzy feeling they give our bank account when we split the rent and...the Netflix subscription. The ultimate question is: Where would be without our flat mates?

We shot the Pilot Episode titled 'WHAT A DAY'... which has now been released. We now need your help to shoot the full season! 

We can’t wait to show you all the FUN we have in store just for you...

Check our our website and follow us on social media for regular updates and all the JS juice: https://www.justsayingtheseries.com/

 

WHY THIS WEBSERIES IS SO IMPORTANT TO US

We have great hopes for this webseries. With a fun and relatable script that speaks out all of those unexplainable moments we have lived with our flat mates. You know those iconic moments we so badly wish someone had been secretly documenting? We have that (and more) covered.  London, like all big cities, can be a really lonely place and it is our fuzzy flat share experiences that have gotten us through the toughest and best moments. And for those of us who aren't that close to our flatmates this webseries is the perfect reason to have that night in together you have been trying to plan (or avoiding) since like forever! The characters each have unique perks along with great stories to tell. With already 5 episodes written out, we now need your help to bring those to life by donating whatever you can. This will help us secure the next shoot, be able to remunerate the Actors and our amazing Crew, as well as send our webseries to Festivals!

 

MEET THE TEAM

 

ORIANE PICK

Oriane is a French-born Actress, currently working between London and Paris, with experience in Film and Theatre.

​After having lived in various countries in Europe, Africa and Asia, she moved to London in 2013 and has finished her Meisner training and been involved in various projects since, including short films and commercials. Oriane is multilingual and speaks French, English, Spanish and Russian.

Her passion for acting started when she was seven years old and lived in Nigeria. Already intrigued by the performing arts, she joined the French Theatre Group for young Actors at her school, and has been performing on stage ever since. 

Oriane later trained at Les Cours Florent in Paris for a summer. She further continued her acting training in London at the Salon: Collective, becoming a fully trained Meisner Actor. 

This year, Oriane has also produced and starred in the upcoming short films ‘Dance Bitch’, Shaken, Simon and Say Your Name. Having dreamt of creating her own series, Oriane is the official writer and producer of Just Saying and will be playing the role of Alice in the series.

 

CLARA MARIA ROSE

Clara Maria Rose is a London based Actress, with experience in Film and Theatre.

She grew up in Germany until she moved to England last year and has been involved in various projects since, including short films and a web series. 

Clara studied with the Salon:Collective to become a fully trained Meisner actor.

Oriane approached Clara to co-produce the web series Just saying... and to guest star in it.

 

CAMILA SEGAL

Camila is a multilingual actress fluent in four languages. 

She started her career through her training with the National Youth Theatre and has since recently shot two feature films titled ‘Love Is Not Enough’ and ‘Clued Up’ which are due for release later this year. 

She is currently undergoing Meisner training at the Salon Collective. Camila’s passion for co-producing and starring in ‘Just Saying...’ as Latin-American ‘Bea’ has been fueled by her enriching and hilarious London flat share experiences. 

She also wanted to bring a lively Brazilian role to life as this is something that has been missing from the current portrayal of Latinas in film and television. There is a huge Brazilian community in the UK and America that are not represented and Camila hopes to shake things up a bit by bringing some Brazilian flavoUr into this fun-filled British series. 

As a bisexual actor, Camila is very excited to announce that Bea’s bisexuality will be showcased in the series which is a great step forward towards inclusion. 

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP US

This is the part where you come in. If you want us to keep entertaining you with our relatable fun-filled flat shenanigans, GET INVOLVED! 

How to get involved? SIMPLE! You can donate as little as £5 to help keep this exciting webseries alive and running! That's it. Of course, all the generous souls and creatives out there, feel free to donate as much as your soul desires, we are deeply grateful. But rest assured, £5 already goes a long way!

 

WHERE YOUR INVESTMENT WILL GO

Everything we receive will be invested towards the shoot, paying our amazing Crew and Cast, securing locations, and making sure we keep on going to tell our story through a full season!

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We totally get it, investing in something can seem big so, if you don't feel like you can invest financially in this project and if you still want to help, we would love it if you could share this campaign with your friends and family.

story:
About the team

Fat Lucy Films began as a cohort group of professional, student and aspiring film makers as part of the Detroit 48 Hour Film Project. Since then, it has branched out through the midwest, including creators from several major metropolitan areas.  Members of the Fat Lucy Films team have pooled their award-winning experiences from music videos, documentary and short films to help each members visions become a reality.  Now Fat Lucy Films embarks on it's most ambitious project to date - an ongoing series.   The crew of The Adventures of Pammy Van Patton is ever-growing, but here is some info about  it's creator, producers and star:

Jennifer Gentner, creator, executive producer, writer

Jen, much like Pammy, is a dreamer. Since she was a little girl she has loved film and television. Her dream of becoming a filmmaker has come true. Jen has been creating short films and music videos over the last decade, but this is her first shot at a comedic series. Pammy Van Patton has been a character that has been floating around in Jen’s head for about 6 years and she decided it was time to share her with the rest of the world. She was very happy to hear the other members of Fat Lucy Films were interested in getting Pammy out there for everyone to see as well. When she isn’t making shorts, Jen enjoys photography, reading graphic novels, scrapbooking, searching for old plastic cameras, and collecting Samuel L. Jackson toys. She has two kids, Gaby and Hayden, 2 dogs, 5 cats (one of which the production company was named after), 2 fish, and 1 fiancé.

Alyse Paquin, Producer

Alyse Paquin has been a part of the local independent film scene in Michigan for several years. She is super excited to be working on a project that just might not involve blood, for once. Comedy and well-developed stories are her passion, and Pammy is the best of both. “When Jen told us about this idea I was immediately on board. I’m so excited to see her vision come to life.”

Gabry Faraj, actor - Pammy Van Patton

Gabry Faraj comes from the prestigious background 'the drama teacher's kid' and embraced life on the stage and independent film projects, until she left Michigan to travel the world. Other than a brief stint of pub theater on the Emerald Isle and local short film projects in Michigan, this is Gabry's return to the screen in a lead role for the first time in four years, which she has embraced with much enthusiasm and excitement. Gabry's hobbies include soccer, cuddling her dog, calligraphy, and exploring. "I had seen her act in plays years before, and I remember her being really funny.  As soon as she auditioned there, it was unanimous that she was right for the role." said Alyse. "She basically is Pammy" added Jen laughing.

What We Need & What You Get

Making an ongoing series is an expensive venture. We are setting our fundraising goal at $8,000 (but we're happy to raise even more).  Donations to our campaign will help to off-set costs such as costumes, props, make-up, locations, and to feed our passionate cast and crew. 

As a thank you for your generous donation, perks include social media or in-credit shout-outs, authentic series props, exclusive behind-the-scenes content, extra on-screen parts in an episode(s)  ofThe Adventures of Pammy Van Patton and even spending a day with Pammy Van Patton herself.

The Impact

It may sound cliche, but The Adventures of Pammy Van Patton truly is a passion project for the cast and crew involved.  It has been the brain-child of series creator Jennifer Gentner for several years.  With the right creators, cast and crew in place, we feel now is the time bring this project to the light of day, unleash it upon the world and generate as many laughs as we can.

 

Risks & Challenges

As a passion project, everything is currently self-funded by the producers, but with your help, we will be able to produce a high-quality light-hearted show, culminating with a full-blown children's beauty pageant. 

The money raised by this campaign will go directly towards costs with the three biggest being:

  • Food 
    • Craft Services and Meals for our cast and crew.
    • All of our cast and crew are donating their time and we want to be able to be able to feed them well.  
  • Costuming
    • because this is a beauty pageant, we will be dressing both Pammy as well as 5-10 girls in the most full-blown, decked-out, pageant attire possible. Without your help this is going to be quite a challenge.
  • Locations
    • We will need several specific locations, your money will go towards rental fees.

     

    Both Jennifer and Alyse have produced high quality award-winning films in the past, many of which were also micro-budget. We are confident that our team can pull this off, but your financial support will make it easier. Help us to finish production within our deadlines, which culminate in a fall release of the show. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand not everyone can contribute financially, but you can still help support Pammy by:

    • Tell your friends about Pammy.   Like, share, comment about and follow The Adventures of Pammy Van Patton through social media
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our fundraising campaign.
    • From now until May 14th we are also running a Thunderclap campaign to promote this indiegogo. Please help us amplyfy our message by signing up for the Thinderclap and sharing with friends. https://www.thunderclap.it/projects/69610-pammy...

Jen, much like Pammy, is a dreamer. Since she was a little girl she has loved film and television. Her dream of becoming a filmmaker has come true. Jen has been creating short films and music videos over the last decade, but this is her first shot at a comedic series. Pammy Van Patton has been a character that has been floating around in Jen’s head for about 6 years and she decided it was time to share her with the rest of the world. She was very happy to hear the other members of Fat Lucy Films were interested in getting Pammy out there for everyone to see as well. When she isn’t making shorts, Jen enjoys photography, reading graphic novels, scrapbooking, searching for old plastic cameras, and collecting Samuel L. Jackson toys. She has two kids, Gaby and Hayden, 2 dogs, 5 cats (one of which the production company was named after), 2 fish, and 1 fiancé.
Alyse Paquin, Producer
Alyse Paquin has been a part of the local independent film scene in Michigan for several years. She is super excited to be working on a project that just might not involve blood, for once. Comedy and well-developed stories are her passion, and Pammy is the best of both. “When Jen told us about this idea I was immediately on board. I’m so excited to see her vision come to life.”
Gabry Faraj, actor - Pammy Van Patton
Gabry Faraj comes from the prestigious background 'the drama teacher's kid' and embraced life on the stage and independent film projects, until she left Michigan to travel the world. Other than a brief stint of pub theater on the Emerald Isle and local short film projects in Michigan, this is Gabry's return to the screen in a lead role for the first time in four years, which she has embraced with much enthusiasm and excitement. Gabry's hobbies include soccer, cuddling her dog, calligraphy, and exploring. "I had seen her act in plays years before, and I remember her being really funny.  As soon as she auditioned there, it was unanimous that she was right for the role." said Alyse. "She basically is Pammy" added Jen laughing.

What We Need & What You Get
Making an ongoing series is an expensive venture. We are setting our fundraising goal at $8,000 (but we're happy to raise even more).  Donations to our campaign will help to off-set costs such as costumes, props, make-up, locations, and to feed our passionate cast and crew. 
As a thank you for your generous donation, perks include social media or in-credit shout-outs, authentic series props, exclusive behind-the-scenes content, extra on-screen parts in an episode(s)  ofThe Adventures of Pammy Van Patton and even spending a day with Pammy Van Patton herself.

The Impact
It may sound cliche, but The Adventures of Pammy Van Patton truly is a passion project for the cast and crew involved.  It has been the brain-child of series creator Jennifer Gentner for several years.  With the right creators, cast and crew in place, we feel now is the time bring this project to the light of day, unleash it upon the world and generate as many laughs as we can.
 

Risks & Challenges

As a passion project, everything is currently self-funded by the producers, but with your help, we will be able to produce a high-quality light-hearted show, culminating with a full-blown children's beauty pageant. 
The money raised by this campaign will go directly towards costs with the three biggest being:

Food 
Craft Services and Meals for our cast and crew.
All of our cast and crew are donating their time and we want to be able to be able to feed them well.  


Costumingbecause this is a beauty pageant, we will be dressing both Pammy as well as 5-10 girls in the most full-blown, decked-out, pageant attire possible. Without your help this is going to be quite a challenge.

LocationsWe will need several specific locations, your money will go towards rental fees.




 
Both Jennifer and Alyse have produced high quality award-winning films in the past, many of which were also micro-budget. We are confident that our team can pull this off, but your financial support will make it easier. Help us to finish production within our deadlines, which culminate in a fall release of the show. 

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand not everyone can contribute financially, but you can still help support Pammy by:

Tell your friends about Pammy.   Like, share, comment about and follow The Adventures of Pammy Van Patton through social media
Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our fundraising campaign.
From now until May 14th we are also running a Thunderclap campaign to promote this indiegogo. Please help us amplyfy our message by signing up for the Thinderclap and sharing with friends. https://www.thunderclap.it/projects/69610-pammy...

story:
Hello! Hey! What's up?

We are Broken Coconuts Productions. A team of comedy loving, self-starting Ryerson University students eager to create something original that boasts Toronto's unique, talented and flourishing comedy scene. Oh ya... and we want it to be *bleep*ing funny.

BleepingFunny 30 minute sketch comedy pilot that consists of five sketches, showcases comedians from across Canada and will be hosted by a local stand-up comedian. The final show will be shot in front of a live studio audience and will pieced together to create a kick*bleep* pilot that will be accessible on a digital platform.

We embarked on production in January, have spent the last 9 months to development and will move into production this fall. In order to make this project come to life we need your help.

Each sketch and the final live studio taping is its own separate production with its own sets, props, costumes, cast and craft services. It's not one production, it's six.

What We Need & What You Get

So order to cover the costs of our production we need to raise $6000. This money will be put towards for things like equipment, transportation, set design, costumes, hair & make up, props and craft services.

We appreciate every penny you are able to donate and we have a few things lined up as our way of saying thanks to all you generous donors.

It Ain't Easy

As full time students juggling school, work, internships and the production of a pilot episode, *bleep* gets tricky. On top of all that, every member of this team has volunteered their time and energy, putting 110% effort and working our *bleep*ing butts because we believe in the success of the show.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate, come out and support the final step of our production, the taping of our LIVE SHOW on November 10th 2018. Check out our Instagram and Facebook @bleepingfunny for updates on our show, details about our fundraisers and a whole *bleep* load of memes.

The Extra Funds

All addition funds raised from our Indiegogo campaign will be donated to Sickkids Foundation. Our mission is to make people laugh and if we can, we want to help those who have a harder time being able to embrace and enjoy life's sillyness.

story:
9 SHORT FILMS . 7 EPISODES . 1 MAIN NARRATIVE

THIS IS

PENNYVILLE is a descent into a world of Greek tragedy, Lovecraftian horror, and psychological drama. Poetic, mythical and unrelenting.

To some, the remains of the desolate hospital have become a fetishist shrine to commemorate the victims. To others - occultists in particular - it is an entrance into another world. A grotesque world.

It marks thirty years since a devastating fire killed all the patients and vast majority of the staff at the notorious Pennyville psychiatric hospital. Amongst the patients that perished in the fire was the birth mother of Emily Barker; a young woman struggling to confront her own mental issues who has succumbed to addiction. The recent birth of her daughter has prompted Emily to take a retrospective look into her enigmatic past. Following an investigation into Pennyville, she stumbles upon the asylum's old caretaker: the eerie Jeremy Hobbs. An uneasy alliance will form as Jeremy recounts not only Emily's mother's shocking story but that of the other patients as well, every last disturbing and grim detail, but can Jeremy be trusted? Will Emily discover the truth and be able to save herself or will malevolent forces break her both physically and psychologically?

Welcome to Pennyville, we hope you enjoy your stay...

​

Our Story

We founded Quint-Essential Creations in 2011, in the early days we focused primarily on producing original horror theatre that was until we moved to Spain in 2014 where our in house writer and director Eli would study filmmaking. In 2015 we shot our first short film THE TEA PARTY. THE TEA PARTY had quite an affect on the audiences who experienced it and it went on to win the award of recognition for Best Horror Short at the Hollywood International Moving Pictures Film Festival as well as being selected as a semi-finalist at the American Horror Film Festival.

"Haunted-house theatre at it's spine chilling best"

Timeout London, 2013

Since wrapping THE TEA PARTY we have wanted to push ourselves further and harder then ever before. Due to Eli's love for writing we already had four further short films written and ready to be made but we decided that instead of producing one or two a year then entering them into film festivals we wanted to do something different. We wanted to share our stories with the public in an innovative and original way, that is when the idea for PENNYVILLE was born.

Now it's 2017 and we have already shot 4 of the short films that will feature in PENNYVILLE. We have 5 more short films and the main narrative to shoot and thats where you come in...

Our primary creative goal has always been very simple; "to entertain and keep people on the edge of their seats". From the very beginning of Q-E Creations, what we have loved the most is sharing our stories with our audiences and witnessing their reactions first hand. Whether its making you jump out of your seat, retreat in fear, tear up with emotion or shudder in disgust; there is no better thrill for us then seeing how our productions engage and affect humanity. Since moving into film we have started to miss experiencing that organic reaction first hand. By entering THE TEA PARTY into festivals it meant that for a long time we have been unable to share our short film with the public. That's why we chose to create PENNYVILLE, we want to bring our stories straight to the public once more.

 

Why PENNYVILLE?

The world of PENNYVILLE holds a very sacred place in our hearts. In 2011 during the 4 week London tour of our first theatre production THE DARK TALES, the concept for PENNYVILLE was born. Inspired by the demise of the lead character from our short play BLOODY MARY; Eli went on to write a feature film THE ASYLUM (working title). It wasn't until we wrapped shooting on THE TEA PARTY that we decided to re-visit THE ASYLUM script. We knew that due to budget restrictions, making THE ASYLUM feature film was out of our reach. That's when we came up with the idea of creating a web series. To shoot individual short films, which would link together with one main narrative to become a series became a much more effective ambition for us. It wasn't long before we realised we had a very unique project in our hands. After creating the web series, our goal will be to make the PENNYVILLE (THE ASYLUM) feature film, a prequel to the web series. The world of PENNYVILLE is now 6 years in the making, now we invite you to become a part of it's history. 

By joining us on this journey not only will you contribute towards the completion of the series, you will play a key role in helping us achieve our primary creative goal! Your contribution will become part of our domino affect in spreading the word about PENNYVILLE, bringing more and more people into our world, creating a bigger and wider audience, reaching the public further and further afield so that once the series is complete we can share our stories with as many members of society as possible. We want you to welcome you to PENNYVILLE, let us entertain you!

Breaking it down...

Our £20,000 target will cover the production and post production costs for the final 5 short films and the main narrative. Below you can see how the funds will be distributed. 

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will still do everything in our power to insure PENNYVILLE is made and seen. We believe that we have a very unique project and we will not stop until we can share it with you. 

Perk Up!

QUIRKY PERKS: We have many unique perks to share with you. Each week there will be something different from each of the short films and the main narrative up for grabs. These quirky perks range from our beloved Tea Party dolls to the sinister Appieorth pop up book. Each prop/item will be delivered along with a personalised message from the actor who used it.

PENNYVILLE ARTWORK: We are creating unique individual posters for each short film that will feature in PENNYVILLE. We will be offering 4 limited edition copies of each poster, signed by the cast and crew who worked on that film with a personalised message on the back. Later on in our campaign we will also have 4 limited edition copies of the official PENNYVILLE poster up for grabs! Watch this space...

We have lots of other exciting perks as well, from tickets to one of our secret screenings where you will be among the first to experience the first four episodes of PENNYVILLE and afterwards have the opportunity to meet with the cast and crew, to being cast in one of our short films as a featured extra; that's right you will be given lines to perform, to Eli's director's script and many more. So keep your eyes peeled throughout the entire campaign for new and exciting updates on the perks! 

MEET THE CREW

We have an absolutely incredible core team onboard for PENNYVILLE and we consider ourselves extremely lucky to have worked with some amazing actors and crew members on all of the short films we have shot so far. We are raring to shoot the next short film and we are always looking for new people to collaborate with; so if your interested in become part of the PENNYVILLE team drop us an email at quint-essential@live.co.uk  

OUR CAST SO FAR...

We have been completely overwhelmed by the amount of wonderful actors who have already applied for roles within PENNYVILLE. Each and every actor we have worked with so far has taken the characters to such amazing heights, bringing the dark and twisted world of PENNYVILLE to life. We would like to introduce you to some of the wonderful actors we have had the pleasure of working with so far.

FUTURE CASTING: We will soon be casting in both the UK and Barcelona for various future PENNYVILLE roles. If you're an actor and keen to get involved be sure to keep your eyes peeled for information about our castings which will be taking place very soon. Even if you're not an actor perhaps you know someone who is? If so, then please tell them about us!

Thank you

Before we leave you to digest the world of PENNYVILLE we just want to thank you for taking the time to look at our page, we hope you'll be with us every step of the way .

Just by sharing our project on social media or telling your family, friends, work colleagues or even the person you sit next to on the bus will help us. We want to invite as many people into the world of  PENNYVILLE as possible and we can only do that with your help.

WELCOME TO PENNYVILLE

WE HOPE YOU ENJOY YOUR STAY...

story:
Short Summary

"Le Band" was originally conceived as a short film, made in 2013 as a university project. I co-wrote the screenplay for said film and starred as Nigel Fury, the wannabe British punk rocker. Recently I decided to adapt and continue the story of the short film as a seven episode web series. "Le Band" has been a personal passion project for myself and the rest of the cast for years, and we can't wait to bring it to your screens! Check out the original film here: vimeo.com/gazio/leband

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise funds to pay for catering, locations and possible hotel for cast and crew. If we raise significant funds, we can pay for state-of-the-art equipment and make sure the crew are compensated well for their time and talents. We have several really fun rewards, but the main thing you get is the opportunity to watch a great, funny, and heartfelt sitcom that will be free to all. There will be no lengthy pitching process to networks or streaming services, leading you to wonder "Whatever happened to that project I donated to?" The show will be on YouTube within the year. The more funds we have, the faster we can make it happen, and the better the end result will be.

Risks & Challenges

Filmmaking is inherently difficult. Finding a reliable crew, securing locations, and even catering can all be immense challenges. There is always a chance that we may have to rewrite parts of the scripts if certain doors become closed to us. If that should happen, we will adapt. The more money we can raise through this campaign, the more flexible we can be in how we make the series. I have been a part of a number of film projects in the past, and problems always arise. We just have to be creative enough to work through them. I have a track record for always getting the job done, no matter what.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, share this campaign on Facebook! Tweet about us! Send an email to your friends and family! If you can't afford to donate, that's fine. But do everything you can to spread the word! We're counting on you to make this show a reality!

story:
The Hal Roach Documentary

The Hal Roach Story is an intimate portrait of the legendary mogul and his stars, including Laurel and Hardy & The Little Rascals.

 

 

Summary 

At the turn of the last century, veteran filmmaker Hal Roach moved to Hollywood in search of becoming an actor. By the early 1920’s, Roach found his real calling as a producer and opened the Hal Roach Studios. Roach is featured in the film clip below talking about the early days of Roach Studios, the excerpt taken from a documentary we produced in the late 1980's, hosted by Lauren Bacall.

Over the next three decades, Roach created some of the motion picture industry’s most famous stars. His stable of talent included Laurel and Hardy, Our Gang and the Little Rascals (see clip below). The feature films he produced included such legendary titles as Topper and the original 1 Million BC.

 

The Hal Roach Story features  film clips representing his entire career as well as a number of interviews, including Mr. Roach himself, taken from two interviews with him shot back in 1983. This is an intimate portrait of one of Hollywood’s most successful moguls.  It is the story of how he created his studio, nurtured his legendary talent and even navigated some of Hollywood's darkest scandals, including the Thelma Todd death, seen in the following film clip.

 

 

WHAT WE WILL ACCOMPLISH

we are producing a feature-length documentary that explores the life and career of Hal Roach. Our goal is to get enough pre-orders to cover our remaining post-production costs..

About the Producers

Marc Wanamaker and James Forsher began working on Hollywood projects back in the early 1980's and co-produced the  1984 feature documentary Ticket to Hollywood, hosted by Jackie Cooper. During the production of this show they interviewed Hal Roach twice and have always wanted to make a documentary  focusing on Mr. Roach's story.

Marc Wanamaker  

Marc Wanamaker is a world-class expert and consultant in film history who has worked in many facets of film production, exhibition, and research for several decades. He holds degrees in theater arts, music and history. He has extensive administration experience with the American Film Institute and is a published historian, lecturer, and teacher who taught film history at UCLA Extension for five years.

After co producing musical concerts and film expositions, he assisted in forming the American Film Institute facilities in Beverly Hills in 1969. He had been an AFI staff member for seven years when he began to produce-direct and consult on documentaries related to the history of the motion picture industry. He engaged in many areas of study while he focused on writing the Encyclopedia of Motion Picture Studios in the United States.

Wanamaker is a founder of the Los Angeles International Film Exposition, known as FILMEX, founded in 1971, and was involved in forming The American Cinematheque. His vast experience co-producing film festivals and expositions led to a position as program consultant with the Pordenone Silent Film Conference in Italy. He has tapped into his world-class archive to produce several historical film festivals, conferences and programs.

Bison’s extensive and unique photo archive, assembled over an almost 40-year period, is used for story research, publishing, international media outlets and documentary film production and is an information source for several Bison Productions (link to http://bisonproductions.com/) film projects.

Bison Archives has consulted on more than 100 documentary films. From Hollywood: The Pioneers, a 13-hour history of Hollywood films of the silent era, to biography documentaries of Hollywood studio personalities, Marc Wanamaker has played an integral part in everything from script preparation to researching historical photographs. Bison Archives is a leading expert on art and antiques, “silent stars” in their own right that have enhanced film production values for some of the greatest motion pictures. Wanamaker with his associate Eugene Edelman is currently developing a book and an exhibition on the subject

James Forsher has been active in producing documentaries on Hollywood history for the past two decades. Documentaries like Hollywood Uncensored, Ticket to Hollywood, Hollywood Ghost Stories and the 26 part Hollywood Chronicles have aired on Discovery Channel, Cinemax, Movie Channel and Arts and Entertainment Network. In 1990 and 1991, he produced two series of interstitial “Hollywood moments” for Encore!,  Dr. Forsher received his doctorate in Urban Planning from the University of Southern California and has had a special interest investigating the effects the film industry has had on American culture.  

Forsher Film Archives...Begun in the mid 1970’s, it has grown over the course of the many Hollywood documentaries produced by Forsher Productions, and includes interviews with moguls like Adolph Zukor, Hal Roach and Republic’s Nat Levine. It features rare behind the scenes footage of Hollywood productions and American cinematic life, including movie premieres and theater.

James Forsher has a PhD from the University of Southern California in Urban Planning. His doctoral thesis  examined the importance of cinema houses on American urban development.

 

Risks and challenges

The biggest challenge is  telling the story of a legendary producer who had the good fortune of living past 100 years. We will focus on the early career, starting with his arrival in Hollywood and going through the successes of Laurel and Hardy, Little Rascals/Our Gang and the feature Topper.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
story_txt:
The Hal Roach Documentary
The Hal Roach Story is an intimate portrait of the legendary mogul and his stars, including Laurel and Hardy & The Little Rascals.
 
 
Summary 
At the turn of the last century, veteran filmmaker Hal Roach moved to Hollywood in search of becoming an actor. By the early 1920’s, Roach found his real calling as a producer and opened the Hal Roach Studios. Roach is featured in the film clip below talking about the early days of Roach Studios, the excerpt taken from a documentary we produced in the late 1980's, hosted by Lauren Bacall.
Over the next three decades, Roach created some of the motion picture industry’s most famous stars. His stable of talent included Laurel and Hardy, Our Gang and the Little Rascals (see clip below). The feature films he produced included such legendary titles as Topper and the original 1 Million BC.

 
The Hal Roach Story features  film clips representing his entire career as well as a number of interviews, including Mr. Roach himself, taken from two interviews with him shot back in 1983. This is an intimate portrait of one of Hollywood’s most successful moguls.  It is the story of how he created his studio, nurtured his legendary talent and even navigated some of Hollywood's darkest scandals, including the Thelma Todd death, seen in the following film clip.
 

 
WHAT WE WILL ACCOMPLISH
we are producing a feature-length documentary that explores the life and career of Hal Roach. Our goal is to get enough pre-orders to cover our remaining post-production costs..
About the Producers
Marc Wanamaker and James Forsher began working on Hollywood projects back in the early 1980's and co-produced the  1984 feature documentary Ticket to Hollywood, hosted by Jackie Cooper. During the production of this show they interviewed Hal Roach twice and have always wanted to make a documentary  focusing on Mr. Roach's story.
Marc Wanamaker  
Marc Wanamaker is a world-class expert and consultant in film history who has worked in many facets of film production, exhibition, and research for several decades. He holds degrees in theater arts, music and history. He has extensive administration experience with the American Film Institute and is a published historian, lecturer, and teacher who taught film history at UCLA Extension for five years.
After co producing musical concerts and film expositions, he assisted in forming the American Film Institute facilities in Beverly Hills in 1969. He had been an AFI staff member for seven years when he began to produce-direct and consult on documentaries related to the history of the motion picture industry. He engaged in many areas of study while he focused on writing the Encyclopedia of Motion Picture Studios in the United States.
Wanamaker is a founder of the Los Angeles International Film Exposition, known as FILMEX, founded in 1971, and was involved in forming The American Cinematheque. His vast experience co-producing film festivals and expositions led to a position as program consultant with the Pordenone Silent Film Conference in Italy. He has tapped into his world-class archive to produce several historical film festivals, conferences and programs.
Bison’s extensive and unique photo archive, assembled over an almost 40-year period, is used for story research, publishing, international media outlets and documentary film production and is an information source for several Bison Productions (link to http://bisonproductions.com/) film projects.

Bison Archives is a leading expert on art and antiques, “silent stars” in their own right that have enhanced film production values for some of the greatest motion pictures. Wanamaker with his associate Eugene Edelman is currently developing a book and an exhibition on the subject

Documentaries like Hollywood Uncensored, Ticket to Hollywood, Hollywood Ghost Stories and the 26 part Hollywood Chronicles have aired on Discovery Channel, Cinemax, Movie Channel and Arts and Entertainment Network. In 1990 and 1991, he produced two series of interstitial “Hollywood moments” for Encore!,  Dr. Forsher received his doctorate in Urban Planning from the University of Southern California and has had a special interest investigating the effects the film industry has had on American culture.  
Forsher Film Archives...Begun in the mid 1970’s, it has grown over the course of the many Hollywood documentaries produced by Forsher Productions, and includes interviews with moguls like Adolph Zukor, Hal Roach and Republic’s Nat Levine. It features rare behind the scenes footage of Hollywood productions and American cinematic life, including movie premieres and theater.
James Forsher has a PhD from the University of Southern California in Urban Planning. His doctoral thesis  examined the importance of cinema houses on American urban development.
 

Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge is  telling the story of a legendary producer who had the good fortune of living past 100 years. We will focus on the early career, starting with his arrival in Hollywood and going through the successes of Laurel and Hardy, Little Rascals/Our Gang and the feature Topper.

story:
Chris Hume: Animator, Agitator

Hello, I am Chris Hume. I have been creating animation to bring joy and laughter, as well as to provoke and inform.

Animation takes a great deal of time and resources - from writing to design to  animation, to voice-over to the final editing. Your support will allow me to deliver a hilarious, entertaining and original animated short.

The funding will cover expenses
- while I work as a one-man animation studio.
- to hire voice-over artists to bring life to the characters.
- to promote the episode in festivals once it is complete.

 

The world needs a super hero that everyone can relate to. A.D.D. Man is far from perfect, but he wants to do the right thing. If only he could stop multi-tasking and focus! There's a little A.D.D MAN in all of us.

Please share this campaign with your friends. Animation is nearly complete (about 89%), and anything you can give is greatly appreciated.

You will be invited to the premiere screening and your name will be included in the end credits of the newest episode.

story:
3 Minute Theology was born out of a desire to reach people where they are – in their homes, at school, and in their offices, looking at computer screens or smartphones.  It came from a desire to preach the message of Christ in a short, digestible way, right in the middle of Facebook feeds or in inboxes. We weren’t looking for people to spend hours with us. Just three minutes.

The production is fairly straightforward, because the meat of 3MT is not the set but the message. At the same time, what if we could take the same product – but add a backdrop that aids the content of that message?

What if we were answering the question “Why Rome?” while standing in the Eternal City? What if we could talk about the first Pope with the Vatican behind us? What if we could talk about the Swiss Guards in their front yard?

We can… with your help.

Why do we need you?

3MT is never going to be a multi-million dollar production on location all over the world. There is a place for that in Catholic media, but that’s not our goal with 3MT. There’s something beautiful about the simplicity of the 3MT set, and that’s not going to change anytime soon.

But, while we produce 3MT very inexpensively, and will always strive to do so, professionalism costs money. Thanks to the Bishop’s Annual Appeal, we were able to buy a better camera, lighting, and the computers we needed. But technology is always changing, and the demand to stay current is always there. We can’t sit still – we need to be learning and growing.

No matter what we expected to happen after we made that first video, one thing we never wanted to do was make mediocre media. One thing I’m really proud about is that we’ve grown as a team to really produce a great product. Going to Rome is going to stretch us. And when you look at the short history of 3MT, when the team has been stretched, great things have happened. I look to the beginning and those first couple episodes when we really didn’t know what we were doing. But we wanted to try. And we’ve come really far. The content has always been orthodox and solid, but we’ve learned so much about the process – camera work, lighting, editing, preparation for each episode. Our production process has really evolved and become tighter and better. This new endeavor is going to force us to learn a lot more about the process, about ourselves, and about making quality, Catholic media.

We want you to be part of the work of evangelization that is 3MT. We want to reach more people. 3MT was never meant just for Nashville – it was meant for the Church. But we need you to help us grow.

You’ll see on the side several levels of participation. Every gift makes a difference.

And who doesn’t want an official 3MT coffee mug?

What if we make our goal?

We want 3MT to continue to get out to people! And that depends on you. If we reach our goal of $10,000, we’ll be filming a series of special episodes right in the heart of the Church – on location in Rome. If we surpass our goal, there is so much more we can do! Long term goals include transcribing the episodes for the hearing-impaired and translating the videos into Spanish. But all of that requires time… and so we’re asking for your treasure.

Other ways you can help:

We also need you to help get the word out – both about the campaign, but more importantly, about 3MT! Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends and family about our goal. And don’t forget to follow us on Facebook or YouTube. 3MT is an important part of the new evangelization, but it depends on you! Share our videos – they come out every Tuesday!

www.youtube.com/3MinuteTheology

www.facebook.com/3MinuteTheology

story:
Keelyn Klein, a superhero with narcolepsy, lives in a world where Supers and Primaries (non-superheroes) are widely accepted yet finds herself on the outskirts of society due to her invisible disability. Keelyn has the power to make people dance; narcolepsy IS NOT her power! Unfortunately, few people seem to understand that narcolepsy isn’t solved by drinking coffee.

“Broad City” meets “The Incredibles” as we follow Keelyn and Lee, her Primary best friend through their day-to-day lives. Lee, always along for the ride in hopes of gaining powers herself, ultimately wants to see Keelyn succeed and help provide some much-needed support. Discover how being labeled “Super” isn’t all it’s cracked up to be and that fighting crime pales in comparison to fighting stereotypes and living up to the standard of an overachieving super-family.

What is narcolepsy?
For those of you who don't know, narcolepsy is a sleeping disorder characterized by excessive sleepiness, sleep paralysis, hallucinations, and in some cases episodes of cataplexy (partial or total loss of muscle control, often triggered by a strong emotion such as laughter). About 1 in 2,000 people have narcolepsy and only about 25% of the narcoleptic population are properly diagnosed. 


An idea is born
One of us, Sarah Albritton, has narcolepsy and isn't shy about it! While day drinking (one of our favorite summer activities), Povs made a comment about how Sarah, being sleepy all the time, would make the worst superhero ever. DING DING DING! Lightbulb goes ON! An idea is born.

We decided to create a comedic, yet relatable character with a misunderstood disorder and portray her in a realistic light. Narcolepsy, to the best of our knowledge, has not been done realistically on television or in films! By having someone who has narcolepsy heavily involved in the creative process and playing the role, we plan to rectify that issue. Additionally, we hope this will bring awareness to this disorder which is highly misdiagnosed. 

Let’s introduce us! We are Sarah Albritton and Catherine “Povs” Povinelli. We’re comedians and friends who met on the Chicago scene and have embarked on this crazy-fun journey to bring narcolepsy awareness through our comedic web series Super Narcoleptic Girl. We've cultivated this baby from a drunken idea to written scripts to a full-fledged web series production. Our characters are (very)  loosely based on ourselves and Keelyn and Lee's friendship mirrors our own.

 

Keelyn Klein aka Super Narcoleptic Girl - Sarah Albritton

Though Keelyn’s Super name is Super Narcoleptic Girl, her power is to make people dance. Her Super name was given to her by mistake and she’s unable to change it, much like living with narcolepsy is out of her control. Ultimately, she doesn’t want to be defined by her disability. Creating a comedic character that brings awareness to narcolepsy, gives a voice not only to that community but to anyone who feels different, disability or not.

 

Friendlee “Lee” Snow  - Catherine “ Povs ” Povinelli

Lee is Keelyn’s quirky best friend and roommate with a lack of boundaries. Though a Primary (without powers), she is fascinated with superhero life and is constantly trying to become a Super by any means necessary. Lee constantly steals Keelyn’s uniform, medication, and food. By all counts she is a terrible roommate, but seems to be the only one Keelyn can live with. She’s the only one who really understands how narcolepsy affects Keelyn and doesn’t judge her by it. Lee is a genuine and loyal friend who would take a bullet for Keelyn...at least in a non-vital area.

A lot of people will say the industry is over-saturated with superheroes…but you know what else is over saturated? Water. And we all NEED water…just like superheroes.

Here are a few, out of many good reasons why:

  1. They’re awesome.
  2. Our lead character, Keelyn Klein, is not defined by her disability; she has the power to make people dance, that’s her POWER, not narcolepsy!  And constantly battles the stereotypes associated with her disorder. This is meant to parallel how people with narcolepsy are viewed and often misunderstood.
  3. Our world has superheroes AND primaries (non-supers). We wanted to create an atmosphere where individuals co-exist, and can constantly ask questions about one another.
  4. If Keelyn’s power is to make people dance, why is she called Super Narcoleptic Girl? You’re just going to have to watch the web series to find out!

At the end of the day, our web series is based in a fictional realm but deals with very real issues.

Our Goal: 5,000 for 10 3-5 minute episodes

Stretch Goal: $7,000

We have a team of talented, dedicated professionals who deserve a well-funded project. We're raising $5,000 to help pay for equipment rentals, locations, cast & crew members, and production costs. We’re smart and savvy with finances, so check out our pie chart because everyone loves pie:

Your contribution, regardless of amount, will be highly valued and used to create something truly unique. “Save the day, stay awake,” might be the web series’ slogan, but for donations, it’s “Save the pennies, Stay in Production.”

Even $10 goes a long way to help us reach our goal, but if you can't participate financially; you can still help us spread the word!

Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tinder (Swipe Right!), Grinder (Also Swipe Right!), eHarmoney.com, FarmersOnly.com and any other social media platform you might use! You can also get the word out to your friends and family about SUPER NARCOLEPTIC GIRL by using the Indiegogo share tools up & to the right.

If you live in Chicago or the Greater Area and want to donate a service or your time, give us a shout! Services might include but are not limited to equipment, props, food, locations, crew assistance, etc…

You can also help support narcolepsy awareness through wonderful organizations like Narcolepsy Network, National Sleep Foundation and Project Sleep. 

THANKS FOR HELPING US REACH OUR GOAL AND BRINGING NARCOLEPSY AWARENESS TO A LARGER AUDIENCE!

We started on this journey not really knowing where it would lead (a punch line here, Sarah having a cataplexy there) but the more we wrote together and realized we had something to say with Super Narcoleptic Girl, we knew there was no turning back…and the LAST thing that was going to stop us was money.

We are set to film at the end of July; which isn’t far away! Eeeeeeeep! Exciting and scary all at once!

The real challenge now is making sure we have the finances to back up our awesome show. We’re confident in our abilities to make this web series happen: Sarah has a plethora of producing experience from her shows in Chicago and Povs worked in a post-production house for…well…we won’t tell you how long!

Plus we have the creative support and involvement of the brilliant people listed below. Everyone listed is extremely talented and believes in the creation of Super Narcoleptic Girl.

Larry Ziegelman - Director
Larry Ziegelman worked in advertising for over 18 years and as an Associate Creative Director at DDB Chicago for 13 of those years. Some of his awards for his Superbowl work include a Cannes Cyber Lion, two Cannes Finalist Certificates, the Yahoo! Big Idea Award, the London International Festival, and Adweek’s Best Commercials of February.

HIs first short film, “Check Please” won the Illinois Shortcuts Competition. His short film, “You Shouldn’t Have” has played in festivals in L.A., New York, Australia and St. Louis where it won awards for Best Comedy over 15 minutes, Best Actor and Best Supporting Actress. And his latest short film, “Boom Boom” has played in the L.A. Comedy Shorts Film Festival, the Bronx International Film Festival and the New York International Film Festival to name a few.

Jon Kline - Director of Photography
Jon Kline is an American cinematographer raised in the Midwest. His award-winning work has been seen on every major television network and at film festivals around the world. Recently he has completed commercial projects for Jell-O, NFL, and Audi. His television credits include shooting for Discovery Networks, National Geographic, and A&E.

Jon’s awards include four “Best Cinematography,” six “Best Picture,” and two “Best Special Effects” awards from the 48 Hour Film Project; and awards at Filmapalooza, the Milwaukee Short Film Festival, the Twisted Dreams Film Festival, the Wildwood Film Festival, the Four Points Film Challenge, the Dusk ‘Till Dawn Film Festival, and the B-Movie Film Festival. He was visual effects supervisor on “Screen: Righter,” a comedy showing at Festival de Cannes in 2017.


Johnny Lange - Assistant Director
Johnny Lange (Columbia College ’03) is a filmmaker with years of experience working in commercial and video production and other creative projects. Most recently he worked as a 1st/2nd AD on Larry Ziegelman’s ‘Geek Lounge’ comedy web series. Johnny is the owner of Lost Child Films and is currently in post-production on two festival-ready short films.

Sarah Albritton - Co-creator, co-writer, producer and actor
Sarah Albritton is a Chicago-based standup comedian, writer and producer. Described by the Chicago Tribune as “vulnerable and honest”, Sarah’s stand-up combines observational humor and personal stories with her unique perspective on living with narcolepsy. Sarah has worked with Ralphie May and performed at the Cleveland Comedy Festival, Funny Women’s Fest LA, Broken Record Comedy Show as part of the Nashville Wild West Festival. She’s the creator/producer of Secrets, Lies & Alibis and hosts the podcast, Sleeping with Sarah.

Catherine "Povs" Povinelli - Co-Creator, co-writer, producer and actor
Catheine "Povs" Povinelli is a Chicago-based standup comedian, writer and actress. A native New Yorker who studied overseas, Catherine holds comedic credits from the Edinburgh Fringe Festival and the Camden Fringe Festival. She was a Funny Women’s New Comedian of the Year Semi-Finalist and is a founding member of the YouTube Channel The Hard Comedy. Catherine holds a Masters of Performance from the Academy of Live and Recorded Arts in London, England
