We started on this journey not really knowing where it would lead (a punch line here, Sarah having a cataplexy there) but the more we wrote together and realized we had something to say with Super Narcoleptic Girl, we knew there was no turning back…and the LAST thing that was going to stop us was money.
We are set to film at the end of July; which isn’t far away! Eeeeeeeep! Exciting and scary all at once!
The real challenge now is making sure we have the finances to back up our awesome show. We’re confident in our abilities to make this web series happen: Sarah has a plethora of producing experience from her shows in Chicago and Povs worked in a post-production house for…well…we won’t tell you how long!
Plus we have the creative support and involvement of the brilliant people listed below. Everyone listed is extremely talented and believes in the creation of Super Narcoleptic Girl.
Larry Ziegelman - DirectorLarry Ziegelman worked in advertising for over 18 years and as an Associate Creative Director at DDB Chicago for 13 of those years. Some of his awards for his Superbowl work include a Cannes Cyber Lion, two Cannes Finalist Certificates, the Yahoo! Big Idea Award, the London International Festival, and Adweek’s Best Commercials of February.
HIs first short film, “Check Please” won the Illinois Shortcuts Competition. His short film, “You Shouldn’t Have” has played in festivals in L.A., New York, Australia and St. Louis where it won awards for Best Comedy over 15 minutes, Best Actor and Best Supporting Actress. And his latest short film, “Boom Boom” has played in the L.A. Comedy Shorts Film Festival, the Bronx International Film Festival and the New York International Film Festival to name a few.
Jon Kline - Director of PhotographyJon Kline is an American cinematographer raised in the Midwest. His award-winning work has been seen on every major television network and at film festivals around the world. Recently he has completed commercial projects for Jell-O, NFL, and Audi. His television credits include shooting for Discovery Networks, National Geographic, and A&E.Jon’s awards include four “Best Cinematography,” six “Best Picture,” and two “Best Special Effects” awards from the 48 Hour Film Project; and awards at Filmapalooza, the Milwaukee Short Film Festival, the Twisted Dreams Film Festival, the Wildwood Film Festival, the Four Points Film Challenge, the Dusk ‘Till Dawn Film Festival, and the B-Movie Film Festival. He was visual effects supervisor on “Screen: Righter,” a comedy showing at Festival de Cannes in 2017.
Johnny Lange - Assistant DirectorJohnny Lange (Columbia College ’03) is a filmmaker with years of experience working in commercial and video production and other creative projects. Most recently he worked as a 1st/2nd AD on Larry Ziegelman’s ‘Geek Lounge’ comedy web series. Johnny is the owner of Lost Child Films and is currently in post-production on two festival-ready short films.
Sarah Albritton - Co-creator, co-writer, producer and actorSarah Albritton is a Chicago-based standup comedian, writer and producer. Described by the Chicago Tribune as “vulnerable and honest”, Sarah’s stand-up combines observational humor and personal stories with her unique perspective on living with narcolepsy. Sarah has worked with Ralphie May and performed at the Cleveland Comedy Festival, Funny Women’s Fest LA, Broken Record Comedy Show as part of the Nashville Wild West Festival. She’s the creator/producer of Secrets, Lies & Alibis and hosts the podcast, Sleeping with Sarah.
Catherine "Povs" Povinelli - Co-Creator, co-writer, producer and actorCatheine "Povs" Povinelli is a Chicago-based standup comedian, writer and actress. A native New Yorker who studied overseas, Catherine holds comedic credits from the Edinburgh Fringe Festival and the Camden Fringe Festival. She was a Funny Women’s New Comedian of the Year Semi-Finalist and is a founding member of the YouTube Channel The Hard Comedy. Catherine holds a Masters of Performance from the Academy of Live and Recorded Arts in London, England

story:
Short Summary

I’m award winning actor and filmmaker George Zouvelos, and I have created and written ‘Spyros Yeeros’ a hilariously funny sitcom about a traditional Greek American family of gastronomical experts led by Spyro who publicly, but reluctantly rises  to the top of New York City's restaurant scene and national renown.. Spyro was  crowned  ‘Gyro King USA’,  by Americas top food critics, as he and his family comprised of the hilarious cast of comedians and actors confront through interactions customers the modern times we live in.

Spyro only wants to make sandwiches and good food and desserts. Unlike his other family members brothers and sisters that work along with him Spyro is not interested in the traditional ways of Greek thanking; especially in his choice of finding a future non Greek wife.

The show responsibly highlights the respect for the caring differences in opinions, and from every generational, ethnic, political, religious and personal preferential societal aspect, and conscienceness, as the stories filter by the diverse customers who dine in the gyros shop, and frequent the Gyro food trucks that operate across New York City. 

We are seeking to film the pilot episodes with sizzle reel and trailers in order to bring to market through a show runner. I was able to secure initial sweat equity commitments from the actors, as we apply for the SAG Aftra low budget contractual agreement.

The show is important to us as it will demonstrate how the sons and daughters of immigrants, all with varying personalities and genders,  were able to get educated, but have all chosen to return and pursue the love and expertise of the gastronomical excellence of the Hellenic Greek family cooking That they offered to the public made with love and the best ingredients.

The funds will be utilized for legal, actual  production, post production, including sound color and scene editing. Additionally, hair make up and props, in addition to travel, lodging, food, refreshments, equipment, wardrobe, coronavirus Coordinator, festivals, advertising, and every aspect to  be fully compliant with the SAG agreement.

All the funds raised here will be to secure this production for as far as we can take it. If we are blessed to have the funds that we need as described below being 85,000 to operate without any further fundraising for the initial filming. In the alternative, $50,000 and then we will have to focus on additional fundraising to reach our goal.

In life nothing is a guaranteed, however through extensive outreach, and the presentation of the treatment to industry experts, in addition to the comedians and actors who have agreed to work on the sweat equity we believe we have more than a decent chance of succeeding with production, post production and publishing to sell for distribution. If you have any questions or comments please do not hesitate to contact me as we are fully transparent seeking only to provide entertainment that is responsible and is able to highlight today’s diverse and very difficult social environments in our nation. 

Thank you, and my warmest regards,

GEORGE ZOUVELOS

story:
Prologue

Growing up as a Filipino-American male, you get asked two questions at family functions: "How's school?" and "Who's your girlfriend now?" It was probably meant to be cute small talk but my young male brain took this very seriously. I didn't want to be a fraud so I NEEDED to have an impressive girlfriend! I didn't actually get a girlfriend until college and that  was quite the roller coaster with high highs and low lows. When it ended, I didn't know who I was. I was lonely and my self-esteem took a hit. So I spent a few years reading self-help articles and trying to find my confidence. One day I read an article that said "to be confident, make confident decisions." "Of course!" I thought, "Confident men don't spend time sulking in their apartment. Confident men are out there being f*ckboys"

My name is Chris Paul Morales and I'm a New York based Actor and Producer. "Fuggboi Dave" is my fourth venture as a producer. This series (inspired by real life events) is meant to explore the effects of toxic relationships and toxic masculinity through an Asian-American lens. The personal experiences that inspired this series were lonely and confusing. The more I spoke about it with others, the more I realized I wasn't alone. If this series can make one person feel like they are not alone, then I would've accomplished exactly what I set out to do.

 

The Team (So Far)!

Currently, I've been so fortunate to find and team up with some amazingly talented people! So far the creative team includes:

  • Nicole Leier, Director (Award-winning Actor, Producer and Director)
  • Naftalie Vader, Writer (Award-winning Writer from the Netherlands)
  • Britain Lonie, Director of Photography

 

The Goal

To bring this story to life we need some help raising funds because filmmaking is expensive! We set a goal for $11,000 and every single cent will go towards the following:

  • Crew Pay & Meals​ (Crew members include: Director, Assistant Director, Director of Photography, Camera Department, Sound, Grip & Electric, Gaffer, Script Supervisor, COVID Compliance Officer, Hair & Makeup, Wardrobe, Set Design, DIT, PAs, etc.!) 
  • Cast Pay & Meals
  • Equipment Rental
  • Locations
  • Transportation
  • Post Production Costs (Include: Editing, Color Correction & Grading, Sound Production, etc.)
  • Insurance
  • Distribution
  • COVID COMPLIANCE: This one is a big one. Creating films in the time of an pandemic is certainly a game changer and COVID Compliance can easily double a film's budget! COVID Compliance includes frequent screening, testing, PPE, Hand Sanitizer, Disinfectants, a COVID Compliance officer and anything else that will keep the cast and crew safe during production. Safety is always #1 no matter what!

 

Perks!


I'm appreciative for every single donation (no matter how much!) and to show my appreciation I'm offering some perks!

  • Thank you! - $1 or above
  • Social Media shoutout - $10 or above
  • Custom Fuggboi Pickup Line - $25 Contribution or above
  • Signed Production Stills - $50 Contribution or above
  • Personalized Video - $75 or above
  • Personalized Video & Song - $100 or above
  • Special Thanks in Credits - $500 Contribution or above
  • Associate Producer - $1000 Contribution or above
  • Executive Producer - $5000 Contribution or above

 

Risks & Challenges

It was risky when I decided to quit my job and become an actor. It was risky when I decided to move out of my parent's place. This time is no different. It's always risky starting a new artistic endeavor and for some reason I seem to always put myself in challenging situations. It's not easy to make a film and yet here I am for the 4th time. The one thing I do know, is that each time I do it, it's better than the last! (That's what she...)
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm truly grateful if you've made it to this page and even read just a little bit of what I'm trying to accomplish here. Times are hard so it's understandable if you cannot contribute monetarily! If this series is something you believe in as well, you can still help by sharing this page and telling your friends about it! That seriously helps more than you know!

story:
A Cell Phone Symphony: Pilot Episode

Hello, I'm Michael Johnson a New York Film Academy student in my final semester, after serving in the US Army I came to NYFA to follow my dream of being a film maker, now that the learning part is almost over i'm getting ready to close the book on that chapter of my life.

This campaign is very important to me because I've dedicated the last few years of my life just to reach this moment, it comes full circle with everything i've learned as a student. Film making is no easy task but neither is anything else in life so I hope to inspire someone to follow their dreams no matter how impossible it seems.

With the donations and support from you and others, I'll be able to tell a funny story that will take people away from the work for just a few minutes, and if all goes well I can continue telling more stories after this project. 

What We Need

$1,000, this money will go towards

  • Set Design, to create a full vibrate world for you to see surrounding the actors.
  • Location fee and permits, because in LA you can't shoot anything without the proper paper work.
  • Feeding Cast and Crew, to give a great performance everyone will need their energy.
  • If we're unable to reach our goal the film will be shot anyway but the script will have to change to fit the budget.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, share the link and tell a friend. Copy the link share it on any online plateform or in a text message.

story:
Short Summary

  • Loose Authority is a short film about a detective who gets the job done by quoting movies.
  • The short film won best film at the Scottsdale Film Festival and best comedy at the Los Angeles Film Awards
  • We are in the process of making a television pilot to pitch to major networks so we can make it a television show or web series

What We Need & What You Get

  • We want to pay our cast and crew and feed them well.
  • We want to rent out the best locations and equipment to do right by our audience

The Impact

  • Theme of the film: take your work seriously, but not yourself. Have fun in life. LOOSEN UP!
  • We want to make you, the audience, laugh hysterically.
  • Support Arizona film!

Risks & Challenges

  • College tuition and student loan debt
  • Trying to avoid this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jfZU3ckGi4Q

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Watch the short on our facebook page @ https://www.facebook.com/looseauthority

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Why Queen's English Exists:

Queen’s English is a gay web series about some messy queens just trying to make it to adulthood in one piece—with some money left over for Sunday mimosas.
 
Written and created by Tyler Dwiggins, Queen’s English follows Gabe, a wayward twink whose Catholic boyfriend just dumped him for Jesus; Tucker, who definitely just locked himself out of the apartment—in full drag; and Olivia, an actress who will probably become a star just after she cleans the ketchup off her shoes. Think Girls or Insecure got thrown in a blender with a splash of Fireball whiskey and a handful of glitter.

In spite of so much progress, gay characters on TV still often slot into very stereotypical categories: a wacky sidekick, a tragic hero, a sexy diversity quota. We are not sidekicks. We are the main characters of our own hilarious stories. And those stories are universal. 

Queen’s English focuses on LGBT characters, but it’s really about the landmine in between childhood and adulthood. The main characters struggle with love, lust, and an empty checking account – just like you!
 

Why We Need Your Help:

Simply put, we need your help to film the rest of the episodes in season one! We are so proud of the work we’ve done so far, and we want to continue telling this story.

We could not have created this project without the hard work of our cast and crew who have worked for free because they believe in the project. In order to keep Queen’s English in motion, we need your support.

Budget Items Breakdown:

  • Cast & Crew
  • Camera Equipment
  • Lighting Equipment
  • Sound Equipment
  • Craft Services
  • Wardrobe & Properties
  • Production Design
  • Venue Sourcing
  • Post-Production
  • Publicity/Marketing Costs

Thank you for visiting our Indiegogo page. No donation is too small! On behalf of the QE cast and crew, we are so grateful for any support you can offer.

Stream & Share.

Follow us on our journey to Queendom on Facebook, Twitter, & Instagram. #QueensEnglishSeries

story:
O Hai!

My name is Juliet Johnston aka (Sparky)
And I've been making fursuits for the past seven years.
You can check out my website here for more info on that!

Anyway! Are you looking for EXPERT tutorial videos on how to make your very own AMAZING fursuits?
"cups mouth and yells (HELL YEAH) like it came from someone else"
Then 'O' boy are you in for a treat!
I'm really excited about making a ten part tutorial series on fursuit building, from patterns, trimming fur, digigrade legs, moving jaws and foam carving! It'll all be here to make getting into fursuit building an easier, less daunting process for those just starting out.
Even experienced builders may find new tricks and tips along the way!
Each episode will be around half an hour so the whole series will be at least five hours long, if not, definitely more! (I often get carried away hehe)

Making your own fursuit is a great way of getting into and experiencing the furry fandom, especially if you're on a budget. It's super fun to learn something new and see your progress get better and better with each new project!
(Not to mention the bragging rights when people ask you, who made your suit?!)
 

What We Need & What You Get =D

I'll be needing $7000USD to make this series as I'm going to take a whole month off my normal fursuit making work and focus only on this series. I'll have my friend and helper, Maria, working on this project too, so will be funding her wages during this time also.

For this fundraiser's running time only you can get this whole series for $35USD
After the series is made I'll be selling it retail for $50USD, that's a whole 30% discount off for you right now PLUS I'll be added all my backers name or "nickname" in the credits and do a lil special dance for you all as a big thank you! 
 

Challenges & Goals!

I've always loved making videos but with all my current work it's been really hard to find time to make high quality tutorials, I've been skimming by with a few "how to" videos on my YouTube channel WarningSparkyBites but they have been low budget and not very well thought out, even though I get many comments from fans saying they love them, I know I can do so much better for you guys!
 

Spread the bird! I mean word...

Even if you can't contribute this time around you can still help out greatly!!!
By spreading the word, retweeting, sharing and harassing yo friends who may be interested!
You can use the Indiegogo share tools too!
 

And that's all there is to it, so what ARRrrrrrrr ya waiting for! =D
Get all up in it!

Your friendly neighbourhood suit maker,
~Sparky

Are you looking for EXPERT tutorial videos on how to make your very own AMAZING fursuits?"cups mouth and yells (HELL YEAH) like it came from someone else"Then 'O' boy are you in for a treat!I'm really excited about making a ten part tutorial series on fursuit building, from patterns, trimming fur, digigrade legs, moving jaws and foam carving! It'll all be here to make getting into fursuit building an easier, less daunting process for those just starting out.Even experienced builders may find new tricks and tips along the way!Each episode will be around half an hour so the whole series will be at least five hours long, if not, definitely more! (I often get carried away hehe)Making your own fursuit is a great way of getting into and experiencing the furry fandom, especially if you're on a budget. It's super fun to learn something new and see your progress get better and better with each new project!(Not to mention the bragging rights when people ask you, who made your suit?!) 

What We Need & What You Get =D
I'll be needing $7000USD to make this series as I'm going to take a whole month off my normal fursuit making work and focus only on this series. I'll have my friend and helper, Maria, working on this project too, so will be funding her wages during this time also.For this fundraiser's running time only you can get this whole series for $35USDAfter the series is made I'll be selling it retail for $50USD, that's a whole 30% discount off for you right now PLUS I'll be added all my backers name or "nickname" in the credits and do a lil special dance for you all as a big thank you!  

Challenges & Goals!
I've always loved making videos but with all my current work it's been really hard to find time to make high quality tutorials, I've been skimming by with a few "how to" videos on my YouTube channel WarningSparkyBites but they have been low budget and not very well thought out, even though I get many comments from fans saying they love them, I know I can do so much better for you guys! 

Spread the bird! I mean word...
Even if you can't contribute this time around you can still help out greatly!!!By spreading the word, retweeting, sharing and harassing yo friends who may be interested!You can use the Indiegogo share tools too! 
And that's all there is to it, so what ARRrrrrrrr ya waiting for! =DGet all up in it!Your friendly neighbourhood suit maker,~Sparky

story:
THE STORY: Jesus dies on the cross with two thieves. They embark on a magical world of  horror and a mystical journey into Hades...  

In Hades, Jesus meets creatures along the way. Both friends and foes. 

Jesus has to conquer dark lands, and gain the Keys of Death in order to rise up from the grave on Earth's third day.

SEASON ONE is already STREAMING.  With over 2.1 million views and counting.  

Now, it's time to bring on LIGHT: SEASON 2

It's a new one minute TV show that displays it's a characters in story book like view.

LIGHT, "Jesus and the Adventures of Hades"  SEASON 2 will be light-hearted story about Jesus' journey thru the Deserts of Hades.   Where He meets strange creatures, monsters, aliens, while joining teams with Noah, Moses, Sheba the Persian Queen, and King David to fight the Goons of Satan, destroy Hades, and release the souls from prison.

I've been re-working and developing this for over ten years.  Finally, it comes to light. It's time! And, with your help, we can get into producing the Second Season!

And with your help, we can up the ante on graphics, and sound. 

 

WHAT WILL (SEASON 2) SHOW LOOK LIKE?

Max Mad with a dash of Star Wars

 

Jesus as a Sword Slinging Warrior in Hades 

 

Gates that speak and have to conquer before you enter.

 

Strange beings roam the Lands

 

Strange lakes to cross

 

AN EPIC DUNE BUGGY BATTLE

 

 

Castles in Hades with their own dark kings.

Jesus has to battle dark kings to access certain grounds in Hades.

 

 

Hades at Night.  

The souls of Hades HAS A LIGHT SOURCE.  THEIR HEART. 

If that light source were to fade away, they die a second death.  

Foes, souls, and creatures die a second death once their light has been taken away.  Either from a spell, total darkness, a sword to the heart, or by a laser rifle. 

 

Then an epic battle scene

Jesus fights the resistance.

 

Jesus than saves the souls

 

 

 

Jesus gains the Keys of Death after defeating the Dark King Zeus.

 

FINALLY! Next foe, Satan...

 

The Budget

$23,000 - FILMING THE SECOND SEASON  | TWELVE - ONE MINUTE EPISODES

EIGHT WEEKS OF FILMING:

  • $1900 Cinematographer.
  • $2400 Director.
  • 250 Production assistant. 
  • 2500 Sound person. (IMPORTANT)
  • $1250 For Red Camera Package.
  • $700 for Second Lead Actor.
  • $450 for third actor.
  • $450 for fourth actor.
  • Lead actor - FREE - its going to be me!
  • $150 a day for food -- total: 1050
  • $1000 for permits, insurance.
  • $2500 Kick Butt - editor.
  • $5500 Special Effects Person.
  • $1500 Sound Production.
  • $1050 Color Correction, Music, Sound Design
  • $500 Misc Explosives (To possible bail our director out of jail.  Just kidding!). Weird stuff happens while on set!

 

 

OUR hope is to have Seven Seasons.  

The last season,  Jesus destroys earth,  and creates a new Earth and Universe right before our very eyes!  

The new Earth is the size of our old universe. How in the world would God be able to fit all those people on one planet from the beginning of time?

 

The Final Season 7, Last Episode, we will see what it's like to live on a planet that size.

Mountains the size of Galaxies.  Oceans the size of Quasars.   Our moons, in the trillions.  

Imagine looking out into the night sky, and instead of seeing the past, you see the future!  New stars forming before our very eyes.  

And every soul can travel into deep space by a blink of an eye.  They're pure light.

That's going to be our new Earth!

Our New Heaven!

 

 

What You Get for Helping

We appreciate every cent contributed to this project.  So, we want to give back something in return.  Please be sure to check out the perks.

 

Your Impact

We want to  reach people in ways the church has never done before.  To teach Jesus without re-writing the book, but using a little imagination.

 

Risks & Challenges 

 

All Production comes with all risk and challenges.  

That's why I'm only surrounding myself with the best team.   Although they have many years in the industry, they are privately independent themselves.

 

Darryl Marshak (Producer) IMDB

Darryl Marshak was an agent for over 25 years.  His clients; Leonardo DiCaprio, James Franco, Farrah Fawcett, Pam Grier, Roger Daltrey of the Who, William Shatner, Scott Baio, Leah Remini, and many more!  He now produces movies.

 

Christine Owens (Producer) IMDB

Christine Owens is the best person to figure out problems.  She's a money person, and she can quickly figure out any problem.  She was the  business partner for Gary Shusett's Film School, Sherwood Oaks College, and is a writer and producer.  Gary has a brother named Ronald Shusett who co-wrote 'Aliens," and  "Total Recall,"

 

THANK YOU 

Pieter Wesley Whittington

story:
RACE FOR THE TOP 

RACE FOR THE TOP (#RACE4TT) is the first reality TV series that highlights the crowdfunding heroes (you), the entrepreneurs, and their businesses that rely on crowdfunding to make their dreams a reality.

The show is a collaborative effort between e360tv and our partners: award-winning production company NBTV Studios, crowdfunding community kulaBrands, and several media distributors. Featuring host Jeff Hoffman, serial entrepreneur from Priceline.com, Ubid.com, co-founder kulaBrands, and other renowned companies. We will explore the stories of the incredible people involved in the crowfunding movement, their journeys, and the unparalleled resolve it takes to succeed. It's a production with broadcast quality that rivals Shark Tank and The Profit.

Race For The Top is a view in the world of entrepreneurship lifestyle and the challenges that accompany that lifestyle. “It’s a breed of people that would rather work 80 hours for themselves than 40 hours for others”. The Race For The Top series explores start-ups before, during and after their crowdfunding campaigns. The show highlights the companies, their products and most importantly, the people. Audiences get insights of the struggles, the pull on family life and the emotional roller-coaster that accompanies the entrepreneurial lifestyle, especially when launching a new company.

 

WHAT IS THE BACKGROUND OF RACE FOR THE TOP?   

Supporting RACE FOR THE TOP is a phenomenal opportunity to help highlight the effects of crowdfunding in the success of entrepreneurs and the value that this activity has been able to create over the past eight years. RACE FOR THE TOP will showcase the effort, struggles, celebrations and the victories, for the crowdfunding entrepreneurs that you are supporting as they stake their futures on the success of their projects.  You will get an inside view of what it takes to create, run, and fulfill on a campaign's promises. This show not only highlights those that dare to dream but also, amplifies the crowdfunding movement through modern, digital media. THE MORE SUPPORT WE RECEIVE, THE MORE EPISODES WE CAN PRODUCE AND THE MORE PROJECTS WE CAN HIGHLIGHT AS THEY ARE "RACING FOR THE TOP"!

According to MIT Professor Eric von Hippel, "crowd funding is an important contributor to the democratization of innovation – the biggest paradigm shift in innovation since the Industrial Revolution."

 

FUNDING GOALS AND TIMELINE  

The funding threshold of $40,000 is our first step towards achieving our goal of breaking ground on the first episode of RACE FOR THE TOP. Normally, a production like this will cost $60,000 to hundreds of thousands of dollars to produce. However, the partners and contractors we’ve brought together for this project are putting their time and resources into the first episodes of RACE FOR THE TOP at no charge or a reduced rate because they believe in the vision and the philosophy of crowdfunding to help entrepreneurs change the world for the better.   

Upon reaching our funding goal, we will go right into our pre-production phase that will entail picking locations and the companies that will be highlighted in each episode. Shortly after, we move into the production phase that includes coordinating the companies and characters for each episode and filming the episode(s). Next, we move into post-production phase that includes editing the footage and adding interactive overlays that will bring the episodes to life! Lastly, we add to the e360tv show line-up and via social and digital advertising networks, we promote and market the show to millions.  

Our potential audience is 12-15 million!

 

The Distribution and Marketing Goals:

e360tv 

Netflix 

Amazon 

Syndication via Vice, Elite Daily 

Big play... Get this on CNBC! 

Teasers via paid social networks to gain viewership 

Target entrepreneurs, investors, business minded audiences

 

THE TEAM

 

Jeff Hoffman  

A proven CEO, worldwide motivational speaker, published author, Hollywood film producer, and a producer of a Grammy-winning jazz album. Producer of an award-winning jazz album, serial of Priceline.com, partner in kulaBrands, Inc., and founder of multiple startups. Jeff serves on the boards of companies in the US, Europe, South America, Africa, and Asia, supporting entrepreneurs and small businesses in more than 150 countries.  

 

Peter Gantner

A lifelong serial entrepreneur, outstanding inventor and business leader, featured in the Wall Street Journal, Forbes Magazine, Fortune Magazine and in every major newspaper. In 1999, Peter’s flagship company, Toy Craze got on Entrepreneur Magazine’s fastest growing companies list, with sales exceeding $16M. His marketing genius resulted in a 60 million piece McDonald’s Happy Meal promotion. Peter has developed a unique and innovative Crowdfunding platform, “kulaBrands" and is currently involved with the launch of several innovative products.  

 

Nick Buzzell  

Nick's passion to create innovative media experiences across multiple platforms led him and his partners to create the next generation media company: NBTV Studios. Since NBTV Studios inception in 2008, Nick and his team have established a rapidly growing B2B and B2C media brand that stands for quality, innovation and diversity.  

 

Jake Strasser  

Jake has written for some of the largest online publishers in the industry, including Barstool Sports, Break.com, Bleacher Report, and more. Furthermore, Jake has an extensive portfolio in TV development, having produced shows for Renegade 83 Entertainment and Magilla Entertainment.  

 

Aggie Kobrin  

Aggie is the founder and director of CEC Global Events, an event and media management company that has produced extraordinary results. She has been a creative force on several independent films and television programs that have included concept development, talent acquisition, event launches, and film and book distribution. With more than 15 years in the events industry, with projects in film and every aspect of media, she brings expertise, experience and creativity.  She has worked on dozens of very successful Crowdfunding projects (and many not so successful) and launched two Crowdfunding Portals with partners.   

 

Aaron Heimes  

Aaron is a business and project development leader that specializes in start-ups. This includes developing, testing and executing strategies in areas of marketing, sales, public relations, web design, social media and fulfillment. These strategies include identifying targets audience(s), designing sales approach, sales assets and Aaron has extensive experience with multiple sales channels inclusive of direct-to-consumer, wholesale and distribution sales. Aaron holds a Bachelors in Business Management and two MBAs in Energy and Project Management.

 

Q and A

When is the event?  

The event is Friday, October 20, 2017 thru Sunday, October 22, 2017 at the LAX Sheraton Gateway Hotel in Los Angeles, CA.

Can I bring a guest?   

All participants must purchase a ticket but the more the merrier.

Are meals included?  

Meals are not included in the purchase of a ticket.

When will the network be live?  

October 20, 2017 is the scheduled hard launch date.

How can I watch it?  

From any viewing device that is connected to the internet including, but not limited to, Android/IOS devices, PC/laptop, internet-connected TVs including Roku, Apple TV, Chromecast, and Amazon Fire.

Will you be adding programs to it on a regular basis?  

Yes, this is an ongoing process based upon audience preferences and trends.

When will the show air?  

Estimated release is December, 2017.

How can I get on the show or in the studio audience?  

If you are a company that would like to be highlighted on the program, please email us at aheimes2287@gmail.com.

What is kulaBrands and how do I join if interested?  

Check out the site at https://kulabrands.com/

What will I get out of going?  

Join us for this entertaining and informative multi-day event that will introduce you to the benefits of Modern Media and prepare you to engage with your community and the world in ways that you never dreamed of. You’ll have access to value-packed seminars, panel discussions, and opportunities to speak one-on-one with potential partners who are successful digital marketers and content producers.

When will I get my gift bag?  

Estimated delivery date is October, 2017.

 

Risks and challenges

The crew at e360tv has teamed up with NBTV Studios, kulabrands, media tech companies, content providers, paid social channels and global distribution companies to complete a team that encompasses all facets of digital media production, promotion and distribution. This project has been in the making for over a year and in that time the leadership at e360tv broke down each of the challenges of the company and teamed up those with the expertise to overcome those challenges. We feel we couldn't be any more prepared for this first huge step.

story:
Hey hi what's up it's me Adam Reines!! 

I made an Indiegogo! That's this. You're here right now reading it.

I'm 22, from New Jersey, I'm an actor, writer and barista (shocking.) So, here's a little background regarding this project. I started writing the pilot episode to this project in March of 2016. It was going well, until I put it on hiatus due to the fact that I was too depressed to write, let alone leave my bed on most days. I was that depressed when I started writing it as well, but it got worse. From 2014 to January 2017, I was on and off suicidal.

However, through hard, hard work in therapy and finding the right medication for me, I haven't had a genuine suicidal thought since January. I finished writing the pilot episode a month ago from posting this, and I am excited, eager, and hungry for this to get made. This story is a super important and valuable story to share with the world and I know that it will do nothing but good.

Dust is not about me. The main message of this story is to exercise empathy, it teaches you how to get over emotional roadblocks no matter how severe they are, and it teaches how to deal with your internal demons. All with a healthy dose of dark comedic relief. You'll feel uncomfortable as fuck, you'll cry, your heart will warm, and most importantly, you'll laugh.  

Why I'm asking for money

Right. So. Why should you donate your hard-earned cash to lil' ol' me. Here are some reasons (holy shit I'm so bad at this):

  1. I have a full production team of professionals and people who work in the industry working on this with me. I would like to pay them. I have my director and two other crew members flying in from LA (I live in NJ) and I would like to pay for their food and hotel. As for the others, they are taking time off from their jobs to work on this with me for 6 days. I would also like to compensate them, as this means way much more to me than words can express and they'd be missing out on funds from work. 
  2. We are shooting after-hours at a deli for two-three days for this shoot. I know the owner would also appreciate some compensation, as they'd be running the electricity for longer than they usually do, and we will be using the equipment in the kitchen, sucking up precious electricity. 
  3. Paying for miscellaneous items; such as props. I have a good graphic designer friend of mine who will be making some posters and labels for props (she doesn't know this yet, actually, but hi Jacqui xoxo) and I would like to compensate her for that as well. Promotional stills, advertisements, editing, and everything post-production will be handled by friends of mine. These donations are more-so going to everyone else besides me. 
  4. Any left over funds from this campaign would go towards shooting the rest of the episodes, which I will also try to fund through Indiegogo. Due to the fact that I'm not an established actor in the industry, it will be harder to shoot the rest of the episodes. Unless this gets picked up by a network. (I'm looking DIRECTLY at you, Netflix.) ((also Hulu)) (((also literally any network in the entire world ok))) If it doesn't get picked up, they will come out between relatively large gaps of time. I have two out of the six written, and the other four I have completely planned out plot-wise in my records. Aka I know exactly everything that happens in the series and exactly what will happen.
  5. And lastly, it might make you feel good to help make someone's dream come true. This is my dream. Not fame. Not money. But being able to put together a piece of art that will actually benefit the public. To create something that will effect people's lives in a positive way. To get people thinking in a way they normally wouldn't. To make people feel. To make people laugh. 

Risks & Challenges

As I mentioned previously, this campaign is only for the pilot episode. Any leftover funds from this Indiegogo will be saved for shooting the other episodes. Like I said, as an unknown nobody in the acting world, it is very hard to shoot an entire miniseries solely off of one campaign, especially when your director lives 3,000 miles away. However, the rest will be made. That is the only challenge I am facing in terms of the whole project. In terms of the pilot, the only challenge is compensating everyone :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't swing donating to this campaign, that is a-okay. Believe me, I understand. I'm a broke-ass. Yesterday, all I ate was a bowl of cereal. I'm on my state's health insurance. 65% of my wardrobe consists of things I've had since senior year of high school. But you can help in a free kind of way. 

Please share this Indiegogo. That's all I ask. Maybe write a lil post with it about how gr8 this seems/how gr8 I am and that's it. Or don't. Honestly do whatever you want. Go watch youtube. Actually, watch this video; It's hilarious: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xYc4DT18EJg
story_txt:
Hey hi what's up it's me Adam Reines!! 
I made an Indiegogo! That's this. You're here right now reading it.
I'm 22, from New Jersey, I'm an actor, writer and barista (shocking.) So, here's a little background regarding this project. I started writing the pilot episode to this project in March of 2016. It was going well, until I put it on hiatus due to the fact that I was too depressed to write, let alone leave my bed on most days. I was that depressed when I started writing it as well, but it got worse. From 2014 to January 2017, I was on and off suicidal.
However, through hard, hard work in therapy and finding the right medication for me, I haven't had a genuine suicidal thought since January. I finished writing the pilot episode a month ago from posting this, and I am excited, eager, and hungry for this to get made. This story is a super important and valuable story to share with the world and I know that it will do nothing but good.
Dust is not about me. The main message of this story is to exercise empathy, it teaches you how to get over emotional roadblocks no matter how severe they are, and it teaches how to deal with your internal demons. All with a healthy dose of dark comedic relief. You'll feel uncomfortable as fuck, you'll cry, your heart will warm, and most importantly, you'll laugh.  

Why I'm asking for money
Right. So. Why should you donate your hard-earned cash to lil' ol' me. Here are some reasons (holy shit I'm so bad at this):

I have a full production team of professionals and people who work in the industry working on this with me. I would like to pay them. I have my director and two other crew members flying in from LA (I live in NJ) and I would like to pay for their food and hotel. As for the others, they are taking time off from their jobs to work on this with me for 6 days. I would also like to compensate them, as this means way much more to me than words can express and they'd be missing out on funds from work. 
We are shooting after-hours at a deli for two-three days for this shoot. I know the owner would also appreciate some compensation, as they'd be running the electricity for longer than they usually do, and we will be using the equipment in the kitchen, sucking up precious electricity. 
Paying for miscellaneous items; such as props. I have a good graphic designer friend of mine who will be making some posters and labels for props (she doesn't know this yet, actually, but hi Jacqui xoxo) and I would like to compensate her for that as well. Promotional stills, advertisements, editing, and everything post-production will be handled by friends of mine. These donations are more-so going to everyone else besides me. 
Any left over funds from this campaign would go towards shooting the rest of the episodes, which I will also try to fund through Indiegogo. Due to the fact that I'm not an established actor in the industry, it will be harder to shoot the rest of the episodes. Unless this gets picked up by a network. (I'm looking DIRECTLY at you, Netflix.) ((also Hulu)) (((also literally any network in the entire world ok))) If it doesn't get picked up, they will come out between relatively large gaps of time. I have two out of the six written, and the other four I have completely planned out plot-wise in my records. Aka I know exactly everything that happens in the series and exactly what will happen.
And lastly, it might make you feel good to help make someone's dream come true. This is my dream. Not fame. Not money. But being able to put together a piece of art that will actually benefit the public. To create something that will effect people's lives in a positive way. To get people thinking in a way they normally wouldn't. To make people feel. To make people laugh. 


Risks & Challenges
As I mentioned previously, this campaign is only for the pilot episode. Any leftover funds from this Indiegogo will be saved for shooting the other episodes. Like I said, as an unknown nobody in the acting world, it is very hard to shoot an entire miniseries solely off of one campaign, especially when your director lives 3,000 miles away. However, the rest will be made. That is the only challenge I am facing in terms of the whole project. In terms of the pilot, the only challenge is compensating everyone :) 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't swing donating to this campaign, that is a-okay. Believe me, I understand. I'm a broke-ass. Yesterday, all I ate was a bowl of cereal. I'm on my state's health insurance. 65% of my wardrobe consists of things I've had since senior year of high school. But you can help in a free kind of way. 
Please share this Indiegogo. That's all I ask. Maybe write a lil post with it about how gr8 this seems/how gr8 I am and that's it. Or don't. Honestly do whatever you want. Go watch youtube. Actually, watch this video; It's hilarious: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xYc4DT18EJg

story:
The Story:

James is undergoing a transitional period of his life. In his early 30's, he's doing his best to balance owning a small but thriving business while searching for love, without compromising his proud geek identity. With the help and guidance of his concerned friends and co-owners Kelly and Dylan, James navigates the misadventures of dating life while haunted by a past he cannot seem to fully move on from. Colored with the magic of their nerdy dreams, these friends will go on a journey together of self-discovery and of course, shenanigans that can't help but mirror the marvelous stories they know and love!

The Creators:

Gavin Bazalar - Writer, Actor & Producer

Gavin began his journey when he was cast in his first play at age 10. However, it wasn't until 5 years ago that he decided to return to the performing arts. He became a student at the American Art Theatre, under the guidance of it's founder and artistic director Rick Imberman. It was here that Gavin learned the fundamentals of acting and went on to perform in multiple community plays on Long Island at the Merrick Theatre and Center for the Arts (Mass Appeal, Fiddler on the Roof) as well as off-Broadway (A Lie of the Mind, The Laramie Project). Gavin has gradually made his way from the classroom, to the stage and tv/film sets but felt continuous training to be essential so he entered into the T. Schreiber Studio Conservatory. Now a graduate, he continues to strive towards making his mark on the world through the living, breathing art of acting and writing. This will be his first entry as a writer and producer. He has written something that is very near and dear to his heart and is thrilled to share it with the world.

http://www.gavinbazalar.com/

Jim Chaliz - Director & Co-Writer


Jim is an award-winning filmmaker whose work has been screened at festivals across the country. His films include Empty Rooms (The Artists Forum Festival of the Moving Image - Best New York Narrative Short) and Last Call (IFQ Film Festival’s Best Audience Short Award). Jim was an editor for Vice News Tonight (HBO) and also worked on Quantico (ABC), Pokemon (Cartoon Network), After the First 48 (A&E), Hack My Life (truTV) and the feature film Come Down Molly.

http://j3filmworks.com/

Director of Photography

Raymond Chu

Raymond Chu is an award-winning filmmaker, contributing as a Producer, Director, DP, Editor, or One-Man-Band, on a wide range of top commercial, fashion, television, web series, music video, short film, documentary, and live events projects that have won film festivals and generated millions of views for top multinational brands around the world. With an eye for style,  he always aims to push genres to their greatest potential and create lasting images that stick with you. Clients include: Kiehl's, Time, Kia, LG, GQ Taiwan, Allure, Jay Z's L+T, William Rast, Georg Jensen, Ancient Aliens, Playtex, Neil Patrick Harris, Eric Buterbaugh, and more."

http://loftyentertainment.squarespace.com/

The Cast: 

Gavin Bazalar as James

Diana Benigno as Kelly

Diana Maria Benigno is so excited to venture into the world of web television! As an actor and dramaturg, she is in the process of completing her MA in Theatre at Hunter College.  She has a BA in Dramatic Literature from NYU.  Favorite roles include Beatrice in Shakespeare's Much Ado About Nothing at Hunter College, Sister James in John Patrick Shanley's Doubt for the Merrick Theatre and Center for the Arts, and suffocating Clarence as Murderer 1 in Nicu Spoon's Richard III.  Previous dramaturgy includes Richard III: a dishonourable tale, at the Secret Theatre in Queens and The Brick Theatre's Shakespeare Festival workshop of Hamlet, or I Shall Mourn the Rivers.  She also can be seen in recurring roles as both Antoinette and Cookie in the Off-Broadway interactive theatre productionMurdered by the Mob.  Most recent roles include Ariel in Identity Theatre's The Tempest with the Shakespeare Forum, and Mother-in-Law in Federico Garcia Lorca's Blood Wedding, directed by Mia Rovegno. Thanks to Tony, always <3 

Jimmy Cintron as Dylan

Jimmy Cintron,  An actor/writer with over 10 years experience. Recent credits include: “Imaginary Love, Love: The Series, Mr. Kiss, Shop Lifters,  and After the Long Beat.” Screenwriting credits include: G-D-G’s Gonna Cut You Down, MGNMT, Birds Fly South, Like Water Currently, Directing Womanhood a film dealing with women’s cancer, and is a Producer/Creator/ Co-writer of Don’t Kill the Messenger feature film. A Marymount Manhattan College and T. Schreiber Studio Acting Program alumni, represented by DDO Artists Agency and Midnight Artists Group.

http://jimmyalexis.wixsite.com/jimmycintron

Our Goal:

This campaign will allow us to shoot the pilot episode of the series as well as put a trailer together for the remaining written episodes in order to assemble a package that we can present to television and web series festivals. We believe this project has an ambitious and unique story that will appeal not only to the ever-growing niche of nerd culture, but to a mass audience. Our goal is to deliver our eccentric and engaging story to the public, and this campaign is the first step to delivering the best series possible. We are confident that we can acquire interest in this project thanks to our very talented and dedicated cast and crew. 

Why Support Us?

By contributing to this campaign, you will be coming on this journey with us and together we will make something terrific! You folks will be the fuel that propels this rocket into space and beyond! Any and all contributions made will be for the production costs that we will incur such as food, travel, equipment rental, advertising; just to name a few. By being a part of this project, we can present our story in a high-quality, and more importantly, a professional manner that will get the attention we seek.

Breakdown of Expenses: 

Timeline:

February - Writing

March - Rewrites

April - Casting begins, J3 Filmworks joins the Production Team

May - Rewrites, Location Scouting

June - Search for Crew

July - First Read-Thru, FB Page Launch, Rewrites

September 13th- Crowdfunding Campaign Launch

End of October - Production Begins

End of November - Post-Production Begins

December - Series Launch

Our main filming location: 

Lost Planet Comics and Collectibles (in Bay Shore, NY)

Questions?

There are always inherent risks when it comes to producing an independent project, but we certainly think it's worth the try! Feel free to reach out to us via email at trinitycomicstv@gmail.com if you have any questions about the project.

Can't Contribute? Not a Problem!

Please don't feel pressured to support us with only your wallets. You can still help us by getting the word out. We are on Facebook and Instagram. You can help with a simple click, like and share! Go to our links below and be a part of Trinity Comics!

Instagram:  @trinitycomicstv 

Face Book:  http://fb.me/trinitycomicstv

Thank you in advance to all of you wonderful people for being a part of this!

story:
What Is It?

 

States of Perception: Body Image is a digital series that will focus on telling 50 unique, diverse stories from 50 different states across the United States of America. Each episode will be between under 10 minutes, feature 1 story from a specific state, and will be released across online platforms when editing is finished. 

 

 

As social media has expanded in reach, more and more people are sharing their stories related to body image online. States of Perception: Body Image will help expand the reach of these stories in a way that is digitally consumable and short-form based. 

 

Why Does This Project Matter?

 

Body image impacts everyone, whether it’s through the media we consume, the people we follow on social media, or the way we view ourselves in private and public. Even though everyone in the world has a story related to body image, we only see a limited scope of these stories represented when we watch tv or when we scroll on Instagram. 

 

By highlighting 50 diverse stories across the USA, we hope the series will open people’s eyes to what body positivity and body neutrality means, and help reduce stigma surrounding eating disorders, lower rates of fat-shaming and gender stereotypes related to weight, and allow people to feel more comfortable being their authentic selves. The series will tackle topics including body positivity vs body neutrality, fat phobia, privileges related to weight and image, social injustices associated with eating disorders and body image, narratives around all body types, narratives surrounding solutions to the stigmatization of body image, efforts to increase inclusive representation in mainstream media, modeling, and fashion, and potentially treatment options and highlights surrounding healing centers. 

 

How Did This All Start?

 

After meeting at a National Eating Disorder Association (NEDA) Walk, award-winning director Alec Fischer and NEDA Ambassador Ryan Sheldon met and bonded over the concept for a series addressing what body image means to people across the United States. Putting together Fischer’s experience creating documentaries and Sheldon’s experience as a body-positivity advocate seemed like a perfect match; thus States of Perception: Body Image was born!

 

Meet the Team:

 

Alec Fischer (@FischrMedia): Co-Producer, Director, Editor

At age 17, Alec created a documentary based on the 2011 suicide epidemic in Minnesota Public Schools that was shown in schools across the world, garnering him international attention. In college he was named a Dalai Lama Fellow, collected 115k+ signatures to ban the practice of conversion therapy on minors, & spoke to 15k+ students across the Midwest about creating safe school environments. He’s been featured in publications including USA Today, The HuffPost, Buzzfeed, MTV, and The Washington Times.

 

Ryan Sheldon (@BingeEaterConfessions): Co-Producer, Host

A motivational speaker and brawn model, Ryan has been educating audiences about body image and binge eating disorder since his own diagnosis in 2015. Passionate about raising awareness of binge eating and body image issues as an Ambassador for the National Eating Disorders Association, he has shared his story with the Today Show, Huffington Post, Seventeen Magazine, and Teen Vogue, among other outlets. Ryan also speaks to teens about masculinity, identity, and body confidence. He is currently working on a book about his and other men's experiences learning to eat mindfully and love themselves just as they are. 

 

If You Raise The Money, What Will Happen?

 

If we raise the $50,000 goal budget, we’ll be able to take a road trip across the United States and film an episode in each state we visit! If we fall short of our goal, then we’ll cut down the amount of states we visit based on the funding we’re able to raise. 

 

Here’s a rough timeline if we raise the entire amount of our goal:

 

September 2019: Campaign Launch!

October 2019: Campaign Closes

November - April 2020: Pre-Production (Episode Planning, Travel Prep, Etc)

May - June 2020: 1st Half of Production (West Coast + Southern States)

July 2020: Post-Production Begins on 1st Half of Series

August - September 2020: 2nd Half of Production (Midwest + East Coast + Mountain Regions)

October 2020 - January 2021: Post Production

Early 2021: Series Premiere

 

What Will The Money Go Towards?

 

Here’s what the $50,000 will go towards: 

 

40% - Airbnb Rental Costs

25% - Gas & Car Rental Fees

15% - Food Costs

10% - Camera Equipment

5% -  Emergency Fund/Backup Funding

5% - Indiegogo Costs

 

If we reach our initial goal then the budget shifts to this breakdown for every dollar raised after $50,000:

 

25% - Editor/Color Correction

25% - Producer Compensation

20% - Director Compensation

10% - Re-Shoot Budget

10% - Music Licensing

5% - NEDA (National Editing Disorder Association) Donation

5% - Indiegogo Costs

 

How Can I Get Involved??

 

YAY! We love that you want to get involved with the project! Did you start by donating to the campaign and sharing the video on your social media channels? Yes? Awesome! Here are some additional ways you can get involved:

 

Nominate yourself or someone you know to be featured in an episode: NOMINATE HERE

 

Join us on Patreon for meetup opportunities, exclusive behind the scenes footage, and project updates: JOIN HERE

 

Join the project newsletter for email updates: JOIN HERE

 

Do you know a local or national company who would want to sponsor an episode, or the entire series? Great! Read the next section to find out more info.

 

I Know A Company Who Would LOVE To Sponsor An Episode, Or The Entire Series!

 

You do!? That’s great - we’d love to have sponsorships to enhance the series and help us pay our bills while we film and edit! You can fill out a sponsorship request form here and we’ll be in touch: SUBMIT HERE

 

About the National Eating Disorder Association

 

The National Eating Disorders Association (NEDA) is the largest nonprofit organization dedicated to supporting individuals and families affected by eating disorders.

 

In the United States, 20 million women and 10 million men will suffer from an eating disorder at some point in their lives. Eating disorders are serious, life-threatening illnesses that affect all kinds of people, regardless of gender, ethnicity, size, age, or background. In fact, eating disorders have the second highest mortality rate of all mental health disorders, surpassed only by opioid addiction.

 

Eating disorders are widely misunderstood illnesses and support options are often inaccessible. As a result, too many people are left feeling helpless, hopeless, and frightened. Through the programs and services offered, NEDA raises awareness, builds communities of support and recovery, funds research, and puts life-saving resources into the hands of those in need.

 

We are so excited to have the opportunity to donate 5% of proceeds to NEDA after reaching our goal. Help support our series and this incredible organization by donating.

 

If you are or think you may be struggling with an eating disorder please visit www.nationaleatingdisorderassociation.org

August - September 2020: 2nd Half of Production (Midwest + East Coast + Mountain Regions)
October 2020 - January 2021: Post Production
Early 2021: Series Premiere What Will The Money Go Towards? Here’s what the $50,000 will go towards:  40% - Airbnb Rental Costs
25% - Gas & Car Rental Fees
15% - Food Costs
10% - Camera Equipment
5% -  Emergency Fund/Backup Funding
5% - Indiegogo Costs If we reach our initial goal then the budget shifts to this breakdown for every dollar raised after $50,000: 25% - Editor/Color Correction
25% - Producer Compensation
20% - Director Compensation
10% - Re-Shoot Budget
10% - Music Licensing
5% - NEDA (National Editing Disorder Association) Donation
5% - Indiegogo Costs How Can I Get Involved?? YAY! We love that you want to get involved with the project! Did you start by donating to the campaign and sharing the video on your social media channels? Yes? Awesome! Here are some additional ways you can get involved: Nominate yourself or someone you know to be featured in an episode: NOMINATE HERE
 
Join us on Patreon for meetup opportunities, exclusive behind the scenes footage, and project updates: JOIN HERE Join the project newsletter for email updates: JOIN HERE Do you know a local or national company who would want to sponsor an episode, or the entire series? Great! Read the next section to find out more info. I Know A Company Who Would LOVE To Sponsor An Episode, Or The Entire Series! You do!? That’s great - we’d love to have sponsorships to enhance the series and help us pay our bills while we film and edit! You can fill out a sponsorship request form here and we’ll be in touch: SUBMIT HERE About the National Eating Disorder Association The National Eating Disorders Association (NEDA) is the largest nonprofit organization dedicated to supporting individuals and families affected by eating disorders. In the United States, 20 million women and 10 million men will suffer from an eating disorder at some point in their lives. Eating disorders are serious, life-threatening illnesses that affect all kinds of people, regardless of gender, ethnicity, size, age, or background. In fact, eating disorders have the second highest mortality rate of all mental health disorders, surpassed only by opioid addiction. Eating disorders are widely misunderstood illnesses and support options are often inaccessible. As a result, too many people are left feeling helpless, hopeless, and frightened. Through the programs and services offered, NEDA raises awareness, builds communities of support and recovery, funds research, and puts life-saving resources into the hands of those in need. We are so excited to have the opportunity to donate 5% of proceeds to NEDA after reaching our goal. Help support our series and this incredible organization by donating. If you are or think you may be struggling with an eating disorder please visit www.nationaleatingdisorderassociation.org

story:
CAMPAIGN UPDATE: 

While we did not meet our goal, we supplemented the donations and funds raised at our events from our own pockets and have successfully filmed the series! We are now in post-production, with a premiere screening coming mid-summer 2019.

 

OVERVIEW:

Following the death of his grandmother, Benji is suddenly stranded alone amongst the severed limbs of his family tree. Implored to re-examine his grievances against his father, Benji discovers that he is the son of a homosexual man who has succumbed to HIV having refused treatment. Quickly piecing together his grandmother’s resentments towards his father, Benji must reconcile the years of misplaced anger he has harboured towards him.

THE IMPACT:

“Pain travels through families until someone is ready to feel it." -Stephi Wagner

Molar Horrors speaks to a generation, regardless of sexual orientation, who have grown up unfamiliar with the politics surrounding the HIV/AIDS crisis but continue to live with the social and political consequences of the pandemic.

Rosy Club Productions is a diverse group of multidisciplinary filmmakers, writers, and artists completing their final year at Ryerson’s Radio and Television Arts (RTA) program in Toronto, Canada. Our team is dedicated to working within local communities to prioritize diverse LGBTQ+ voices in the promotion of community and mental health. This series will aid in establishing not only the voices of young artists, but also to elevate those of local community members.

BUDGET:

Rosy Club Production’s $5000 Indiegogo goal will help supplement the financial contributions of our executive team members. Filmmaking is an expensive endeavour, and this project is no exception. Should we reach our goal, the $5000 fundraised will aid in covering the costs of equipment rentals, transportation, locations, costuming, special FX makeup, set dressing, and craft services. 

We appreciate every dollar donated, and for that reason we have come up with some unique perks themed around the web series. 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

While financial contributions are appreciated, we understand that not everyone can contribute in this manner. If you would like to support our project but cannot donate, please share this campaign with your friends and family members!

Otherwise, follow us on social media @molarhorrors

If you would like to email us directly for more ways that you can help, reach out at: rosyclubproductions@gmail.com 

For any other questions about the series, and more information on Rosy Club Productions please visit: www.molarhorrors.com

story:
SUMMARY

Good day, thank you for viewing our campaign. We are Adam Shepherd and Ashlin Harris from London, United Kingdom. We are both Co - creators of WHO IS BANKSY? during the day we are credited actors and have previous experience in writing. 

We are funding to create a 'proof of concept' episode also known as a Pilot episode, These are made to show to TV networks or other production services to produce a project that will be featured on a TV outlet. 

Our campaign is designed to create laughter and imagination to those who view/make it during these slow and dark times. The Campaign is mighty important to us because right now, creativity outlets are minimal. We aim to create something that is light yet purposeful.

All contributions will be highly appreciated, whether monetary or through sharing our campaign to others. All the Funds will go towards production team costs, talent, locations, editing, sound, art director, make up artist, the hiring of equipment and small additional costs. The more funds raised will able us to invest in the final quality of the final product.   

 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET?

The estimated funds we require for our project are: £10,000

This covers the cost of: DOP, Gaffer, First Ad, Runner, Sound Equipment, MUA, Art director, Actors, Locations, Photographer, Travel expenses, Food, Editor, Grader, Composer, Sound mixer.

The planned shooting period will be for the duration of 1 week and will include 1 episode of 20-25minutes

 

PERKS.

The perks are intended to make you feel as close to the project as possible, because after all we would not be a production without your generosity. *please check out their full description in the perks section on the main campaign page.

  • A social media shout out.
  • A 'Who is Banksy' postcard
  • A 'Who is Banksy' cap
  • A 'Who is Banksy' T - shirt
  • An Executive producer and solo name mention in credits x2 (free access to live Screening and choice of cap/t-shirt)
  • Producer and your name mentioned in credits (free access to live screening)
  • First access to Final edit at live Screening.

 

IF THE TARGET IS NOT MET?

If we fail to reach our target we will have to adapt and compromise on the amount of episodes and potential the quality of the filming, which may have an impact on our chances of getting the project on to a TV network.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Timing will be our biggest challenge, due to the corona virus. time could be lost due to closures of some amenities used for the production. The potential that production crew or talent could contract Corona virus close to shooting days leaving us to postpone or replace.

another challenge is pitching to TV networks and outlets. If we fail to secure a network feature we will turn it into a Webseries.

The quality of the final product could be at risk if not enough funding is generated.

story:
Hello! I'm Lyralen Kaye and I want to tell you a little about Assigned Female at Birth, A Web Series about Some Bodies. Born of the pandemic and our need to tell stories while keeping very safe about our health, AFAB necessitated a journey through cyber space into the hearts and minds of people across the United States, Canada, the UK, Australia and Mexico.

Basically, the 23 characters depicted in AFAB, like the 32 people I originally interviewed to create the project, have been taught from birth that their bodies can never be good enough. Not able enough, not straight enough, not cis enough, not thin enough, not white enough, not gay enough, not femme enough, not butch enough, not young enough...the list goes on. All feel invisible—from the gender fluid Asian lesbian born with a fibular hemimelia disability to the blind ballet dancer,
from the women fighting clinical depression to the rabbi on the spectrum who is also a cancer
survivor, from the preschool teacher to the therapist with multiple personalities—they struggle to
be seen. And whether the prejudice they fight is ableism or racism, homophobia or misogyny, whether they seek healing from #metoo issues, prejudice or disabilities they’ve had since birth, they reach for life with courage. They are bold, frightened , vulnerable and ridiculously strong.

They are, above all things, woke.

They are my people, my community, the only place I call home...and I want them to be that place for you too, no matter your gender or orientation, your ability or your age.

For too long, these are the stories not heard anywhere in the mainstream, and besides the oppression that implies, it is a terrible loss, because having an outlier identity means you have to unpack what it means to be human in order to both survive and thrive. And then you have so much to teach, and so many ways to laugh at the absurdity and the pain of being human.

We are in a crucial time in history. Art and stories hold us to empathy, to a growing understanding, to an ability to connect.

This is a world changing project, and we want you to be part of it.

We also want to move beyond our first 2 seasons into a deeper ongoing examination of these lives, and to pay cast and crew equally, according to SAG-AFTRA guidelines, moving forward.

We believe this is crucially important.

Why? Because this project represents unheard voices telling human stories of struggling to accept the bodies in which they live...a struggle we all have in this culture. Because loving our bodies is a way to love the earth, to find peace...and art inspires empathy, compassion, passion, commitment to the core issues of our lives in a way political rhetoric approximates.

It's important because we, those of us creating this project, those of us interviewed for this project, are among the most at risk. It's important because telling our stories is a way to overcome our fear of being hurt and in doing so to love the world and offer connection to our communities.

It's important because we've been trolled on FB and YouTube since the very first day, and we want to sing against that hate.

It's important because you are part of this, and we are one world and one people.

Please give. Please spread the world. Please watch the videos and the series. We hope to make you laugh and cry.

Nuts and Bolts: Please do visit and like and subscribe!

Our YouTube channel:

https://www.youtube.com/c/AnotherCountryTV

Our first episode:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=egcDfCDBQWs&amp.....

 

Help us make more!

We appreciate whatever you can do!

Be well, stay safe. We wish you peace.

Lyralen Kaye, fae/faire, they/them

Jude Sclarsky, e, eir

Nelda Quigley, she/her

Tina D'Elia, she/her

Alex Alexander, she/her

 

How we're doing it? The technology?

I'm a push-the-envelope person, so as the writing moved along, I started asking directors of photography if we could film remotely and still create the illusion that characters were relating in the same world. And we decided to try. So our actors are spread across the country and most have never met in 3D!

For Season 3, we have our first opportunity to film fully vaxxed and in person. This is likely to triple our budget...but it will be so worth it.

We appreciate everything you do!!!!
