story:
PART 2 OF THIS CAMPAIGN HAS LAUNCHED!! Please head over to: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/scary-sleepover-the-resurrection-continues#/

 

UPDATED - JULY 1, 2020: Our new campaign has opened! Click the above link to head over to PART 2!

WHAT IS SCARY SLEEPOVER?

Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER is an on-line reality series that features some of the biggest names in genre entertainment like you've never seen them before... in their pajamas! In each episode a different celebrity artist joins filmmaker Adam Green (HATCHET, FROZEN) for a slumber party at his studio where they spend the night playing games, watching movies, eating junk food, and having extremely candid conversations that reveal their biggest real life fears. To date the 29 existing episodes have been watched over 1 million times between ArieScope.com and ArieScope's YouTube channel. 

It was Green's goal in creating SCARY SLEEPOVER to not only entertain audiences but to provide a true connection between artists and fans. While the show may be inherently funny and contain some truly hilarious moments, it is also bursting with genuine heart due to each guest's personal relationship with Green and how comfortable they are opening up about themselves so honestly. Through its many emotional and revealing moments SCARY SLEEPOVER has given fans a much deeper look at who these artists really are and just how much we all truly have in common as a community. 

THE GUESTS SO FAR:

Previous guests have include: Slash (GUNS N ROSES), Sid Haig (THE DEVIL'S REJECTS), Kane Hodder (FRIDAY THE 13TH), Danielle Harris (HALLOWEEN), Dee Snider (TWISTED SISTER), Derek Mears (SWAMP THING), Bill Moseley (THE DEVIL'S REJECTS), Emma Bell (THE WALKING DEAD), Tony Todd (CANDYMAN), Joe Lynch (MAYHEM), Brea Grant (DEXTER), Felissa Rose (SLEEPAWAY CAMP), Neil Marshall (GAME OF THRONES), Ti West (HOUSE OF THE DEVIL), Kristina Klebe (HALLOWEEN), Lucky McKee (MAY), Clare Kramer (BUFFY THE VAMPIRE SLAYER), Todd Farmer (MY BLOODY VALENTINE), Tiffany Shepis (VICTOR CROWLEY), Tom Holland (CHILD'S PLAY), Laura Ortiz (HOLLISTON), Darren Lynn Bousman (SAW), Zach Galligan (GREMLINS), and Jeffrey Reddick (FINAL DESTINATION).

THE HISTORY OF SCARY SLEEPOVER:

Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER originally ran from 2015 - 2017. Full-length uncensored versions of episodes ran on ArieScope.com while ArieScope's YouTube Channel carried shortened versions. The show was (and remains) free to watch no matter which platform you watched it on.  As beloved as the series may have become, unfortunately our model of making the show with our own money and giving it away to fans for free eventually took its toll on us. Producing the show was taking up all of our time and we were sinking further and further into debt the longer we worked on it. So it was with a heavy heart that we had to roll up our sleeping bags and say goodnight to the slumber parties. 

The amount of work that goes into producing an episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER is on par with an episode of any network television reality show - only we were doing it without a budget of any kind whatsoever.  Not only is a crew required for every shoot but episodes can take anywhere from 40 to 60 hours  (if not longer) to complete post-production. We were having to work through the nights and over the weekends around our actual production jobs in order to make SCARY SLEEPOVER happen, often times giving up paid work and falling behind on deadlines in our personal careers.  As much as we loved doing the show, no one involved could carry on producing a show where the people behind it were literally paying to work on it. So after 29 wonderful episodes, the reality of the situation won out and we had to call it a night.

WHAT PROMPTED THE RESURRECTION? 

Over the past summer two crucial things happened that caused us to start rethinking SCARY SLEEPOVER.  In July an article titled "Adam Green Saved My Life" was posted on NightmareNostalgia.com. In the piece, writer Landon Evanson bravely discussed his on going battle with depression and how SCARY SLEEPOVER had helped him through some of his darkest nights when he was having suicidal thoughts. It wasn't that the series possessed a magical cure for depression but by Landon connecting with the relationships and sincerity on display in SCARY SLEEPOVER, he saw just how fortunate his own friends make his life. We highly encourage you to read Landon's article here. [http://nightmarenostalgia.com/2019/07/13/adam-g...]

It was Landon's story that first got us talking about resurrecting SCARY SLEEPOVER. Just like our show had helped him realize what he has in his own life, Landon's article helped us see what we have in our show. Landon, if you see this - thank you for showing us that what we do matters. We're so very grateful that you're still here and that our work could help you when you needed it. 

Just two months later, our dear friend Sid Haig passed away. Sid was a major part of our ArieScope family having appeared in HATCHET 3, our sit-com HOLLISTON, several of our annual Halloween short films, an episode of our original series HORRIFIED, two episodes of THE MOVIE CRYPT podcast, and two episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER (his original episode in 2015 and the Christmas Special in 2017). While we had known that Sid was ill for a long time and though he had lived the fullest life a man could ever dream of living, his passing was still devastating. Sid had hundreds of films and television shows under his belt - not to mention countless interviews that he had given during his lifetime. Yet out of everything that fans could have turned to when he passed, it was Sid's 2015 episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER that many reached for to remember him with. His episode was suddenly viewed over 100,000 times within the first 48 hours of his passing and in turn, all of the episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER quickly began climbing up and up in views as a whole new audience discovered the series. Once again we began to question our decision for walking away from the show before ever asking the community we were serving for help. We were ready to try and resurrect SCARY SLEEPOVER.  

After the financial hit that making the show had caused us the first time around, the most obvious change we knew we'd have to make was that our crew would need to be paid something for all of their hours of work this time around. While our loyal crew may be willing to work on the show for far below any kind of standard industry rates, with bills to pay and children at home to feed... the days of everyone always working for free are over. It was also crucial to all of us that if we were to bring the series back certain technical areas of the production would need to be improved on. For instance, one of our biggest concerns is making sure that we can afford to have a professional sound mixer and operator on set this time around. In making the first two seasons of the show we had to throw out so many incredible moments due to unusable sound. 

As an example, our final episode (the Christmas Special in 2017) was so plagued with sound problems that it was almost never released at all. Kane Hodder, Danielle Harris, Sid Haig, Bill Moseley, and Felissa Rose were Adam Green's guests for that special episode. In the end, we knew that we couldn't not show the world such an incredible gathering with all of those horror icons having Christmas dinner and a slumber party together, so we fixed up the audio as best as we could and we released the episode with sound that legitimately made us ashamed. To make it worse, we had to throw out many wonderful moments that we captured between the group because the microphones we had weren't working at all. That night was such an incredible moment in time that will never happen again- (Sid would learn that he was seriously ill shortly after we shot) and our audio was unusable simply because we didn't have a budget to work with. It was heartbreaking. And we can't let that happen again. This time around we have to have help.

WHAT WE'RE ASKING FOR:

In order to keep bringing you new episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER, in order to keep the series independent, and in order to keep the series free to watch and accessible to all... we're asking for a budget of $5,000 (USD) per episode. That's IT. Could we ask for more? Absolutely. Should we? Probably. But right now all we want is to be able to make the show for you again without it negatively effecting our lives and putting us in debt like it did before. For every $5,000 raised we will put a new episode into production. It's that simple. Ultimately you decide just how many episodes you'll get based on how much and how often you donate.

Given the size of SCARY SLEEPOVER's audience and how many times the episodes are viewed, the meager $5k per episode budget that we collectively arrived at is more than fair. It is the bare minimum we need to pay our crew something for their work, to improve the quality of the show, and to keep the series free to watch on ArieScope.com and on ArieScope's YouTube channel - platforms that are readily accessible to all. Full disclose- we're extremely nervous that $5k may turn out not to be enough after all of the fees and taxes that get taken out before what we raise even gets to us. Remember, not only does Indiegogo take 5% of what we raise as their own "platform fee" but they also automatically set aside 5% of whatever we raise as a contingency to cover "chargebacks" (backers who default on whatever they pledged). So that's 10% gone right off the bat. Then the banks charge fees on every individual pledge. Every donation that comes from someone within the US has 2.9% + .30 taken out for a "transaction fee" while donations that come from other countries have a much higher amount taken out plus a hefty "transfer fee" (at least $25 or more) on top of that!  Finally, at the end of the year we'll also need to pay taxes on every dollar that came in just like all US citizens have to do. We know this is all information that is likely just making your eyes glaze over and your head spin. No, you don't need to call an exorcist. It's unfortunately just how crowdfunding goes and there is no way around it. We won't know the reality of it until after we've made the first crowd funded episode and see how it went but we're being transparent the whole way. If we have to adjust accordingly moving forward? Well, then we'll have to adjust accordingly. But hopefully you're getting a clear picture of just how much we're trying to make this work on as tight of a budget as possible.

"ONCE A NEW EPISODE IS GREEN-LIT, HOW LONG BEFORE WE CAN WATCH IT?"

Every time we hit another $5,000 goal we'll get started making an episode. Producing an episode can take anywhere from a few weeks to a couple of months. It all depends on guest/crew availability but we usually move rather fast. We'll post updates and include the most accurate ETA we can for when we expect the next episode to be ready. Should we become unavailable for any amount of time due to starting production on our next feature film or television project, it doesn't mean SCARY SLEEPOVER will end. In a perfect world donations are continuously coming in during the time we're away shooting the next big project. That way we come back to this with enough funding ready to make multiple episodes back to back rather than randomly making one here and making one there. It all depends on how the fundraising goes. But to be clear- this endeavor is not going to pay anyone enough to quit their career and stand by waiting for the next episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER to get green-lit. Please be reasonable. We'll get new episodes made as fast as we can and in a timely fashion. Episodes will be released simultaneously on ArieScope.com and ArieScope's YouTube channel. The same exact version will be released on both platforms. Want to help see episodes get made faster? Share this campaign on social media and encourage others to donate! 

We'll end this campaign when funds seem to have stoped coming in. If things go well and we make a complete season (12 crowd funded episodes + 2 outtake episodes) rather quickly? Well, when the season is over we'll put a pin in the campaign while we take a break and recover, then start it up again once we're ready to tackle a new season. Let's see how it goes before worrying about that as having dozens of episodes financed would be an extremely high class problem to have!

"SO WHAT DO I GET FOR DONATING?"

You get THE SHOW!  Look, we know people love their buttons, posters, "shout outs," shopping bags, T-shirts, and other crowdfunding rewards but we want to bring you as many episodes as possible for as low a production budget as possible. If we start creating and shipping a bunch of useless "stuff" all over the world we would need to raise WAY more per episode just to pay for all of it and we'd be spending our time shipping rewards instead of making the actual show. Donate because you want to get new episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER, not because you want an official pencil sharpener or other random item with the show's logo on it. We're putting every dollar into the show, not squandering it on T-shirts.

OK, FINE!  You want rewards? We created some wicked cool rewards that won't take away from the show itself or require us to jack up the minimum amount we need to raise just so that we can pay for "Scary Sleepover" hair ties, spatulas, staplers or other useless stuff that we all know you don't really need. Unfortunately, IndieGoGo's interface massively limits the amount of space where you can describe each reward so we've listed more thorough descriptions below. Remember- you can donate any amount you'd like. It's not like you have to purchase one of the rewards if you'd rather give less and just contribute what you can afford to give to help make the show happen. 

The Unlisted Reward =  This one is our reward to everyone who helps. For every 6 episodes that get green-lit we will create a 7th episode on our own that consists of outtakes and moments that you didn't see in the previous 6 episodes. With Seasons 1 and 2 we always did a mid-season and an end of season outtake episode. So just like the two previous seasons, we're only doing this for every 6 episodes that get green-lit. If the donations come to a complete stop after just 4 or 5 episodes? Well, that's unfortunately where the season ends. We'd love nothing more than to be able to do a full 14 episode season just like we used to (12 crowd funded episodes + 2 outtake episodes) but that's entirely up to you the audience.

$50 = Scary Stream-over Party! Whenever this next season (technically Season 3) of Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER is considered to be over you will receive a private invitation to an all-night, on-line "Scary Stream-over Party" with Adam and Arwen that is exclusively for backers who donated $50 or more. Please remember that at this point we have no idea how many episodes you guys will ultimately green-light so we have no way of knowing exactly how many episodes will constitute Season 3. We have to play it by ear and see what you do. Point is- everyone in this tier and above will be invited to an all-night Scary Sleepover live stream where we all watch movies, play games, talk about our fears together, and pig out on junk food. If you've ever enjoyed one of THE MOVIE CRYPT's annual live "Yorkiethons" or participated in MOVIE CRYPT LIVE (a monthly live stream for Patrons of the podcast) - this is gonna be similar to that only better! When the season ends a weekend night will be announced for the "Stream-over." When that weekend arrives a private link to the stream will go out to everyone who purchased a reward this season. Adam and Arwen will be on the stream with everyone all night. Knowing them they will have some surprises up their sleeves so you never know who else might show up and crash the party! This exclusive live "Stream-over" will essentially recreate what you see Adam and his guests do on the show and most likely go for an 8-hour stretch like 7pm PST until 3am PST (or hours like that).  We will give everyone at least 3 week's notice for when the slumber party is going to happen. Our apologies if the night that this winds up taking place doesn't work for you  but we're going to give everyone plenty of notice. Ideally this "Stream-over" will take place within a month of whenever the final episode of the season is released but for all we know Adam could be on set in the middle of directing a movie in Tunisia by then. Just know that one way or another we will make this event happen even. Seriously, this is a pretty awesome reward and we're all already looking forward to it!

$100 = Thank You Credit! Not only will you get an invite to the all night, on-line "Scary Stream-over Party" listed above but you will be immortalized by having your name on screen at the end of an episode. This is sincerely a big deal to us as we're crediting you on screen right alongside our beloved crew. Having donated to and worked on crowd funded projects ourselves, one thing that we really hate to see is when the credits acknowledging the very people who made the project happen fly by so fast or are shoved up into the corner of the screen so small that no one could ever possibly read them. Hey, we get it. The average audience member immediately shuts off whatever they are watching once the credits start and with on-line content a "play" doesn't count as completed unless it plays until the end. That's why we do our ending credits for SCARY SLEEPOVER while there is something still happening - even if it is merely dialogue continuing on underneath the credits. We give people a reason to finish watching the entire episode. Therefore, everyone who ever watches an episode that you backed is going to see that you were part of making it happen. Please take this one seriously. We sure do as our crew is our family. To be acknowledged in our work alongside our brothers and sisters is an honor.

$250 = Personalized "Thank You" video & Early Access! Not only will you get all of the above (a thank you credit and an invite to the all night, on-line "Scary Stream-over Party"), you'll also receive a private link to see the episode that you backed several days ahead if its premiere on-line! best of all, there will be a personalized introduction from Adam Green and Arwen thanking you for helping SCARY SLEEPOVER continue at the front of it! We debated offering this one for awhile as truthfully it takes a lot more time to make happen than you might think. (Any editors out there know how many hours it can actually take to create individual episodes for a variety of people, export them, and upload them to a private server.) But if you're going to back us this generously we want to make sure you see in our eyes just how appreciated you actually are. Sincerely, this one is a reward for us just as much as it may be a reward for you. A personalized video is the closest we can come to actually shaking your hand or full-on hugging you. You're a goddamn hero and we love you for caring this much about what we do. Let us tell you how we feel about you to your face.

$5000 = Executive Producer! This is as big as it gets because at this level you're one of us. By singlehandedly financing an episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER you will be credited on screen as the sole Executive Producer at the top of the episode. Your "Executive Producer" credit will join "Created By" and "Guest Star" as the only credits at the beginning of the episode! You'll also be invited to join us on set when the episode shoots. NOTE: You are responsible for getting yourself to our studio in Los Angeles. We will give you as much advance notice of the shoot night as possible. In fact, you'll find out what date it is being scheduled for when we do. Scheduling SCARY SLEEPOVER's shoot nights is a lot like a game of human Tetris in that we're juggling our guest's and our entire crew's availability. That can give us extremely limited options. There have been times in the past where a guest tells us "I'd love to do it! I'm in town tomorrow but then I'm not back again for 8 months. Can you make that work?" and then we have to scramble to put the shoot together right up until the moment the guest arrives at the front door. Hopefully our audience backs enough episodes that we have some options for you as far as shoot nights go but if there aren't any other episodes in the pipeline we may not. For instance, if you can't get here for the very next episode we're going to be shooting, perhaps there are other shoot nights coming up that are a little bit further off in the calendar and that have more notice before they take place. Again, we have no way of knowing just how many episodes we're going to wind up making as it all depends on how this campaign goes. Just know that we'll do everything we possibly can to make the shoot happen on a night when you can be here for it. Please keep in mind that we can't control it if a guest or crew member suddenly falls ill or has an emergency arise and forces us to reschedule a shoot at the last minute any more than we can reschedule an entire shoot if you suddenly can't make it at the last minute. Our advice: Do this because you want to produce your own episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER and treat the set visit as an added bonus. Chances are good it will all work out but we have to be as thorough as possible in these descriptions.

Keep in mind, donations go toward the next episode in line being financed. It does not mean you continue to keep getting that reward for all future episodes as well. 

So, there you go! Rewards!

NOW... LET'S DO THIS!

While over 1 million people may have already watched Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER, the reality is that very few are actually going to step up and help. They're going to wait and hope that other people donate - then watch the show. It's just how this goes. But if we didn't have at least a little bit of faith in our audience we wouldn't have gone through the effort of making the video you watched above or putting together this campaign. We believe in you!

This is the moment when you show us what SCARY SLEEPOVER means to you. Do the slumber parties continue or are they truly over? We sincerely hope that you'll consider backing us generously and continuously as the series (hopefully) continues on and on. Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign.

Most sincerely-

The ArieScope Family

SCARY SLEEPOVER: RESURRECTION VIDEO made by Sean Becker, Will Barratt, Adam Green, and Arwen. Massive thanks to Lola Barbare ("Arwen"), Jeremy Wanek (Arwen VFX), Kevin Barbare, and to Josh Ethier for letting us pretend to yell at you.
story_txt:
PART 2 OF THIS CAMPAIGN HAS LAUNCHED!! Please head over to: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/scary-sleepover-the-resurrection-continues#/
 UPDATED - JULY 1, 2020: Our new campaign has opened! Click the above link to head over to PART 2!
WHAT IS SCARY SLEEPOVER?Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER is an on-line reality series that features some of the biggest names in genre entertainment like you've never seen them before... in their pajamas! In each episode a different celebrity artist joins filmmaker Adam Green (HATCHET, FROZEN) for a slumber party at his studio where they spend the night playing games, watching movies, eating junk food, and having extremely candid conversations that reveal their biggest real life fears. To date the 29 existing episodes have been watched over 1 million times between ArieScope.com and ArieScope's YouTube channel. It was Green's goal in creating SCARY SLEEPOVER to not only entertain audiences but to provide a true connection between artists and fans. While the show may be inherently funny and contain some truly hilarious moments, it is also bursting with genuine heart due to each guest's personal relationship with Green and how comfortable they are opening up about themselves so honestly. Through its many emotional and revealing moments SCARY SLEEPOVER has given fans a much deeper look at who these artists really are and just how much we all truly have in common as a community. 
THE GUESTS SO FAR:Previous guests have include: Slash (GUNS N ROSES), Sid Haig (THE DEVIL'S REJECTS), Kane Hodder (FRIDAY THE 13TH), Danielle Harris (HALLOWEEN), Dee Snider (TWISTED SISTER), Derek Mears (SWAMP THING), Bill Moseley (THE DEVIL'S REJECTS), Emma Bell (THE WALKING DEAD), Tony Todd (CANDYMAN), Joe Lynch (MAYHEM), Brea Grant (DEXTER), Felissa Rose (SLEEPAWAY CAMP), Neil Marshall (GAME OF THRONES), Ti West (HOUSE OF THE DEVIL), Kristina Klebe (HALLOWEEN), Lucky McKee (MAY), Clare Kramer (BUFFY THE VAMPIRE SLAYER), Todd Farmer (MY BLOODY VALENTINE), Tiffany Shepis (VICTOR CROWLEY), Tom Holland (CHILD'S PLAY), Laura Ortiz (HOLLISTON), Darren Lynn Bousman (SAW), Zach Galligan (GREMLINS), and Jeffrey Reddick (FINAL DESTINATION).
THE HISTORY OF SCARY SLEEPOVER:Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER originally ran from 2015 - 2017. Full-length uncensored versions of episodes ran on ArieScope.com while ArieScope's YouTube Channel carried shortened versions. The show was (and remains) free to watch no matter which platform you watched it on.  As beloved as the series may have become, unfortunately our model of making the show with our own money and giving it away to fans for free eventually took its toll on us. Producing the show was taking up all of our time and we were sinking further and further into debt the longer we worked on it. So it was with a heavy heart that we had to roll up our sleeping bags and say goodnight to the slumber parties. The amount of work that goes into producing an episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER is on par with an episode of any network television reality show - only we were doing it without a budget of any kind whatsoever.  Not only is a crew required for every shoot but episodes can take anywhere from 40 to 60 hours  (if not longer) to complete post-production. We were having to work through the nights and over the weekends around our actual production jobs in order to make SCARY SLEEPOVER happen, often times giving up paid work and falling behind on deadlines in our personal careers.  As much as we loved doing the show, no one involved could carry on producing a show where the people behind it were literally paying to work on it. So after 29 wonderful episodes, the reality of the situation won out and we had to call it a night.
WHAT PROMPTED THE RESURRECTION? Over the past summer two crucial things happened that caused us to start rethinking SCARY SLEEPOVER.  In July an article titled "Adam Green Saved My Life" was posted on NightmareNostalgia.com. In the piece, writer Landon Evanson bravely discussed his on going battle with depression and how SCARY SLEEPOVER had helped him through some of his darkest nights when he was having suicidal thoughts. It wasn't that the series possessed a magical cure for depression but by Landon connecting with the relationships and sincerity on display in SCARY SLEEPOVER, he saw just how fortunate his own friends make his life. We highly encourage you to read Landon's article here. [http://nightmarenostalgia.com/2019/07/13/adam-g...]It was Landon's story that first got us talking about resurrecting SCARY SLEEPOVER. Just like our show had helped him realize what he has in his own life, Landon's article helped us see what we have in our show. Landon, if you see this - thank you for showing us that what we do matters. We're so very grateful that you're still here and that our work could help you when you needed it. Just two months later, our dear friend Sid Haig passed away. Sid was a major part of our ArieScope family having appeared in HATCHET 3, our sit-com HOLLISTON, several of our annual Halloween short films, an episode of our original series HORRIFIED, two episodes of THE MOVIE CRYPT podcast, and two episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER (his original episode in 2015 and the Christmas Special in 2017). While we had known that Sid was ill for a long time and though he had lived the fullest life a man could ever dream of living, his passing was still devastating. Sid had hundreds of films and television shows under his belt - not to mention countless interviews that he had given during his lifetime. Yet out of everything that fans could have turned to when he passed, it was Sid's 2015 episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER that many reached for to remember him with. His episode was suddenly viewed over 100,000 times within the first 48 hours of his passing and in turn, all of the episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER quickly began climbing up and up in views as a whole new audience discovered the series. Once again we began to question our decision for walking away from the show before ever asking the community we were serving for help. We were ready to try and resurrect SCARY SLEEPOVER.  After the financial hit that making the show had caused us the first time around, the most obvious change we knew we'd have to make was that our crew would need to be paid something for all of their hours of work this time around. While our loyal crew may be willing to work on the show for far below any kind of standard industry rates, with bills to pay and children at home to feed... the days of everyone always working for free are over. It was also crucial to all of us that if we were to bring the series back certain technical areas of the production would need to be improved on. For instance, one of our biggest concerns is making sure that we can afford to have a professional sound mixer and operator on set this time around. In making the first two seasons of the show we had to throw out so many incredible moments due to unusable sound. As an example, our final episode (the Christmas Special in 2017) was so plagued with sound problems that it was almost never released at all. Kane Hodder, Danielle Harris, Sid Haig, Bill Moseley, and Felissa Rose were Adam Green's guests for that special episode. In the end, we knew that we couldn't not show the world such an incredible gathering with all of those horror icons having Christmas dinner and a slumber party together, so we fixed up the audio as best as we could and we released the episode with sound that legitimately made us ashamed. To make it worse, we had to throw out many wonderful moments that we captured between the group because the microphones we had weren't working at all. That night was such an incredible moment in time that will never happen again- (Sid would learn that he was seriously ill shortly after we shot) and our audio was unusable simply because we didn't have a budget to work with. It was heartbreaking. And we can't let that happen again. This time around we have to have help.WHAT WE'RE ASKING FOR:In order to keep bringing you new episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER, in order to keep the series independent, and in order to keep the series free to watch and accessible to all... we're asking for a budget of $5,000 (USD) per episode. That's IT. Could we ask for more? Absolutely. Should we? Probably. But right now all we want is to be able to make the show for you again without it negatively effecting our lives and putting us in debt like it did before. For every $5,000 raised we will put a new episode into production. It's that simple. Ultimately you decide just how many episodes you'll get based on how much and how often you donate.Given the size of SCARY SLEEPOVER's audience and how many times the episodes are viewed, the meager $5k per episode budget that we collectively arrived at is more than fair. It is the bare minimum we need to pay our crew something for their work, to improve the quality of the show, and to keep the series free to watch on ArieScope.com and on ArieScope's YouTube channel - platforms that are readily accessible to all. Full disclose- we're extremely nervous that $5k may turn out not to be enough after all of the fees and taxes that get taken out before what we raise even gets to us. Remember, not only does Indiegogo take 5% of what we raise as their own "platform fee" but they also automatically set aside 5% of whatever we raise as a contingency to cover "chargebacks" (backers who default on whatever they pledged). So that's 10% gone right off the bat. Then the banks charge fees on every individual pledge. Every donation that comes from someone within the US has 2.9% + .30 taken out for a "transaction fee" while donations that come from other countries have a much higher amount taken out plus a hefty "transfer fee" (at least $25 or more) on top of that!  Finally, at the end of the year we'll also need to pay taxes on every dollar that came in just like all US citizens have to do. We know this is all information that is likely just making your eyes glaze over and your head spin. No, you don't need to call an exorcist. It's unfortunately just how crowdfunding goes and there is no way around it. We won't know the reality of it until after we've made the first crowd funded episode and see how it went but we're being transparent the whole way. If we have to adjust accordingly moving forward? Well, then we'll have to adjust accordingly. But hopefully you're getting a clear picture of just how much we're trying to make this work on as tight of a budget as possible."ONCE A NEW EPISODE IS GREEN-LIT, HOW LONG BEFORE WE CAN WATCH IT?"Every time we hit another $5,000 goal we'll get started making an episode. Producing an episode can take anywhere from a few weeks to a couple of months. It all depends on guest/crew availability but we usually move rather fast. We'll post updates and include the most accurate ETA we can for when we expect the next episode to be ready. Should we become unavailable for any amount of time due to starting production on our next feature film or television project, it doesn't mean SCARY SLEEPOVER will end. In a perfect world donations are continuously coming in during the time we're away shooting the next big project. That way we come back to this with enough funding ready to make multiple episodes back to back rather than randomly making one here and making one there. It all depends on how the fundraising goes. If things go well and we make a complete season (12 crowd funded episodes + 2 outtake episodes) rather quickly? Well, when the season is over we'll put a pin in the campaign while we take a break and recover, then start it up again once we're ready to tackle a new season. Chances are good it will all work out but we have to be as thorough as possible in these descriptions.Keep in mind, donations go toward the next episode in line being financed. It does not mean you continue to keep getting that reward for all future episodes as well. So, there you go! Rewards!NOW... LET'S DO THIS!While over 1 million people may have already watched Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER, the reality is that very few are actually going to step up and help. They're going to wait and hope that other people donate - then watch the show. It's just how this goes. But if we didn't have at least a little bit of faith in our audience we wouldn't have gone through the effort of making the video you watched above or putting together this campaign. We believe in you!This is the moment when you show us what SCARY SLEEPOVER means to you. Do the slumber parties continue or are they truly over? We sincerely hope that you'll consider backing us generously and continuously as the series (hopefully) continues on and on. Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign.Most sincerely-The ArieScope FamilySCARY SLEEPOVER: RESURRECTION VIDEO made by Sean Becker, Will Barratt, Adam Green, and Arwen. Massive thanks to Lola Barbare ("Arwen"), Jeremy Wanek (Arwen VFX), Kevin Barbare, and to Josh Ethier for letting us pretend to yell at you.

story:
Short Summary 

Jai the cumin, Leo the salt, and Q the pepper pack up their bags and say goodbye to          North Carolina to add to the cultural melting pot that is New York City!  METROS is a Comedy Series that follows our three main characters as they take on all of the absurdities and craziness that comes with this circus of a city, discovering new things about themselves. They are shaped by the creatures who inhabit the concrete jungle through the lens of the millennial metrosexual!

Meet the Metrosexuals!

Jarred Harper (Role of Leo)- Producer, Director, Writer, Actor                                                                                                                                  

Jarred is an actor, writer, and director. Born and raised in Atlanta Georgia and after graduating from The University of Georgia four years ago he moved to New York City to enroll in The William Esper Studio, a two year acting conservatory program. After graduating from acting school Jarred has starred in two Off-Broadway Theater productions in 2018, short films, and web-series. He has now set his sights on creating METROS and is excited to bring the joy and laughter to the audience as much as it has brought him and his METROS team to create!

  • IMDb: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8953979/?ref_=nv_sr_1?ref_=nv_sr_1
  • Instagram: @Jarred_Harper
  • www.Jarredharper.com

Sarang Sharma (Role of Jai)- Producer, Co-Writer, Actor                                                                                                                                    

Sarang, also a graduate of The William Esper Studio, is a first generation Indian-American actor, writer, director, and stand-up comedian based in New York City. He enjoys writing plays and short stories as well and is currently working as a lyricist for upcoming rappers and singers in NYC and Atlanta. Sarang is thrilled to be a representative of the budding new talent of first generation American artists and looks forward to collaborating with artists of all backgrounds to promote the new "American Dream".

  • www.Sarangsharma.com
  • Instagram: @Sarangatan

Quentin Lee Moore (Role of Q)- Actor

Quentin attended Atlantic Acting School’s Evening Conservatory and made his NYC stage debut in the production of Do You Roll Over in the Night at the Linda Gross theater at the completion of his training. He has since appeared in the original short play Woman Illusion (Theater for the New City) and Stepping Through Blood (New Perspectives Theater). He is currently deepening his Atlantic roots through training as a voice coach under Katie Bull and teaching in the high school program, Staging Success. Quentin graduated from the University of South Carolina where he majored in biology/pre-med and minored in psychology where he also earned several All-American honors as a standout track and field athlete. He is a NYC transplant from Chesapeake, VA. He is exceedingly grateful to be a part of the Atlantic Theater team.

  • Backstage: https://www.backstage.com/u/quentinleemoore/
  • Instagram: @Quentinleemoore

Will Kaufman- Cinematographer 

Will is an award winning filmmaker, editor, cinematographer and photographer.  He began his professional career in 2004 working on Emmy Award-winning shows for Red Line Studios, in 2009 he began shooting/producing at MTV Networks, most notably for the Emmy Award Winning Series MADE.  Will’s formidable knowledge and skills developed during his field and studio work for Discovery, ESPN, CMT, CBS, and CNBC. 

  • www.wrkmedia.com

The METROS Mission

With the support and funds raised by you METROS lovin' fools, we will be putting all those dolla bills to the creation of  the Pilot Episode. We will then submit the Pilot to several TV & Film Festivals to gain relationships with producers and financial backing to fund the remaining five episodes for Season One of METROS.

 

Why Are We Crowdfunding?

Broad City, High Maintenance, Insecure, Workaholics, and Portlandia, to name a few, all have gotten their start independently. The TV & Film industry is ever changing and the many great things that have come about recently are the opportunities that artists can make for themselves. Now great television and film ideas are not solely up to the networks and gatekeepers to green light or pass on. Filmmakers and actors now have the ability to work hard and see their creative visions come to fruition.

The METROS team is very excited to take the independent journey and to take you along with us! With the independent route we have the creative control to let the story flourish without any such agenda or limitations. We, as the METROS team, are pumped to get to share our laughs and absurd New York moments with you!

METROS Financial Goal

  • We are on a mission to raise $17,000 for our METROS Pilot Episode!
  • These are how our costs are broken down for the Pilot Episode:

 

 

If money is tight, no worries, anyone can click a button to like & share to spread the word on METROS! :)

story:
The series is now available to watch! Check out Episode 1: 

 

The Story

“Diagnosis: Boring” follows Jess Lowry, the prototypical millennial, whose life changes quickly when her doctor diagnoses her with a potentially fatal case of being “boring.” Jess finds herself in a position that many people today find themselves in; socially connected, employed, healthy, and utterly miserable. We watch as, episode by episode, Jess goes through everyday “cure’s” to depression—therapy apps, self-help gurus, reliance on alcohol— only in the world of “Diagnosis: Boring” these are commonly thought of as remedies for “being boring”.

 

The story of Jess Lowry is very much one of a sane character in an insane world. The trickiness of depression is that it tends to be a sickness that affects the patients logic, and people suffering from it often don't feel like there is anything wrong with them, but rather the world around them. "Diagnosis: Boring" aims to get in Jess's head, to a place where the viewing audience can see things the same way she does. 

The Impact

There is no doubting the steady advance of the social media generation-- the new millennial wave of activism and radical tolerance is an unavoidable subject on any news show or at family dinner-- but with it, a disease has quietly been on the rise, like its shadow: Depression.

From the outside looking in, depression is often defined as being sad. Depression, however, is just the opposite; it is the lack of sadness, it is the lack of happiness, it is the lack of any emotion at all. Depression feels a lot like being bored... by everything and anything.

By externalizing so much of the inner struggle that depression is, "Diagnosis: Boring" looks to bring levity to what can often be considered an extremely heavy subject manner. Hopefully, by bringing laughs to such a serious subject, it will become more approachable, and easier to talk about, at a more public level. 

The Team

Frank Spiro, Writer/Director

Frank Spiro is a writer/comedian/filmmaker currently based out of Chicago, IL. A recent graduate of The Harold Ramis Film School at The Second City in Chicago, IL— the first film school of it's kind to solely teach comedic filmmaking— Frank likes to write surrealist, absurdist comedies. Prior to moving to Chicago, Frank graduated from Tulane University in New Orleans with a degree in poetry, where he was the winner of The Tulane Arts and Film Festival short film prize, and founder of The Tulane Vignette, a satirical newspaper which continues to flourish. In the last few months, Frank has had feature length scripts featured on The Black List website, as well as a pilot script that was a finalist for the Launchpad pilots competition. 

 

Michael Schiff, Producer

Michael is a writer and producer in Chicago and recent graduate at the Harold Ramis Film School at The Second City. Prior to Chicago, Michael produced content for DOGTV in San Francisco. Michael also has an extensive background in marketing, working for tech companies to launch and market products to millions of people. Michael received his Bachelor of Arts degree in Business Economics and Financial Accounting from the University of California, Santa Barbara.

 

Ana Silva, Jess Lowry (lead)

Ana Silva is a native of Portland, OR (the cool Portland), a graduate of AMDA LA/NY, iO Chicago, and The Second City’s Conservatory and House Co. Programs, and was a 2018 NBC Universal and The Second City’s Bob Curry Fellow. Select Credits: She the People [U/S] (Second City Theatricals), In the Heights (Casa 0101/ Teatro Nuevos Horizontes), Searching for Aztlán (Teatro Milagro), and This American Lie (Directed by Anthony LeBlanc). You can see Ana perform around Chicago with her improv teams: Matt Damon Improv (2017 Best Improv Team CWFF), Baby Wants Candy, Improvised Jane Austen, and Dynasty Improv. 

 

Candice Majors, Director of Photography

​

With over five years of professional set & post-production experience, Candice has a diverse body of work providing an artistic eye and strong work ethic. Candice is a graduate of Columbia College Chicago where she majored in Film Production and Cinematography.

 

Lauren Schatzel, Production Designer

Lauren is an artist and director with BFA in sculpture and painting from San Francisco Art Institute and an MS in Leadership for Creative Enterprises from Northwestern University.

 

The Investment

While we already have a good start on funding, there are three main areas of the budget where your contribution will help us: production design, crew support, and post-production.

Production Design

The goal of this web series is to take a sane character and place her in an insane world. This means we have to create the insane world. This is where a significant amount of the budget will go. We are going to work with local Chicago artists, businesses, and locations to build this world into something wholly unique and different.

Crew Support

We want to recruit a diverse and talented crew that will help make this world come to life. And we want to support them for all the hard work. To make five different six minute episodes is going to require a lot of resources, time, and effort from quite a few people. 

Post-Production

While shooting the film itself takes out a large portion of the budget, so does the detailed work that goes into post-production of the film. Once the picture is locked, we'll spend weeks focused on editing, colorization, and sound mixing before it is ready to be released. 

The Thank You

Thank you! Thank you for taking the time to learn about "Diagnosis: Boring." Even if you can't contribute to the fundraiser at this time, we appreciate your interest and would love if you can share this page with others. And if you are able to contribute, we are grateful for it. We believe we're creating something special and we look forward to sharing it with you when it's complete.

story:
We are The Dope Life...and you might be too.

Derek is what many would call a “wanna be”. He’s always been intrigued by hip-hop culture and he tends to standout - especially in a culture of roofers, stay-at-home moms and guys that call you a 'sissy' if you think global warming is real. Hate it or love it, these are the simpler places and Deedleburg likes to keep it that way.

Most aspiring creatives, move to cities to evade the places they were born and raised. But Derek can't. He's stuck in Deebleburg due to the long and drawn-out laws regarding parole. He wants to get out and entertain the world through his raps, dancing or really any opportunity that might bring him fame and glory, but the system and his bad habits stand against him.

The Dope Life is more than just an exploitation or mockery of the suburbs of America. This is a story of the struggles any artistic or radical person faces in the search for self worth, a place in society or at the very least, individual freedom while trapped in an unhealthy environment.

What started out as a quick sketch comedy about a foolish, over-the-top, white-rapper in a red state turned into a script that we have rewritten and evolved into a 5-part series. It grew from 4 years of jokes, witty banter and heart to hearts between myself and Derrick Sloan (Derrick Dillard) on the daily.

The merge of three personalities, an ex-felon, an ex-marine and a probation officer, form The Dope Life. Three contrasting 30-year-old’s with extreme identity flaws are bound together by an existential crisis and passion for their town's least favorite art form - rap music.  They all suffer from mental instabilities spawned by their personal experiences with our American institutions – correctional, military and an often unjust judicial system. 

At face value, Dereck and his peers may seem like a bunch of goofy deadbeats facing dilemmas related to depression, anxiety and other mental illnesses. Yet despite all odds, they carry on with high hopes and plans to escape small town culture – making Deebleburg the battleground of a life worth living. 

 

Putting together a viable film crew is...

EXPENSIVE. We wish we could do it all ourselves, but have found we need financial support in efforts to bring in a Director of Photography, Sound Recordist, Post-Production Editor and a Makeup Artist. While we've compiled a great cast and found locations that will be telling of the atmosphere, Crew talent in Austin, TX is costly and rightly so. Therefore, financial demands are outside of what we servers, teachers and bartenders can afford.

 

For our 25-page script, we will need to shoot for 5 days total.

We've got our eyes set on some really talented and experienced members of the Austin Film Community that are quickly turning into industry pro's. Here's a breakdown of what we need to land them.

Director of Photography - $300/day - $1500/shoot

Sound Engineer/Recordist - $150/day - $750/shoot

Hair/Makeup Artist - $75/day - $375/shoot

Props/Location Expenses - $425

Post Production Editor - $750

Food/Beverage - Anything extra helps but we know how to eat cheap!

 

Monetary support is amazing, but any encouragement is great. 

We wouldn't be here asking for help if we thought we could scrounge up any more than we already have. We know most of our friends and colleagues fall in to the same financial boundaries that we do. So while we greatly appreciate any funding you can afford to help with, a share, a like or even just a text saying "Haha" is super encouraging and we'll use it as fuel to get this pilot done and out to the public.

story:
SEASON 1

Mistake is an original scripted family drama series created by Nicolette Ellis. This show stems from the Wright family mourning the loss of their Matriarch, in this time of sorrow the Love family intertwines themselves into the cracked foundation of the Wrights, and everything begins to fall apart. The show follows two African-American families dealing with completely different levels of an array of elements including alcoholism, teenage pregnancy,  mental health and greed, but the biggest unspoken commonality --survival  

For SZN2 of Mistake Series, Selma star Kent Faulcon and The Finest (abc)  star Dorian Missick serves as executive producer of Mistake, the latest project from actress, writer and director Nicolette Ellis.

The first season of Mistake  is currently streaming on our

  Youtube Channel  and KweliTV.com .

 

Cast from Season 1 

Nicolette Ellis - Maddie Love

Imana Breaux - Shelby Wright

Claudia McCoy- Melissa Wright

Will Strong- Shawn Wright

Dorothy Meyers- Karen Love

David A. Wallace- Michael Love

Cylla Senii- Shayna Montgomery 

Daniel Cunningham- Shawn Wright Jr.

Ayden George- Quincy Wendell

Channing Jackson- Alex James

Atika Greene- Sugar Dan

Tomas Bergland- Jared Lewis

Articles from Season 1

" The show does its due diligence in pulling in an audience, with it’s attention to character development and interloping story lines."

"The web series is a moving tale about the different perspective of family dynamics. It involves real-life issues of abandonment, drug abuse and betrayal, which of course, can be a recipe for disaster."

"After watching the first two episodes of Mistake,  I quickly wandered the official website to find out when the next episode will be. Both episodes left me wanting MORE!

“Mistake” takes you on so many twist and turns you may even have to replay episodes to uncover the full story.

Why is SZN2 needed?

Mistake is a series that speaks on plenty of issues that are often completely overlooked when it pertains to the African-American community. We feel it is our duty to continue to shed light on issues that plague our people and strive to  be the voice and vision for those who are going through the same thing as these characters are. The incredible journey with these characters has just begun and we want you to see where each and every storyline goes.  We would love the opportunity to continue sharing this journey with you all, creating a story that shows how everything unfolds, and who is left standing when the dust finally settles. 

The Team for SZN2 

 

Nicolette Ellis (Actress/Writer/Creator/Director/Executive Producer)

Kent Faulcon (Executive Producer) 

Dorian Missick (Executive Producer)

Imana Breaux (Actress/ Producer/ Music Supervisor)

Cylla Seni (Actress/ Producer/ Business Development)

David A. Wallace  (Actor/ Consulting Producer)

Driven Society (PR) 

Bianca Lominy (PR, Founder of Honey B Media Group) 

THE CREW of SZN2

Shot by: WELTHĒ IMAGES

https://www.weltheimages.com

Timeline for our Campaign

Mistake season 2 crowd fund campaign will run for 45 days. During this time, we'll be in pre-production with the goal of shooting the second season this summer July-August! 

We need to raise at least 12K to have a successful SZN2 of Mistake Series.

 

Your Support  

Your support won't only help us pay everyone a wage (!) for the shoot, rent equipment, feed the cast and crew, and supply post-production services, it'll also help us demonstrate to others that Mistake has support from a wide group of amazing people - who believe in us!

SPREAD. THE. WORD. 

                                           

Donations help, but also spreading the word about our campaign for Season 2 of Mistake. 

  • Tweet it
  • Instagram it
  • Facebook it
  • Whatsapp it
  • Snapchat it

Please  share it Tag us on ALL social media platforms at @MistakeSeries

MistakesSeries.com
story_txt:
SEASON 1
Mistake is an original scripted family drama series created by Nicolette Ellis. This show stems from the Wright family mourning the loss of their Matriarch, in this time of sorrow the Love family intertwines themselves into the cracked foundation of the Wrights, and everything begins to fall apart. The show follows two African-American families dealing with completely different levels of an array of elements including alcoholism, teenage pregnancy,  mental health and greed, but the biggest unspoken commonality --survival  
For SZN2 of Mistake Series, Selma star Kent Faulcon and The Finest (abc)  star Dorian Missick serves as executive producer of Mistake, the latest project from actress, writer and director Nicolette Ellis.
The first season of Mistake  is currently streaming on our

story:
Why this is important!

It's easy to get swept up in the excitement of a crowdfunder that will launch an important Christian film, or series. You guys have always been there for me and the team, and have helped to fund both Genesis and now Quantum! Equally important to those previous crowdfunders is the need to ensure we have the proper workspace to make these features. The original funds from the Quantum campaign did set aside a small budget for hardware, which was used to upgrade the CPUs and RAM of the 20 server machines (Thank you!). However, the workstations are starting to show signs of failure and are in need of new parts. You can also see in the video above that the render machines are not housed in a proper rack (tower), nor are they in a separate room from my office which gets hot and noisy. We've been roughing it for a while and now it's time for a move to the perfect location where we can continue these amazing Christian productions indefinitely, and with that move comes the opportunity to set the work space up right! So I've created a little "mini" crowdfunder in which I'm asking if you'll help me to raise a small amount to make this move and upgrade possible. Will you please help?

 

 

What will be upgraded?

  • 10% New wires, tubing, ducts, hardware store supplies
  • 15% of the budget will get the AC unit installed, to cool the render farm down
  • 25% of the budget will be for building temporary walls and ventilation 
  • 10% of the budget will go towards the server rack, desk and infrastructure
  • 25% of the budget will go to critical hardware upgrades to components that are failing
  • 15% will be for misc. needs (such as the electrician's work in wiring the place up)

 

 

Office Perks

In addition to having your name in the credits, we also thought it would be fun to name the 20 servers after their respective donors who are providing them a proper home. I have also added some hero perks in which the donor will be sponsoring those items single-handed!

 

Thank You!

You guys truly are an amazing blessing from God. Thank you for giving us the initial funds to start producing the series, and a special thanks to all of you on Patreon who have been supporting us each month! Once we have this office migration completed, we'll be all set to start wrapping up on the newly expanded episode one. For more details on the changes we made to episode one, an update video will be released shortly. So if you haven't subscribed already, please go to the sevenfoldfilms.com website and join our mailing list. God bless!

story:
Hello everyone, I’m Prudence Sneed the creator, writer and director of Southern Truths. I have had the pleasure of working through the endless progress of this web series project since Spring of 2017. Many of you know me from our community, church or schools and have watched my aspiring acting career since the age of 14. I would like to say thank you for these endless years of support from the bottom of my heart.

Southern Truths is an independent project. With an independent project also known as “Indie”, there were many times corners had to be cut and scenes simply didn’t make it to the screen as planned due to the lack of time, equipment and resources.  We have spent the last two years learning from those lessons. One of the main lessons learned is, “you can’t cut corners”. The funds raised in this campaign will allow us to reach not only quality filming goals but also the ability to submit, and be present in the upcoming film festivals. We will be able to have everything needed for production and post production.

With the help of each and every one of you, not only will we be able to complete season 3 in a stellar recorded fashion, but you will also be ensuring that our actors are remaining employed and active. And in today’s era of COVID-19 this would be an added blessing for many of us.

We are raising $6,000. This ensures not just the production of Season 3 of Southern Truths but it will also add in covering the following:

  • Costs for pre and post-production
  • Costs for feeding cast during scheduled shoots
  • Costs for securing locations for filming
  • Costs for film festival entries
  • Costs for styling and make-up

Some of the added features that we enjoy supplying our cast and crew with are special designed apparel, Southern Truths keepsakes and for those actors who are joining the cast from surrounding cities such as Austin, Houston, etc., we offer hotel accommodations (equivalent to Holiday Inn Express) as well as a travel stipend.  

Please be assured that in the event we do not raise the goal amount of $6,000.00 by November 19, 2020, any and all funds donated will still be allocated to all areas mentioned above. It will be evenly applied to assure the best outcome possible.

I understand that making an adjustment to your budget during a time like today can be scary. I look at it this way, you all have thoroughly enjoyed watching numerous shows you may have never had the opportunity to watch during a pandemic such as this. From Netflix to Amazon Prime, your viewing pleasure has been at your fingertips. Now you not only have the opportunity to watch something new and refreshing but you’ll also be investing in this project. You’ll be investing in someone’s career, you’ll be investing in the arts in Dallas, Tx and you’ll be allowing someone like myself an opportunity that they otherwise would have never had.

As with any business opportunity, there is adversity. And we are well prepared for the adversity that will come our way. As it relates to COVID-19, we are ensuring staff and actors are all practicing self-distancing as well as checking temperatures upon arrival. Everyone will be required to wear their mandated masks unless they are on set filming. These are the things we can somewhat control and it’s our biggest adversity to date. Our other challenge would be securing our locations due to capacity restrictions however, we have been very careful during the writing phase to ensure we are not asking for over crowded scenes that would place anyone in harms way during this time.   

Not everyone can donate financially and we understand that more than anyone. You can still help us in a major way and that’s by getting the word out about Southern Truths to all your friends, family and co-workers. Just share the link to your social media sites and/or website and feel free to tag us in it so that we can show you all some love back. Every little bit counts.

It takes a Village and our Village has helped us create some successful moments. Join us in making our upcoming season not only successful but magical.

story:
Hi! I'm Chris Russell. I'm a screenwriter, filmmaker and actor. Two years ago, I quit my job as a hotel doorman. Being a doorman was a big part of my identity, and was the inspiration for my first web series. It was also how I kept a roof over my head and maintained health insurance. I gave up the stability of a full-time job to pursue my lifelong dream of being an actor. It was the greatest risk of my life. I had no other work lined up -- only a small amount of savings, and a whole helluva-lot of hustle.

The risk has paid off. In the time that has passed, I got an agent, booked some commercials, joined SAG, and landed a recurring role on an HBO series. And yet, despite all of those wonderful advances in my career, I still find myself scrapping to get by in-between gigs, drowning in bills and scrounging to take any job I can to keep me afloat. 

Which brings me to "Flyering". 

One of the many "survival jobs" I work is handing out flyers in the streets. Have you seen these people before? Of course you have! Have you acknowledged them? Be honest... Yeah, neither did I... till I actually had to do it for an entire day. 

I knew almost immediately that this was a breeding ground for bizarre, fascinating human interaction. On top of that, I've met some amazingly talented artists, who are also fighting to keep the dream alive while doing whatever they can to make a few bucks while chasing the dream. 

They are the guts of what my show is about. Your contributions will help this hilarious and heartfelt story come to life. 

What We Need 

We're asking for $10,000:

- To pay and feed our crew.

- To pay and feed our actors. 

- To rent quality equipment. 

The Team

Chris Russell (creator):

Chris has appeared in over 50 films, TV shows, and commercials. Recent credits include a recurring role on HBO's The Deuce, and a guest spot on NBC's Law and Order: SVU.  His short films, Doorman and Anna Robot, have received acclaim from several prestigious film festivals and contests throughout the country. Chris has also recently found success as an on-camera acting coach. His popular workshop Breaking into Film and Television with Chris Russell, is ongoing at the Matthew Corozine Studio Theatre in New York City. 

Kevin Losani (producer, cinematographer, editor):

Kevin is a producer, director, dp, editor and vfx artist. His work spans over a variety of video formats that include narrative films, commercials, music videos and documentaries. With varied collective film making teams, Kevin has received multiple NY Emmy awards, Tele awards, Webby honors, AP Editors honors and a circuit of indie Film Festival recognition.

story:
What makes SCALES different?

The show represents a community that has not been able to have their story told and represented. The series looks at characters moving through challenges in life through a lens without placing society-based labels on who and how these characters love. In SCALES, the social norms of what is acceptable are non-existent. Remy is a successful editor of successful Atlanta based magazine and by all standards, could be a heterosexual male.

Remy is successful in his work life and has awesome friendships, but his inability to balance love is his achilles heel. Audiences care about Remy and the plight of his friendships, and who he loves is less important. There are many norms to being gay and SCALES casually points out those norms. Gavin, who rounds out the trio who is a trans-male. Gavin’s journey in SCALES is not to educate you on what trans mean or what it looks like but what being a relationship in turmoil looks like, regardless of the two parties involved.

SCALES focuses on the dynamics and beauty of the friendships with problems that other person faces, regardless of race, gender, etc... Being unapologetic in SCALES means being comfortable in your own skin and that is what sets this Drama-Comedy genre apart from other shows. The intentional vibe around SCALES includes music featured by all independent artists that personifies the beauty of independent filmmaking. These unknowns will resonate with audiences as the story of SCALES is being told by an indie creator, who’s been given a platform to share such original programming.

The Impact

There has been no show that portrays such an appreciation for diversity without labeling characters for their orientation in years. Currently there is no content on television that showcases the type of characters that SCALES has. 

 

  • SCALES has received over 87k views and has received numerous awards in less than six months since its debut. The series has also gained over 1,060 subscribers.
  • It's a show that's unapologetically inclusive! 

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Production value could be impacted - shooting in high quality with experienced cinematographers can be expensive . Film permits in Atlanta can range from 200-400 dollars. 
  • To meet any challenges we will stick to our goal of shooting six episodes over two weekends as we did it in Feb 2018 & 2019. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word about our show on YouTube , Instagram and Facebook. (Scales, The Web Series)

story:
COVID Ditty is keeping New York Actors Creative and Working Through Tough Times

A Bronx-bred, film-TV-theater actor, Steve is a character actor who typically plays working-class people. Sometimes, he plays complementary roles such as an attorney opposite a headliner, like multiple Grammy- and Tony-Award winner Patti LaPone in FX’s hit show POSE. 

But the COVID-19 pandemic has changed things, including Steve. After months of isolation and continuous death-toll updates, he subconsciously decided to squint so he could see the humor amid the wreckage.

“There is a place for the human expression of some sort of  joy—or we would have all gone crazy,” says Steve, who shook the room with his booming voice as the miserable Ghost of Jacob Marley in A Christmas Carol in Harlem at the Classic Theater of Harlem—before the pandemic shut down everything.

Suddenly, Steve saw juxtapositions and inequities everywhere. Schools and houses of worship closed down, but liquor stores, fast-food joints and the state lottery were open for business. Teachers expressed concern about going back to work, while minimum-wage workers at McDonald’s dished “essential” burgers seemingly around the clock.

With Broadway locked down, Steve has started a new NYC production during the pandemic—about the pandemic—with his own cobbled-together life savings. He recently began writing an eight-part “dramedy”—COVID Ditty—a series of short vignettes that captures glimpses of oddities and ironies that we have all been too numb to fully digest. Steve is the writer, the director and the lead as “Phil”, who is a simple, lumbering, lunch-pail guy trying to make sense of the new world order.

Steve’s other new role is one of job creator. So far, he has hired SAG-AFTRA actors, like himself, for Episode 1, as well as an editor, a Go Pro cameraman, someone in charge of music, a production team and a digital marketing firm with a publicist to get the word out. 

According to Steve, New York City is the tale of two cities: the posh “Goldman Sachs New York” who have the resources to cut and run to the Hamptons, Miami or points beyond when the going gets tough and the blue-collar families who grind and endure, making the city’s gears turn every day—even when the New York Post’s headline screams, “New York City is Dead Forever.”

“COVID Ditty is a New Yorker’s love letter to his neighborhood,” Steve says. “It’s a love letter for the people who went through 9/11 and the people who are going through this pandemic—and they are still HERE. They love the city. They see the good in people. They are rising above the news, all the partisan anger and rancor. They are regular joes, trying to get by. There are plenty of those people out there.” Now COVID Ditty hopes to keep production of the additional episodes  moving forward with help from the greater community. 

 

Help Keep COVID Ditty Progressing....

Steve, in his own words:

I always bet on a sure thing. The COVID Ditty web series is a testament to the hard-working NYC families who have chosen to stay and fight. I have reached into my SAG-AFTRA retirement savings to produce the first scripts for Season One, but I need your help to finish the eight-part series. We have actors, an editor and a production team counting on us. We are an economic engine that is putting money into the local Bronx economy. Every time a coffee is bought over a script meeting, a lunch is served on set or an interior location is used, a local Kingsbridge business benefits. The arts are job creators! If you believe New Yorkers don’t quit, please make a contribution today to keep this work alive. For donations more than $60, I’ll throw in a t-shirt that captures this memorable work during an unforgettable time.

The Impact

ALL donations will keep the show in production and contribute to keeping NY artists and crew working through this difficult time that has especially impacted artists and creatives across this city, the country and the world.

  • Support NYC actors and neighborhoods
  • Contribute to a heartfelt, relevant series that can share light to many during a difficult time.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please go to https://stevegreensteinactor.com/covid-ditty/ to check out the first episodes  and @covidditty for Social Media, and share COVID Ditty, to spread the word about this project. Every little bit helps!
story_txt:
COVID Ditty is keeping New York Actors Creative and Working Through Tough Times
A Bronx-bred, film-TV-theater actor, Steve is a character actor who typically plays working-class people. Sometimes, he plays complementary roles such as an attorney opposite a headliner, like multiple Grammy- and Tony-Award winner Patti LaPone in FX’s hit show POSE. 
But the COVID-19 pandemic has changed things, including Steve. After months of isolation and continuous death-toll updates, he subconsciously decided to squint so he could see the humor amid the wreckage.
“There is a place for the human expression of some sort of  joy—or we would have all gone crazy,” says Steve, who shook the room with his booming voice as the miserable Ghost of Jacob Marley in A Christmas Carol in Harlem at the Classic Theater of Harlem—before the pandemic shut down everything.
Suddenly, Steve saw juxtapositions and inequities everywhere. Schools and houses of worship closed down, but liquor stores, fast-food joints and the state lottery were open for business. Teachers expressed concern about going back to work, while minimum-wage workers at McDonald’s dished “essential” burgers seemingly around the clock.
With Broadway locked down, Steve has started a new NYC production during the pandemic—about the pandemic—with his own cobbled-together life savings. He recently began writing an eight-part “dramedy”—COVID Ditty—a series of short vignettes that captures glimpses of oddities and ironies that we have all been too numb to fully digest. Steve is the writer, the director and the lead as “Phil”, who is a simple, lumbering, lunch-pail guy trying to make sense of the new world order.
Steve’s other new role is one of job creator. So far, he has hired SAG-AFTRA actors, like himself, for Episode 1, as well as an editor, a Go Pro cameraman, someone in charge of music, a production team and a digital marketing firm with a publicist to get the word out. 
According to Steve, New York City is the tale of two cities: the posh “Goldman Sachs New York” who have the resources to cut and run to the Hamptons, Miami or points beyond when the going gets tough and the blue-collar families who grind and endure, making the city’s gears turn every day—even when the New York Post’s headline screams, “New York City is Dead Forever.”
“COVID Ditty is a New Yorker’s love letter to his neighborhood,” Steve says. “It’s a love letter for the people who went through 9/11 and the people who are going through this pandemic—and they are still HERE. They love the city. They see the good in people. They are rising above the news, all the partisan anger and rancor. They are regular joes, trying to get by. There are plenty of those people out there.” Now COVID Ditty hopes to keep production of the additional episodes  moving forward with help from the greater community. 
 

Help Keep COVID Ditty Progressing....
Steve, in his own words:
I always bet on a sure thing. The COVID Ditty web series is a testament to the hard-working NYC families who have chosen to stay and fight. I have reached into my SAG-AFTRA retirement savings to produce the first scripts for Season One, but I need your help to finish the eight-part series. We have actors, an editor and a production team counting on us. We are an economic engine that is putting money into the local Bronx economy. Every time a coffee is bought over a script meeting, a lunch is served on set or an interior location is used, a local Kingsbridge business benefits. The arts are job creators! If you believe New Yorkers don’t quit, please make a contribution today to keep this work alive. For donations more than $60, I’ll throw in a t-shirt that captures this memorable work during an unforgettable time.

The Impact
ALL donations will keep the show in production and contribute to keeping NY artists and crew working through this difficult time that has especially impacted artists and creatives across this city, the country and the world.

Support NYC actors and neighborhoods
Contribute to a heartfelt, relevant series that can share light to many during a difficult time.


Other Ways You Can Help
Please go to https://stevegreensteinactor.com/covid-ditty/ to check out the first episodes  and @covidditty for Social Media, and share COVID Ditty, to spread the word about this project. Every little bit helps!

story:
Meet Claire and Shelley!

Hi, we're Claire and Shelley. We're biracial sisters who live in Bushwick, Brooklyn. We lost our mom to cancer when we were young. She was white. We were raised by our single black dad. Losing her at such a young age influenced our work as artists and how we identify as women of color.

We live together in Bushwick, Brooklyn, and spend our free time at Eugene’s Candy Shop, and look at the kittens in the pet shop down the street. When we get paid, our favorite #treatyoself spot is the taco truck parked on our block. Otherwise, we live off of taquis, blocks of cheddar cheese, and boxed wine. Our apartment doesn’t have a fire alarm, but we do have mice, bugs, and chill landlords.

This Campaign is to raise funds for our series Dear Sister Directed, Produced, Written, and Starring Claire and Shelley Fort

Dear Sister is...

Whimsical. Joyful. Brilliant.

We want the audience to see themselves within a piece of our story. Dear Sister offers viewers time to dream, laugh, and process our collective anger, fear, and anxiety we carry as black people in America.

We're inspired to write about how we preserve our family history and how we navigate the space between being black and white, and our journey through loss, grief, and ultimately- healing.

Your Impact.

Where your Donations Go:

By supporting our project, you are giving our incredibly talented cast and crew of Black Female Filmmakers, which is predominately Female QTPOC,  the opportunity to work behind and in front of the camera.

Season 1 of Dear Sister includes 5 episodes approx. 10 minutes each, shooting summer ‘19

We’re looking to raise a total of $10,000. This will go towards production costs and paying our incredibly talent cast and crew.

Here’s a detailed breakdown of what your contribution covers:

PRODUCTION COSTS:

Production Team:

Cast, Director,  DP, Sound Mixer, Lighting Design, Gaffer and so many other amazing creatives

  • Location: Location rentals and set design costs
  • Equipment Rental: Quality Camera, Lighting and Sound
  • Craft Services
  • Post-Production
  • Editing
  • Sound Mixing
  • Color Correction
  • Film Festival Entry Fees
  • IndieGoGo Fees

Why Now?

Dear Sister celebrates family, legacy and the necessity of storytelling as act of activism.

If you aren’t able to contribute right now, please help us by getting the word out on social media!

Insta: fortsisters

Twitter: fortsistersfilm

Facebook: fortsistersfilm

Claire has an M.F.A in acting from the University of Washington. Shelley has an M.F.A. in acting from Brown University. They both are graduates of Kenyon College.
