story:
Short Summary

Have you ever found yourself among a group of women and you wondered what they were really thinking? Maybe you considered the possibility of that smile on their face being fake, because how could someone really be that happy in this chaotic world?

Maybe you have been trying to live up to the standard of the proverbs 31 woman not realizing she was a fictional character in a poem written by a queen to her son. Maybe you have been trying to do all the things she did, instead of discovering the virtues that exist in a proverbs 31 woman.

No matter which you are, we believe that Ruby Unleashed will unlock the woman within that has been longing to come out and be accounted for.

Hi, My name is Deborah Watson, and I'm the founder for Studio 2.22 Films in Branson, Mo. For years, I have watched people be passed over for a promotion for one reason or another. Normal, every day people with extraordinary talent, hidden inside but never having the opportunity to come out and shine.

I have also been "one of those" that was stuck in the "doing the proverbs 31 woman thing" instead of focusing on the character of a woman. I was exhausting myself "rising early" and providing more than enough for everyone in the house. Staying up late at night to make sure things were achieved. Yes, I even longed for giving birth to a child to be a great mom! But that day didn't come biologically, and I always felt like a failure. Until I came to grips with who a Proverbs 31 woman really was.

She's every day people. Single women. She's refined. She's casual. She likes to cook, and possibly hunt, and even write parables to encourage others in their faith.

What We Need & What You Get

Right now we need to finish paying off the cost for a pilot we built to send to the networks. We are also raising support to pay for the setup fees for the rubyunleashed.com website.

The team has worked hard already and will continue together as we head into preproduction for the first Season.

Once we pay for the remaining balances, we will be free to move forward with the Season I production.

The Impact

The impact of Ruby Unleashed will be to help bring fun, Christian, faith-based programs to mainstream television and give other options for entertainment on the networks. It's written in such a way that Christian, or non-Christian people can watch it and laugh together, cry together, wonder what's going to happen to Ruby together.

Risks & Challenges

Life can be messy. We have chosen to include real life struggles handled through biblical principles. We're not going to shy away from some topics because women deal with them. It doesn't matter if they attend church or not. There are clear answers to todays issues and it's time that they are talked about in mainstream media.

We've been criticized for calling it "Ruby Unleashed- The adventures of a proverbs 31 woman" The train of thought is that people won't give it a chance because it's too "churchie". We're hoping they do give it a chance, once they meet the characters in the story and realize the validity of the message.

How You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can help out financially. We're a firm believing group of people that understand this fact, we're five people away from talking to whomever we need to talk to, so that we can achieve whatever it is we need to achieve. If you can't help out the campaign financially, feel free to share it with your friends. Maybe one of them is praying for an opportunity like this. Or you can visit our website at rubyunleashed.com and visit the about us page. There is a link you can share your story with Ruby and the gang. Who knows, maybe your story will actually become part of the script if you want. The possibilities are endless.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

In Development is being produced by both students and recently graduated "adults" who are just beginning to make our impact on the industry. We faced significant pre-production challenges that were largely helped by Volunteer Lawyers for the Arts, and are thrilled to be moving forward. Our goal is to produce work that makes people laugh- plain and simple. So many people look forward to going home and catching up on their favorite series, and we're hoping that we can become that series in the near future. Is there anything quite like that feeling? (Ok, maybe when you don't get charged for guac, but not much else). 

With your contribution, you are directly impacting the quality of In Development. From equipment, to actors, to crew meals, every penny counts to making sure we have the best and brightest working on our show- the future of laughter depends on it.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3,000 to cover essential production costs, such as:

  1. Equipment: Lights, Camera, Action would be pretty hard to carry out without lights...or a camera. We have rental packages from Adorama and Gotham Sound to make sure our production looks and sounds top notch, which is essential for putting our best foot forward when pitching our full season in the future.
  2. Actors: Our project will be registered with the Screen Actors Guild, which means that we are recruiting some of the best talent we know. These funds will also be allocated to paying our actors.
  3. Crew Meals: Every six hours on set, it is customary to feed your cast and crew. These crew meals will help tremendously on 12 hour shoot days and provide the sustenance needed to get the job done!

What Happens if We Don't Reach Our Whole Goal?

We are positive we will. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, we are looking for help in more ways than just cash contributions. You can also help by both sharing the link to our Indiegogo campaign with literally everyone you know.

Literally. Everyone.

And then follow us on Instagram: @indevelopmentpilot

story:
Hi, I'm Marrissa, 

I've been a storyteller for the stage and the screen for the past decade, in the last year I have produced three short films under Mighty Mice Media Co. 

But only now do I feel ready to break into what I've always wanted to do - narratives for the small screen! I've had a lot of ideas over the last two years but F*CK STAN is the perfect jumping off point - it's real, it's challenging, it's a little adventurous and a lot of fun. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have a great team and a great story, now we just need a great support system to get us over the top. We don't want to just ask for money and then give you some trinket you won't really need, we want you. We want your eyes and ears and minds. We want your thoughts, your criticisms, and your laughs. Everyone who donates will get to be included in the process and will have an influence on the final product; from getting to see the film while it's in editing to coming to our set and being with us in the moment!

Risks & Challenges

Our main challenge will be filming all 3 episodes in 4 days. We are doing extensive prep work including location scouts, actor rehearsals, story boards, etc. A lot of hard work is going into this project and we're going to work our asses off to make sure it all pays off!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't Contribute? We totally get it but if you like what you see and you want to see F*CK STAN, please share our campaign on your social media. Every click helps!

story:
The Grey Sweatpants Battle Royal

Let's try it again! Grey Sweatpants are self explainatory. Men love to wear them and women love to look at them. We just trying to see something.

In conjunction with GCW and Allie Kat's Real Hot Girl Shit, the Grey Sweatpants will be an special attraction where half of the proceeds will go to the participants and other half of the proceeds will go to Planned Parenthood. My goal is to get the boys paid and Planned Parenthood paid. Donate what you can.

story:
ABOUT CHEVY AND CAPRICE:

Chevy and Caprice is a web series that follows two black girls that meet at their absolutely lowest point in life. After discovering they both have supernatural talents they form a friendship. On their journey to improve their circumstances they discover that their abilities aren’t always good and end up creating a lot of turmoil and collateral damage along the way. 

 

What We Need....

Your contribution will go to covering expenses for equipment, locations, permits, craft service and paying cast and crew. We'll also be using contributions to buy all kinds of props, costumes, and supplies for set design.

 

The Impact

This series will be a hilarious journey that tackles real issues that affects black women from all walks of life. As Black producers we want to tell stories about people of color through various lenses. It is our duty as creators to contribute content to the culture.

 

Meet The Team

WRITER/DIRECTOR

Petey - is a Haitian American boy that grew up in south Florida. He loves telling stories that can spark conversations about inclusion. When all else fails sticky rice and mango will always do the trick for him. Currently living in LA and writing his 4th feature film, Petey hopes to share Chevy and Caprice with the world.

 

CAST

Chaz Shermil Hodges -  is an avid reader, writer, poet, and actress. Originally from Chicago this woke brown girl, made her way to sunny California to complete her MFA at UCSD. Obviously fish tacos are a favorite. She currently works regionally in theater, she teaches and directs at the Berkeley Playhouse, and has made some very cool television debuts.

 

Jasmine Ashanti - is a Haitian American actress residing in Los Angeles CA. She is originally from PG County, Maryland. Jasmine received a BA in theater from Temple University and MFA in acting from UC, San Diego. Theater credits: The Last Tiger in Haiti (Co-pro Berkeley Rep, La Jolla Playhouse), Ready Steady Yeti Go (Rogue Machine Theatre). Since moving to LA, Jasmine has done many voice over spots including the Netflix cartoon "LEGO Friends" numerous national commercials, The ABC discovers showcase and guest starring roles on The Good Doctor, Black-ish, Lucifer, and On My Block--

story:
OUR STORY

Callers is an original television pilot written by Andee Buccheri, an actress, comedian, and writer based in New York City. Callers takes us into the world of Alicia, who is trying to get by as a college student in New York by working at her University’s call center. When their office gets rocked by an insurmountable challenge, Alicia and her co-workers resort to comedic and desperate measures in order to save their jobs.

 

OUR BUDGET

We have an incredible team of New York University students, alumni, and affiliates who are working together to bring this hilarious and all-too-real story to life. In order to make this happen, we need your help!

  • Festival Submissions: In order to be noticed by television networks and streaming services, we must submit our final product to film festivals and film markets. Each submission costs money, and we would love to submit to as many festivals as possible in order to get our project noticed.

  • Equipment: We want our project to look as professional and aesthetically pleasing as possible, which requires professional camera, lighting, and sound equipment.

  • Insurance: A set of this size needs insurance for equipment, cast, and crew. That way if anything (or anyone…) breaks, we’re covered.

  • Food and Transportation: Our cast and crew will be working long hours in order to tell this story, and we want to make sure they are taken care of.

  • Cast and Crew Compensation: While our budget is too small to pay everyone as much as they deserve, we do want to offer them something for their hard work and immense talent.

 

OUR TEAM

Andee Buccheri - Creator / Executive Producer

Andee Buccheri is an actress, comedian, and writer born and raised in central Connecticut. She has a BFA in Drama from NYU's Tisch School of the Arts and can be seen in and around New York doing standup with Laughing Buddha Comedy, among others.

 

Peter Mancuso - Director

Peter Mancuso is a writer and director studying at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. Born and raised in Coventry, Rhode Island, he hopes to receive his BFA in Film and Television in the spring of 2019. He likes long walks around the neighborhood and when people make a small contribution of $18.31, in honor of NYU's inaugural year.

 

Sabeen Shalwani - Producer

Sabeen Shalwani is a producer and production manager based in NYC. She uses creative means to bring light to contemporary social issues. Sabeen is currently pursuing a BFA in Film and Television at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts.

 

Eric Campos - Executive Producer

Eric couldn't be happier to be producing content that's based on his own likeness. A voice actor and native Mexican, he can be found doing funny voices, sometimes for money and sometimes just because. Most recently can be heard on the Dora the explorer spinoff: Dora and Friends: Into the City!

 

Thalia Romina - Executive Producer

Thalia Romina is an actor born and raised in Queens, New York. After graduating from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts, she has been performing in educational and political theatre with Teatro SEA and Omaha Theater Company respectively. She spends her free time eating pasta and obsessing over Jeremy Renner.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Thank you for taking the time to learn about our television pilot! If you are unable to donate, please consider sharing our campaign on social media.

Facebook: facebook.com/CallersTVShow

Twitter: twitter.com/CallersTVShow

Instagram: instagram.com/CallersTV

Email: callerstv@gmail.com

 

LOGO DESIGN BY: Siddharth Ghandi
story_txt:
OUR STORYCallers is an original television pilot written by Andee Buccheri, an actress, comedian, and writer based in New York City. Callers takes us into the world of Alicia, who is trying to get by as a college student in New York by working at her University’s call center. When their office gets rocked by an insurmountable challenge, Alicia and her co-workers resort to comedic and desperate measures in order to save their jobs. OUR BUDGETWe have an incredible team of New York University students, alumni, and affiliates who are working together to bring this hilarious and all-too-real story to life. In order to make this happen, we need your help!
Festival Submissions: In order to be noticed by television networks and streaming services, we must submit our final product to film festivals and film markets. Each submission costs money, and we would love to submit to as many festivals as possible in order to get our project noticed.
Equipment: We want our project to look as professional and aesthetically pleasing as possible, which requires professional camera, lighting, and sound equipment.
Insurance: A set of this size needs insurance for equipment, cast, and crew. That way if anything (or anyone…) breaks, we’re covered.
Food and Transportation: Our cast and crew will be working long hours in order to tell this story, and we want to make sure they are taken care of.
Cast and Crew Compensation: While our budget is too small to pay everyone as much as they deserve, we do want to offer them something for their hard work and immense talent.
 OUR TEAMAndee Buccheri - Creator / Executive ProducerAndee Buccheri is an actress, comedian, and writer born and raised in central Connecticut. She has a BFA in Drama from NYU's Tisch School of the Arts and can be seen in and around New York doing standup with Laughing Buddha Comedy, among others. Peter Mancuso - DirectorPeter Mancuso is a writer and director studying at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. Born and raised in Coventry, Rhode Island, he hopes to receive his BFA in Film and Television in the spring of 2019. He likes long walks around the neighborhood and when people make a small contribution of $18.31, in honor of NYU's inaugural year. Sabeen Shalwani - ProducerSabeen Shalwani is a producer and production manager based in NYC. She uses creative means to bring light to contemporary social issues. Sabeen is currently pursuing a BFA in Film and Television at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts. Eric Campos - Executive ProducerEric couldn't be happier to be producing content that's based on his own likeness. A voice actor and native Mexican, he can be found doing funny voices, sometimes for money and sometimes just because. Most recently can be heard on the Dora the explorer spinoff: Dora and Friends: Into the City! Thalia Romina - Executive ProducerThalia Romina is an actor born and raised in Queens, New York. After graduating from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts, she has been performing in educational and political theatre with Teatro SEA and Omaha Theater Company respectively. She spends her free time eating pasta and obsessing over Jeremy Renner. OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPThank you for taking the time to learn about our television pilot! If you are unable to donate, please consider sharing our campaign on social media.Facebook: facebook.com/CallersTVShowTwitter: twitter.com/CallersTVShowInstagram: instagram.com/CallersTVEmail: callerstv@gmail.com LOGO DESIGN BY: Siddharth Ghandi

story:
The Story

When the mystery of a child snatched from its mother - WINIFRED NEKESA, at birth grips the nation, Anthony and his team - MIKE, HENRIETTA, and JACINTA, swing into action.  

They follow the story all the way to the doorstep of a celebrated city medic - Dr JAMES BROWN OPONDO, his wife ALICE and his trusty side dish SPACIOUS AKINYI. 

Together this sordid trio run a very lucrative medical practice (THE PRACTICE) and an adoption agency (THE MAKAZI CHILDREN’S FOUNDATION) which serve as fronts for their child trafficking and illegal adoptions operations, with international connections in Serbia, UAE, Dubai and Thailand.

Backed into a corner, Dr Opondo and his associates strike out at Anthony’s family and friends. With death threats and attempts on Anthony’s life in particular, boss lady MARGARET APIO is torn between keeping Anthony in hiding or letting him continue working on the child trafficking case.    

But Margaret is not alone in her concern for her star employee. At home, AYAN - Anthony’s beautiful wife, is 6 months pregnant and frightened at the thought of possibly raising a young family on her own.

Meanwhile, self-styled estate agent mogul ONESMAS MOGAKA - the man at the centre of the storm kicked up by Anthony’s latest exposé, has posted bail and is out for blood. 

What We Need & What You Get

Xodus Productions, Axiom Group & Warrior Films are looking to raise enough support to cover the production costs for the pilot episode of The Reporter. Your support will help us raise funds toward Pre-Production, Production, Post-Production, and Beyond Production costs, which we have broken down below. 

  • Pre: Script Revisions, Location Scouting, Casting, Insurance
  • Prod: Lighting, Audio, Set Dressing, Wardrobe, Location Services, Craft Services, Equipment Rentals, Cast & Crew hiring.
  • Post: Editing, Color Correction, Foley, Sound Mixing & Scoring. 

We have exciting perks to share, ranging from social shoutouts & a behind the scenes e-book to digital screeners. Take a look and find the best fit. 

If we don't reach our goal, we will use whatever we have raised to bring to life as much of the pilot episode as we can before we can shop it around to networks. We are determined to bring The Reporter to life, and we will do as much as possible with what we've got. 

The Impact

Child trafficking is a problem the world over, but it is particularly pervasive in parts of the world where people are poor. Would be traffickers know this and it doesn't take much for them to persuade a struggling parents to part with their children for a few dollars.  

We hope that by telling this story we will:

  • Bring more attention to the world of child trafficking.
  • Educate the public on how to recognize child traffickers and the tactics they employ.
  • Push our governments for tighter controls and close legal loopholes which enable child trafficking to thrive.

Risks & Challenges

Production can be daunting, but with your support we can overcome the fiscal and physical hurdles that await us.  

Xodus Productions, Axiom Group & Warrior Films have a combined production experience of more that 8 years, each one proficient in making television commercials, documentaries and short films. 

Our budget has already been devised, and the pilot will cost roughly $150,000 split between Pre-production, Production, and Post costs.

Each aspect of production is an item on a checklist. We work on each item until the list is complete. As challenges arise we pivot and problem-solve until the issue is resolved. Relying on each other and our extended network of talented artists for advice and guidance. We funded the first two episodes ourselves because we believed in our ability to rise above inevitable obstacles enough to risk our own resources.

Other Ways You Can Help The Reporter

The Reporter is a TV series with very high aspirations. We've assembled a talented and dedicated crew -- all experienced professionals and accomplished filmmakers, from Uganda and Kenya. But we can't do it without you.

We are at preproduction with plans to shoot in January. 

If you are unable to support the campaign financially, please spread the word! You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign with your friends and family.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I’m Bella, the writer and creator of the BABY MAMA DRAMA: WEB SERIES! Having received my B.A. in Multimedia and Filmmaking in 2015 from NJCU, I’ve been putting sincere effort into fulfilling my passion, gaining experience and creating art with the skills I have been blessed to learn while doing what I love most – STORY TELLING. 

With my passion, I was able to create a story that so many of my peers and countless others throughout the world can relate to. The BABY MAMA DRAMA story has resonated with so many people who deserve to know what has become of the characters they've connected to so easily; but that cannot be done without your kindness and generosity. 

What We Need & What You Get

We love our fans SO MUCH and have been listening to your suggestions and requests for an even bigger and better season 2! Your contributions will help us deliver the following:   

LONGER EPISODES! - ALL episodes in season 2 will be at LEAST 15 min! (Episodes in season 1 were 8-12 min)  

MORE EPISODES – We are bringing you EIGHT (8) all new episodes! (Season 1, there were only 6)  

MORE CHARACTERS – We’ve had to cast THIRTEEN (13) new characters for season 2 – including the kids of the main cast that the fans have been asking for!  

Contributors will enable production to:

  • Feed our very deserving cast and crew while on set;
  • Have access to better locations;
  • Rent more equipment for an even more cinematic production to expand on the quality fans have grown to love;
  • Pay some of our “starving” artists/the people this project wouldn't be possible without - It isn't nearly what they deserve considering the impact Covid-19 has had on the film industry, but being able to pay them a  little something for their time and effort is essential.
  • Props and set design to assist with visual storytelling.  

The Impact

We have determined we would need about $3,500 to produce BMD: Part 2 the way we envision it and the way our fans deserve to see it! And because we understand how big of a deal that is to raise, we have come up with some awesome perks to reward those who are fortunate and kind enough to donate – how do these babies sound?  

 How cool would it be to see your name in the credits with a “Special Thanks” shout out? Or would you like to be ON SET during production during one of our shoot days and see how fun filmmaking is behind the scenes? Or how about a small speaking role that’ll produce footage for you to add to your acting reel and experience to add to your resume? Or would you like to video chat with a member of the BMD cast and ask them WHATEVER you want?? 

Production for BMD Part 2 has been severely halted based in large part to both Covid-19 and a lack of funding. Please help us finish what we’ve started early 2020 and wrap up production for BMD Part 2 so we can show it to the fans, FINALLY! 

Risks & Challenges

What is currently transpiring throughout the country due to Covid-19, our project is experiencing a serious delay. We run the risk of not meeting our goal while attempting to raise funds during a pandemic however it is very important to us to bring our supporters a season 2! As the series creator, I am hoping that no matter the outcome, we are able to push forward and produce an even more entertaining and successful season. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a monetary contribution at this time, we completely understand! Because BABY MAMA DRAMA already represents a collection of artists, we are also open to accepting collaborations as your form as generosity. If you are a makeup artist, fashion designer make beats or music you would like to have featured on season 2, please send inquiries and submissions to babymamadrama.webseries@gmail.com

story:
Lock the Target

Hey everybody, it's Rexx Arkana from STATIK Industrial TV. We've been blown away by the international support STATIK has received from our viewers. We are delighted to be able to serve a community of people  who love dark electronic music as much as we do.

From dancing with my mother as a child to hanging out in the record stores as a teen, music is a big part of my background. At STATIK TV, we love sharing the stories of artists in our scene and celebrating our mutual love of industrial music and culture with you.

But I am also hoping you'll love us back...and get on board with us as we prepare to bring you Mechanismus Festival this summer. 

 

Bait the Line

Creating a video series like STATIK is  a lot of fun, but it's also costly. For example, bringing  our viewers the highest quality footage requires at least two pro grade cameras, only one of which we own. We have to rent the others, along with additional peripherals and auxiliary equipment such as lights, cables, controllers and power drops. Since Seattle is on the other side of the country from our base in New York, covering Mechanismus will also necessitate air travel and a hotel, which alone will run in excess of $3000US for a three person crew.

We currently publish all of our content for free, and we don't sell advertising or influence. The only way for us to recoup any of our costs is through the patronage of you, our amazing audience.

 

Spread the Net

We are prepared to thank you graciously for your support, and we've established lots of different levels for people to contribute to our campaign. From t-shirts to photo books, shout-outs to swag bags, we think you'll find something to get excited about in our list of perks. On top of limited edition commemorative merchandise, select boosters contributing $35 or more will receive video recognition of their support from their favorite artists, posted publicly to their Facebook wall (or digital file). Those who pledge $50 or more have the chance to ask select festival performers anything they'd like to know about their work, while STATIK captures it all for the world to see. 

All boosters at any level will receive early access to future published Mechanismus-related video content.

 

Catch the Man

With your help, we can do more things faster. This is true of all episodes, but especially when trying to cover a five-day festival half a world away. We're ready to bring you all the live concert performances, exclusive band interviews and entertaining behind the scenes action you've come to expect from STATIK TV. You know you can count on us to deliver our unique brand of storytelling to the festivities in Seattle.

The question now is: can *we* count on you? Take a look at the perks we're offering and - if you can - contribute to the cause. If you want to support what we're doing, but can't afford to do so financially, there are other ways you can help. Make some noise. Help us boost the signal, for this campaign and for the series. There is strength in numbers. Together, we can make ourselves heard. 

Thanks for listening...and for your continued support.

rexx

Scene. Strong. STATIK. 

 

The Small Print: STATIK has graciously received the support and backing of many of the artists scheduled to perform at the festival. We did not ask all of the bands to participate, however, so if your preferred artist isn't on the list of perks, email us at industrialstatik@gmail.com and we'll see what we can do. Please also note that while all of the bands represented have pledged their time and commitment, sometimes shit happens. In the event that a scheduled artist becomes unavailable to deliver on their perk, STATIK TV will offer either an alternate artist, or a refund, at the booster's discretion.

story:
Short Summary

 

Hi, I’m Mike Bocchetti from the Artie Lange Show, Last Comic Standing, and many movie and tv show appearances.

 I’m proudly creating a new series, "Bocchetti's Basement", a unique late night, half hour talk show.  It'll be diverse, funny, and original. It won't be the same recycled guests or people screaming over each other to be the funniest, or what they think is edgiest. It’s going to be on amazon prime. I have a comedy documentary "Who Is Mike Bocchetti" on there now. 

We want to do at least  6 episodes.

Here is where you come in.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are gonna need at least 12 thousand dollars to do it. Which pays building my basement into a studio type set, production costs, cast, salary, food, etc etc. There will be perks for people that make a donation, including being thanked in the credits, signed merch,  and if you contribute a certain amount will be invited to the set to watch a taping! Please contribute what you can. I’m asking for the money because I want to give my fans and new people that will be watching this great production value. Nothing half-assed, something original and funny you can enjoy , not see the same shows same guests people screaming over each other from lack of attention from their childhood or marriage. thanks everyone look for Bocchetti’s basement coming to amazon prime soon

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks  to these types of endeavors, but we have a good team of artists working with us and are confident we can make this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can donate but If you can share the link, that helps us too.

story:
My name is Josh Isaac and in May I’m graduating from Ithaca College with a Cinema & Photography B.S. degree and an Animation minor. I grew up watching every animated show and movie I could find with my dad and brother, and have always known that I wanted to make the kinds of fun and impactful stories that greeted us whenever we turned on the TV. My goal is to create stories with both heart and humor, connecting with audiences in the same way I felt connected to the cartoons I watched as a kid.

For my senior thesis, I am making a pilot for a cartoon I've been developing over the past year and a half. It is called "Knights of Luminos" and is a show about friendship, adventure, personal growth and the power of teamwork. Daisy, the enthusiastic warrior, Belch, the honorable goblin, and Chip, the happy go lucky wood elf come together to form our heroes, a team of Knights dedicated to protecting the people of the kingdom from monsters, criminals, supernatural forces and corruption. Together, they learn that everyone has something different to offer and that working as a team is the best way to solve problems and be heroic Knights.

Any and all funds we raise will go towards commissioning artists to help contribute to the project. We'll be able to have things like a fully realized series logo, beautifully drawn backgrounds, promotional posters and more. ALL of which you, as a donor, will be able to receive as .PNG files for a $20 donation.

Even if you can't donate, it would be a MASSIVE help to me and my team if you helped spread the word about this project, sharing the campaign and other promotional materials online with your friends.
story_txt:
My name is Josh Isaac and in May I’m graduating from Ithaca College with a Cinema & Photography B.S. degree and an Animation minor. I grew up watching every animated show and movie I could find with my dad and brother, and have always known that I wanted to make the kinds of fun and impactful stories that greeted us whenever we turned on the TV. My goal is to create stories with both heart and humor, connecting with audiences in the same way I felt connected to the cartoons I watched as a kid.
For my senior thesis, I am making a pilot for a cartoon I've been developing over the past year and a half. It is called "Knights of Luminos" and is a show about friendship, adventure, personal growth and the power of teamwork. Daisy, the enthusiastic warrior, Belch, the honorable goblin, and Chip, the happy go lucky wood elf come together to form our heroes, a team of Knights dedicated to protecting the people of the kingdom from monsters, criminals, supernatural forces and corruption. Together, they learn that everyone has something different to offer and that working as a team is the best way to solve problems and be heroic Knights.

Any and all funds we raise will go towards commissioning artists to help contribute to the project. We'll be able to have things like a fully realized series logo, beautifully drawn backgrounds, promotional posters and more. ALL of which you, as a donor, will be able to receive as .PNG files for a $20 donation.
Even if you can't donate, it would be a MASSIVE help to me and my team if you helped spread the word about this project, sharing the campaign and other promotional materials online with your friends.

story:
Hi, I'm Sarah Pribis.

The purpose of this Indiegogo is to raise funds to produce my TV show, CELEBRITY PETS: UNLEASHED.  It's a talk show with a twist! In the vein of "The Tonight Show," I will conduct interviews...but with celebrity pets. Think "Entertainment Tonight" meets "The Secret Lives of Pets." How does this work, you ask? Well, the animals sit on the lap of their celeb owner, who answers each question in the voice of their beloved pet. Will they use accents? Speak another language? The possibilities are endless...

There are talk shows on TV, cute animal videos on Youtube & Instagram, and hilarious animated films of cartoon animals, but nothing that actually combines all of these elements. Maybe you've seen Chris Pratt on The Late Show, but have you seen Chris Pratt's sheep on The Late Show? And wouldn't you like to know what Chris Pratt's sheep, Cacao, knows about Chris Pratt? CELEBRITY PETS: UNLEASHED gets the juicy celeb gossip straight from the horse's mouth -- LITERALLY.

And just in case you could care less about celebrity gossip, there are other sketches too!

A little something for everyone.

Like a drinking game, where the celebs & their pets face off against Sophia & I, and indulge in Malbark, Dog Perignon, Pawsecco, or Pinot Meow.

OR our version of "Who Wore It Better?" -- where both the animal and their owner strut identical outfits on our CATwalk.

Maybe you miss me on HQ? Don't worry, we've got a trivia component too.

Let’s introduce you to the team. 

Sarah Pribis (Creator, Host, Co-Producer)

Sarah Pribis is an actress, host, producer, writer and cat mom in NYC. She is most widely known as one of the original hosts of HQ Trivia, a live mobile game show. Previous TV roles include: Bravo's Dirty John, CBS’s The Bold & the Beautiful, and several appearances on Cat Week on The Ellen Show after an infomercial she starred in went viral. Sarah’s recent feature films include: Clinton Road (Ice-T, Vincent Pastore), Inside Game (Scott Wolfe, Will Sasso), and Cicada (Cobie Smulders, Scott Adsit), which just screened at the 2019 Tribeca Film Festival. Her comedic talents can be found in sketches on: Betches, College Humor, & TruTV’s Hack My Life.

Jessie Jolles (Director)

Jessie Jolles is a comedian, writer, and director. She is the creator & host of Just For Laughs' new digital series "It's A Date!" and was recently 1 of 100 creators from around the world selected for YouTube’s “Women in Comedy” Production Program. She writes & directs comedic sketches for Betches, and has been featured on TIME, HelloGiggles, The Huffington Post, Cosmopolitan, Funny or Die, Above Average, Backstage, Elite Daily, Indiewire, and more. You can also catch her in the Bravo digital series "Guide To...", MTV News After Hours, and Elite Daily's "Generation whY". Jessie performs at the Upright Citizens Brigade and hosts a monthly show at the PIT called "No Such Thing As Love."

Amber Sweet (Co-Producer)

Amber Sweet is an actress, writer & producer, and the co-owner of WrenLee Pictures. Her recent credits include the feature film Sargasso (Tom Berenger, Jeremy Sumpter) and Hell On The Border (Ron Perlman, Frank Grillo). She is slated to star in the superhero pilot Where Is Astral Man, and in The Chariot, a feature film by Adam Sigal.

Let’s talk money. 

We don’t have a studio backing us. CELEBRITY PETS: UNLEASHED is our independent passion project. We’re proud to be part of a community of New York filmmakers who look out for each other. Whether they’re lending their talents, their gear, or their advice, the generosity of this community astounds and inspires. We’re asking you to be part of that community. 

Producing a show can be expensive and there are a lot of little costs here and there that you might not immediately think of. Luckily, we have! And the big ones — can’t forget the big ones. Luckily, we haven’t! From craft services to Indiegogo fees to production insurance, we have every dollar we plan on raising accounted for.

Instead of boring you with every detail, here is a general breakdown:

 

And, of course, let's take a look at those rewards.

You know the drill. To the right, you can check out all of our rewards, from social media shout outs to seeing your name in the credits. There's even an opportunity for you to receive a custom pet portrait by yours truly. Check out this bad boy I painted last week:

What’s the status of the project? 

Your contribution won’t be going to a project that isn't going to happen — it will be funding a show that IS happening. The team is already well into production. We started shooting May 19th, and our first 10 hours of footage are already in the editing room, being made into TV magic. 

What’s next?! Well, this project is NOT going to the dogs.

We’ll be submitting CELEBRITY PETS: UNLEASHED to networks & streaming platforms in the hopes that it'll be picked up and brought to television, computer, tablet, and phone screens in your homes!

Could you share this with your mom?

Or whoever in your life you think might relate or might just be into it. Whether or not you can make a contribution, sharing our story, this link, and our campaign with your friends, family, old camp counselors, podiatrists, and anyone else is extremely helpful to us.

And finally, THANK YOU.

From all of us. We think you're the cat's meow. Now, let’s bring CELEBRITY PETS: UNLEASHED to life!

story:
(Spanish Versión en Español)

Visit our Trip With a Mission page in: YouCaring.com/LyosTV

 

This new project of LYOS.TV is a Video Blog of a Motorcycle Solo Trip from Malaysia to Spain... 

Video Blog from Kuala Lumpur to Barcelona, in which LYOS, a Video Producer/Climber/Explorer from Mexico, will be documenting everything that happens...

 

We have to tell you the story really fast...

Past:

LYOS left Mexico 11 years ago and captured with his cameras 40 countries in 5 continents.

In 2008 he started a Motorcycle Trip from KL to Madrid... but was interrupted by an Avalanche when he was climbing Mount Everest and canceled the trip...

He did only 1/4 of the route... 

 

Today:

Now 9 years later, Lyos wants to finish that trip, documentating everything on weekly chapters on a Travel Vlog.

So, this Crowd Funding is to get the trip started.

Also you need to know what you will get for your money. For that, Lyos will upload the chapters of the Indonesian Vlog he did and edited to show that the KL - BCN Trip will be even more amazing, so you will support us to do it... 

And the Chapter 01 of LYOS.TV is here:

There are 16 Chapters in the Indonesian Vlog.

 

Future:

After funding the money for the new trip, Lyos will make weekly chapters in real time of all the new Motorcycle Vlog.

Trip that will be crossing 33 countries starting from KL to Barcelona in 2018.

We need your HELP for that... please support LYOS.TV to make this happen...

 

If you can´t Help us with Donations or in YouCaring.com/LyosTV

please Help us Sharing this Campaing with your Family and Friends or the video.

https://youtu.be/ouzTt_HbHho

All the Complete Details of the Perks for Supporting LYOS.TV in this Link:
https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/757c3955

 

So, that was the short version of the story... now, because we know you want them, here are all the details of the project...

Lyos left Mexico and has been 11 years on the road... and in that time he has done some weird stuff:

 

  • Traveled from Acapulco to Cancun by Bicycle

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GNBapesTV5s

 

  • Motorcycle, Car and Jeep Trips around Mexico

https://youtu.be/5Wv2frYSIBc?t=385

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0PORpqhNCj0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yITWaC10xqI

 

  • Running with Bulls, Rappelling the Basement of Swallows and Experiencing "Flying" just like an ancient Mexica with the Papantla Flyers

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qbxm0ywyCvc

https://youtu.be/al3ncaCK_EM?t=197

 

  • Travelled the important Maya sites from Mexico to Costa Rica by car doing 25,000 kms

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9cJTZQX5ot8

 

  • Produced, presented and edited Extreme Sports capsules for a TV show in Melbourne

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1CDUSpPGagY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mcssGFgnOE4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RiWCDJDsIkw

 

  • Travelled in a Motorcycle Chopper in 11 countries of Southeast Asia for 33,000 kms

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K_oa-lVAEhQ

 

  • Climbed to the Summit of 38 mountains, including almost getting killed by an avalanche and losing a finger to get to the Top of Mount Everest
 


His cameras already got him detained in 4 different countries and now he is a motivational speaker… doesn´t drink, smoke or do drugs...

All these weird activities are included in the first chapter of the LYOS.TV project... 

 

These are the Social Media the project already has:

 

  LYOS.TV        LyosTV         LyosTV         LyosTV         LyosTV         LyosTV 

 

  FB Group        FB Page        Indiegogo        PayPal        Lyos.TV@lyos.tv

         

We also have a team of translators totally ready and willing to put subtitles on LYOS.TV

So far we have Spanish, English, Indonesian, French, Russian, German, Italian, Dutch, Finnish, Polish, Turkish and Catalan.

They are just waiting for LYOS.TV to be supported by you guys... so LYOS.TV can reach as much people as possible all over the World by being subtitled in 11 or more languages...

 

​

 

If later when the chapters get released, you can´t find the subtitles in one of the languages listed, it means we still need help to do them... you can also be part of the translation team to help in these or other languages and join LYOS.TV 

If you want please contact us.

You will be part of our VIP contribuition community and will give you credits with your links in the LYOS.TV Web Site and YouTube video descriptions of each video... just like this:

LYOS.TV/who

 

 

This new project in 2018 will be a Motorcycle Trip from Kuala Lumpur to Barcelona.

Including all kind of activities like Extreme Sports, Touristic Spots, High Mountains, Beautiful Beaches, Weird Places and Visiting Orphanages... crossing a Total of 33 Countries.

1. - Malaysia

2. - Thailand

3. - Cambodia

4. - Vietnam

5. - Laos

6. - Myanmar

7.- India

8.- Pakistan

9.- Afghanistan

10.- Tajikistan

11.- Kyrgyzstan

12.- Kazakhstan

13. - Uzbekistan

14. - Turkmenistan

15. - Iran

16. - Georgia

17. - Turkey

18. - Greece

19. - Bulgaria

20. - Romania

21. - Ukraine

22. - Hungary

23. - Slovakia

24. - Poland

25. - Czech Republic

26. - Austria

27. - Italy

28. - Switzerland

29. - Germany

30. - Netherlands

31. - Belgium

32. - France

33. - Spain

This route will take, approximately, 2 years to accomplish all the 33 countries.

Is not an easy route and could change because of many external factors like political problems... still, it will start in 2018 from Malaysia and will finish in Spain… maybe in 2020.

 

After 11 years travelling outside Mexico and his experience in the last motorcycle trip in Asia that lasted 20 months… Video that we showed you before...

 

Lyos calculated that he needs $ 33,000 usd for this KL - BCN motorcycle trip.

Funding Money:

Cost of travelling per month = $ 1,000 usd.

That was calculated on a daily basis: $10 usd for food, $10 usd for petrol and $10 usd for accommodation.

That means $ 30 usd x 30 days… so, $ 900 usd. But there are always some extra expenses and to make it easier, we will say $ 1,000 usd per month.

2 Year Trip = 24 months = $ 24,000 usd daily travelling expenses.

Cost of the second hand motorcycle and international Carnet de Passage papers, so the motorcycle can cross borders with Lyos = $ 5,000 usd.

Cost of the Video and Action Cameras = $ 2,000 usd.

Web Site to keep you informed with chapters and photos updated all the trip = $ 1,000 usd.

Costs for Visas, Subtitling, Repairs, Indiegogo Fees and more = $ 1,000 usd.

Total Cost of the 2 Year Vlog Trip from Kuala Lumpur to Barcelona = $ 33,000 usd.

 

Doing this project on a budget trying to save money is important.

$10 usd food and $10 usd accommodation, will force Lyos to maintain a simple more connected to the place and people´s day to day life.

Meaning that sometimes he will have to share rooms in hostels, eat street food or bargain about any touristic service or expeditions on the trip…

All these situations will force him to meet people and make new friends everywhere… making the stories of the trip richer and unique…

 

 

Since you don´t know what to expect of this motorcycle trip, we are dividing the funding of LYOS.TV new Vlog in 2 stages.

The first stage is already this crowd funding from Indiegogo to start the Motorcycle Trip to Barcelona, asking for the first $ 5,555 usd.

 

That´s just to cover the 2 principal costs:

1. - Buying a second hand Chopper Motorcycle for = $ 3,555 usd

2. - Buying the new Video Camera and the Action Camera for = $ 2,000 usd

 

The prices for the cameras online and also in many electronic stores already checked in Kuala Lumpur, tells us that $ 2,000 usd are enough to cover the cost of buying them new.

The second hand motorcycle price is more difficult to calculate.

Lyos checked prices the last time he was in some places of Malaysia and KL, and a 5 year old Chopper was between $ 3,000 and $ 3,500 usd

So we will put the cost on $ 3,555 usd to make sure he can buy it and also because 555 is Lyos favorite number.

 

He knows that reaching this first goal to buy this is not going to be easy…

Also even a little bit harder if you guys don´t know what to expect about all the journey or if you are doubting if Lyos work is worth it or not.

The only thing that we can do, if you didn´t watched it before, is show you the Chapter 1 of the first LYOS.TV project.

A Video Blog of Indonesia in Spanish with English and French subtitles, totally produced and edited by Lyos.

LYOS.TV - Chapter 01 – The Dream…

 

This chapter and all the Indonesian Vlog, has no script or camera crew, is a Solo Trip filmed in 10 countries: Spain, England, Australia, New Zealand, Sri Lanka, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and the narrations are based in Indonesia, with chapters in Borneo, Sumatra, Java and Bali.

 

 

The story is exactly as it happened... without enough money, without rules and without plans… has 16 Chapters… and the list is here:

1       The Dream…

2       See You Later

3       Return to Melbourne

4       The Project

5       Living in the Car

6       Mount Cook Fall

7       Sri Lanka Fix

8       Philippines Fall

9       A Better Year

10     Exploring Borneo

11      Sumatra Fall

12     Thay Relyoaded

13.1  Crossing to... Bali

13.2  Macho Motorcycle Dream Trip

13.3  The Immortal

13.4   Ubud

 

 

All the chapters will be something between 14 - 15 minutes… but remember that the most important thing of this project, is the TRUTH.

So, we will try to make the chapters duration as standard as possible, even though sometimes reality is way different than expected and we can´t control it.

Still, we will never bore our viewers with a chapter that is longer than it should be… or so fast that you can´t enjoy it...

So, the first deal before the KL – BCN Trip Vlog starts, is that, if with your help we reach the goal to buy the stuff and motorcycle, to get ready for the next LYOS.TV trip, we will release 5 Chapters on the $ 5,555 usd goal.

You already have:

Chapter 01 – The Dream…

 

So after this is done, we will release:

Chapter 02 - See You Later

Chapter 03 - Return to Melbourne

Chapter 04 - The Project

Chapter 05 - Living in the Car

 

That means that it would be $ 1,111 usd per chapter.

In this procedure you guys will be motivated to see more and more with actual results in hand, while the real project that you are funding has not even started yet.

Meaning that you are receiving and being part of 2 Vlogs for the funding of 1…

This has to convince you to help us and spread this campaign with your friends, so later more people´s help will join us on the way to start the KL – BCN Vlog.

The faster you fund and spread this project, the faster you will have more Indonesian chapters and the faster the KL-BCN will come to live.

 

After this first goal, the crowd funding will be on Demand, meaning that it will continue so we can keep releasing the chapters 6, 7, 8, 9… and every $ 1,111 usd we will upload one more until reaching number 16.

 

 

When we reach that point, LYOS.TV will have $ 17,777 usd of funding… little more than half of the total money that it´s needed to start and finish the new $ 33,000 usd 2 year Vlog until BCN.

Half of money is enough to cover the expenses of many months with the weekly capsules on real time of the KL to BCN project.

After the “first season” with the 16 chapters, you will see that the main porpuse of LYOS.TV is to show reality…

Some chapters are about beautiful places, victories and summiting mountains… some about happy, relaxing and party times… some about failures… some others are sad and even about illness recoveries… learning at the end, that no matter what shit happens in our life... we have to get up again… yes, get up... always…

The thing of LYOS.TV is showing you “travel life”… just as it is… with the goals, the dreams and the obstacles… with the ups and downs that we all have… because at the end, everybody knows that… life is not easy…

So after the Indonesian Vlog, the real time travel capsules of the new Vlog will have a different format.

Each chapter of the fist Vlog resumed the story traveling time of months in 15 minutes.

Some were formed with 1 month of traveling, others with 2 months and another with 2 weeks… and even there is one chapter, done with 11 days of traveling time…

The new Video Blog format on weekly chapters to cover the Motorcycle Trip, will be that every Sunday, Lyos will grab the camera and tell you all what happened in the last week… from Monday to Sunday…

We think each chapter will be a 4 or 5 minutes video, illustrated with footage and photos… or maybe more with special edition and music.

But each chapter duration will depend on reality… on how entertaining were the places and the activities of that single week.

And the best thing in this new project, is that we can focus the chapters on more interesting details.

We will have seven days of storytelling in 5 minutes and we don´t have to rush taking away a lot of stuff and details, just to focus on the most amazing things of the trip…

And don´t get confused, the most amazing parts of the trip will be there... just this time the narration will get more detailed and personal…

 

A motorcycle trip from Kuala Lumpur to Barcelona by land… crossing 33 countries and some of the most difficult places in the world… alone… telling the story as it goes on a limited budget... trust LYOS.TV, we are sure it will be amazing and totally worth it.

 

 

The motorcycle gives a different perspective when you travel…

It is freedom… and gives you the opportunity to get to the corners where no foreigner or even average locals go… just because we can… and just because going to hidden and unknown places, is exactly the way in which we can use the word "explore"…

So let´s go and see what happens… let´s discover real people, real places and real stories…

Doesn´t matter in what you are interested… Rivers, Temples, Waterfalls, Animals, Religions, Villages, Mountains, Jungles, Sports, Orphanages, Beaches…

Whatever you are looking for, the motorcycle is destined to take us there and beyond to find something new…

And this time, even with the option that if you are passionate about something else… or you know anything interesting somewhere… an orphanage or a special secret place along the route… write us... we will make sure it will be soon on LYOS.TV…

 

Amazing Trip that with your Help… will be a Reality very Soon… 

 

ℒ५٥೭   ​

 

If you can´t Help us with Donations,

please Help us Sharing this Campaing with your Family and Friends or the video.

https://youtu.be/ouzTt_HbHho

All the Complete Details of the Perks for Supporting LYOS.TV in this Link:
https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/757c3955

 

                                                      

*************************************************************************************

ESPAÑOL

Visita nuestra Trip With a Mission page en:  YouCaring.com/LyosTV

 

La primer pregunta que habría que responder es... ¿Porqué?

¿Porqué cruzar esos países en una motocicleta?

El objetivo es salir de la rutina para inspirarnos a explorar lo desconocido... con culturas reales, nuevos países, personas únicas... visitando niños en orfanatorios de todos los países.

Éste proyecto con presupuesto limitado tratará de mostrarte la realidad de viajar... con las cosas buenas y las cosas malas... tal como sucede con los altibajos de la vida.

No hay una mejor manera para poder entender a la humanidad y la forma de pensar de otras personas, que viajando por los rincones de sus países.

Acompañen a LYOS.TV en éste viaje para poder aprender un poco, ayudando a los niños más necesitados de ésta parte del Mundo, juntos...

 

Éste nuevo proyecto de LYOS.TV es un Video Blog de un Viaje en Moto de Malasia a España... 

Video Blog de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona, donde LYOS, un Productor de Video/Alpinista/Explorador de México, documentará todo lo que pase...

 

Te tenemos que contar la historia un poco rápido...

Pasado:

LYOS salió de México hace 11 años y ha capturado con sus cámaras 40 países en 5 continentes.

En 2008 empezó un viaje en Moto de KL a Madrid... pero el viaje fue interrumpido por una Avalancha cuando estaba escalando el Monte Everest y tuvo que cancelar el viaje...

Solo pudo hacer la cuarta parte de la ruta... 

 

Hoy:

Después de 9 años, Lyos quiere terminar ese viaje, documentando todo lo que pasa en capítulos semanales de un Vlog Viajero.

Así, éste Crowd Funding es para preparar dicho viaje.

También necesitan saber que es lo que obtendrán si nos ayudan. Y para ello, Lyos subirá los capítulos del Vlog de Indonesia que hizo y editó, para mostrar que el viaje de KL a BCN será aún más increíble y nos apoyen para realizarlo... 

Y el Capítulo 01 de LYOS.TV es este:

Son 16 Capítulos del Vlog de Indonesia.

 

Futuro:

Después de recaudar el dinero para el viaje, Lyos hará capítulos semanales del nuevo Vlog en Moto en tiempo real.

Viaje que cruzará 33 países empezando de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona en el 2018.

Necesitamos de tu AYUDA... por favor apoya a LYOS.TV para hacerlo realidad...

Todas estas actividades raras están incluidas en el primer capítulo del proyecto LYOS.TV... 

 

Éstas son las Redes Sociales que ya tiene el proyecto:

LYOS.TV/who

 

 

Éste nuevo proyecto para 2018 será un Viaje en Moto de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona.

Incluyendo todo tipo de actividades como Deportes Extremos, Lugares Turísticos, Montañas Altas, Playas Chidas, Lugares Raros y Visitando Orfanatorios... cruzando un Total de 33 Países. 

1. - Malasia

2. - Tailandia

3. - Cambodia

4. - Vietnam

5. - Laos

6. - Myanmar

7.- India

8.- Pakistán

9.- Afganistán

10.- Tayikistán

11.- Kyrgyzstán

12.- Kazakstán

Esta ruta durará, aproximadamente, 2 años en completarse con los 33 países.

No es una ruta fácil y puede cambiar debido a varios factores externos como problemas políticos... aún así, empezará en 2018 de Malasia y terminará en España... tal vez en el 2020.

Después de 11 años viajando fuera de México y su experiencia con el viaje en Moto anterior en Asia que duró 20 meses... Video que ya les enseñamos antes...

 

Lyos ha calculado que necesita $33,000 usd para el viaje de KL a BCN en moto.

Recaudación de Dinero:

Costo de viajar por mes = $ 1,000 usd.

Eso fue calculado con gastos por día: $10 usd para comida, $10 usd para gasolina y $10 usd para el hotel.

Eso significa que son $ 30 usd x 30 días… $ 900 usd. Pero siempre hay algunos gastos extras y para hacerlo más fácil, diremos que son $ 1,000 usd por mes.

2 Años de Viaje = 24 meses = $ 24,000 usd de gastos de viaje.

Costo de una motocicleta usada y el Carnet de Passage internacional, para que la moto pueda cruzar fronteras con Lyos = $ 5,000 usd.

Costo de la Cámara de Video y la Action Camera = $ 2,000 usd.

Página Web para mantenerlos informados con los capítulos y fotos actualizadas del viaje = $ 1,000 usd.

Costo de Visas, Subtítulos, Reparaciones, Indiegogo y más = $ 1,000 usd.

Costo Total Vlog de Viaje de 2 Años de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona = $ 33,000 usd.

 

Realizar éste proyecto con presupuesto intentando ahorrar dinero es importante.

$10 usd para comida y $10 usd de hotel, hará que Lyos mantenga una vida simple y más conectada con las personas locales en su día a día.

Algunas veces tendrá que compartir cuartos en hostales, comer en la calle o regatear cualquier actividad o servicio turístico o expediciones en el viaje…

Todas estas situaciones lo forzarán a conocer gente y hacer nuevos amigos en todas partes... haciendo que las historias en el viaje sean más valiosas y únicas...

 

 

Ya que ustedes no saben que esperar de este viaje en moto, vamos a dividir la recaudación de fondos del Vlog LYOS.TV en 2 etapas.

La primera etapa será ésta campaña en Indiegogo para empezar el Viaje en Moto a Barcelona, pidiendo los primeros $ 5,555 usd.

 

Eso es solamente para cubrir los 2 costos principales:

1. - Comprar la Motocicleta Chopper usada por = $ 3,555 usd

2. - Comprar la Cámara de Video y la Action Camera por = $ 2,000 usd

 

Los precios de las cámaras en línea y también en varias tiendas electrónicas de Kuala Lumpur, nos dice que $ 2,000 usd son suficientes para cubrir el costo de comprarlas nuevas.

El precio de la moto usada será más difícil de calcular.

Lyos checó precios la última vez que estuvo en algunos lugares de Malasia y KL, y una Chopper con 5 años de uso estaba entre $ 3,000 y $ 3,500 usd

Así que pondremos el precio en $ 3,555 usd para asegurarnos de que se pueda comprar además de que 555 es el número favorito de Lyos.

 

El sabe que alcanzar esa primer meta para comprar ésto no será fácil…

E incluso un poco difícil si ustedes no saben qué va a resultar de este viaje o si están dudando si el trabajo de Lyos vale la pena o no.

Por ello si no lo vieron antes, lo primero que queremos enseñarles es el Capítulo 01 del primer proyecto de LYOS.TV

Un Video Blog de Indonesia en Español con subtítulos en Inglés y Francés por ahora, totalmente producido y editado por Lyos.

LYOS.TV - Chapter 01 – The Dream…

 

Éste capítulo y todo el Vlog de Indonesia, no tiene script ni asistentes de cámara, es un viaje en solitario grabado en 10 países: España, Inglaterra, Australia, Nueva Zelanda, Sri Lanka, Malasia, Filipinas, Singapur, Tailandia y las narraciones fueron grabadas en Indonesia, con capítulos en Borneo, Sumatra, Java y Bali.

 

 

La historia es exactamente como se vivió... sin dinero extra, sin reglas y sin planes... tiene 16 Capítulos… y son éstos:

1       The Dream…

2       See You Later

3       Return to Melbourne

4      The Project

5       Living in the Car

6       Mount Cook Fall

7       Sri Lanka Fix

8       Philippines Fall

9       A Better Year

10     Exploring Borneo

11      Sumatra Fall

12     Thay Relyoaded

13.1   Crossing to... Bali

13.2  Macho Motorcycle Dream Trip

13.3  The Immortal

13.4   Ubud

 

 

Todos los capítulos durarán entre 14 y 15 minutos… pero recuerden que lo más importante de éste proyecto, es la VERDAD.

Así, trataremos de hacer la duración de los capítulos lo más estándares posible, aunque algunas veces la realidad sea muy diferente a lo que se esperaba y no la podamos controlar.

Aún así, jamás aburriremos al espectador con capítulos más largos de lo que deberían ser... o tan rápidos que no los puedan disfrutar...

Entonces el primer trato antes de que el Vlog de KL a BCN empiece, es que si nos ayudan a alcanzar la meta para comprar la moto y preparar el siguiente viaje de LYOS.TV, les daremos 5 Capítulos al llegar a la meta de los $ 5,555 usd.

Ustedes ya vieron el primero:

Chapter 01 – The Dream…

 

Después de  alcanzar la meta, les subiremos:

Chapter 02 - See You Later

Chapter 03 - Return to Melbourne

Chapter 04 - The Project

Chapter 05 - Living in the Car

 

Eso significa que serán $ 1,111 usd por capítulo.

En ese esquema siempre estarán motivados para ver más capítulos, sabiendo que lo que tendrán será de calidad, mientras que el proyecto que de verdad están financiando ni siquiera ha empezado.

En pocas palabras les estamos dando y forman parte de 2 Vlogs por financiar 1…

Esto debe convencerlos de ayudarnos y compartir ésta campaña con sus amigos para que más personas nos ayuden y se nos unan para empezar el Vlog de KL a BCN. 

Entre más rápido financien y compartan éste proyecto, más rápido tendrán más capítulos de Indonesia y más rápido podrá empezar el viaje de KL a BCN.

 

Después de ésta primer meta, la campaña crowd funding seguirá on Demand, lo que significa que continuará para seguir financiándonos y podamos darles los siguientes capítulos 6, 7, 8, 9… y así cada vez que juntemos $ 1,111 usd se subirá uno más hasta llegar al 16.

 

 

Cuando lleguemos a ese punto, LYOS.TV tendrá $ 17,777 usd financiados… un poco más de la mitad del dinero total que se necesita para empezar y terminar el nuevo Vlog de $ 33,000 usd de viaje por 2 años hasta BCN.

La mitad del dinero es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de varios meses de viaje con los capítulos semanales en tiempo real del proyecto de KL a BCN.

Después la "primer temporada” con 16 capítulos, ya habrán visto que el objetivo principal de LYOS.TV es mostrar la realidad…

Algunos capítulos son acerca de lugares chidos, victorias y escaladas de montañas… algunos son felices, relajados y de fiesta... algunos de fracasos... algunos otros tristes y recuperándose de enfermedades... aprendiendo que al final, no importa la chinga que nos ponga la vida... nos tenemos que levantar otra vez... así es, levantarse...  siempre...

En LYOS.TV queremos mostrarles lo que es “estar de viaje”… tal cual es… con las metas, los sueños y los obstáculos… con los altibajos que todos tenemos... porque al final, todos sabemos que… la vida no es fácil…

Así que después del Vlog de Indonesia, las cápsulas de viaje en tiempo real del nuevo Vlog tendrán un formato distinto.

Cada capítulo del primer Vlog resume la historia de tiempo de viaje de meses en 15 minutos.

Algunos se hicieron con 1 mes de viaje, otros con 2 meses y otro con 2 semanas… e incluso hay un capítulo que se hizo con 11 días de tiempo de viaje…

El nuevo formato del Video Blog semanal para el Viaje en Moto, será que todos los Domingos, Lyos agarrará la cámara y les contará todo lo que ha pasado en esa semana… de Lunes a Domingo…

Creemos que cada capítulo será de 4 o 5 minutes de video, ilustrado con imágenes y fotos… o tal vez más con edición especial y música.

Pero la duración de cada capítulo dependerá de la realidad… de que tan entretenidos fueron los lugares y las actividades de esa semana.

Y la mejor parte de éste nuevo proyecto, es que podremos enfocar los capítulos en los detalles más interesantes.

Tendremos 7 días de historias que contar en 5 minutos y no tenemos la presión de quitar muchas cosas y detalles, sólo para enfocarnos en las cosas increíbles del viaje...

Y no se confundan, las cosas más increíbles del viaje van a estar... sólo que ahora la narrativa será aún más detallada y personal...

 

Un viaje en motocicleta de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona por tierra... cruzando 33 países y algunos de los lugares más difíciles del mundo... sólo... contando la historia tal como pasó con presupuesto limitado... confía en LYOS.TV, estamos seguros que valdrá la pena y será increíble.

 

 

La motocicleta te da una perspectiva diferente cuando viajas…

Es completa libertad… y te da la oportunidad de llegar a lugares remotos donde ningún extranjero ni los locales normalmente van... sólo porque podemos ir... y sólo porque ir a esos lugares ocultos y desconocidos, es exactamente la forma en la que podemos usar la palabra "explorar"...

Así que vamos a ver qué pasa… descubramos personas, lugares e historias reales…

No importa que es lo que te interese… Ríos, Templos, Cascadas, Animales, Religiones, Aldeas, Montañas, Selvas, Deportes, Culturas, Playas... 

Lo que sea que estés buscando, la motocicleta está destinada a llevarnos allá y aún mucho más lejos, para encontrar algo nuevo…

Y ésta vez, con la opción de que si te apasiona alguna otra cosa... o sabes de algún lugar interesante por ahí... algún orfanatorio o algo por la ruta especial y secreto... escríbenos... lo visitaremos para ponerlo próximamente en LYOS.TV…

 

Un Viaje Increíble que con tu Ayuda… será una Realidad muy Pronto… 

 

ℒ५٥೭   ​
