02 - See You LaterChapter 03 - Return to MelbourneChapter 04 - The ProjectChapter 05 - Living in the Car That means that it would be $ 1,111 usd per chapter.In this procedure you guys will be motivated to see more and more with actual results in hand, while the real project that you are funding has not even started yet.Meaning that you are receiving and being part of 2 Vlogs for the funding of 1…This has to convince you to help us and spread this campaign with your friends, so later more people´s help will join us on the way to start the KL – BCN Vlog.The faster you fund and spread this project, the faster you will have more Indonesian chapters and the faster the KL-BCN will come to live. After this first goal, the crowd funding will be on Demand, meaning that it will continue so we can keep releasing the chapters 6, 7, 8, 9… and every $ 1,111 usd we will upload one more until reaching number 16.  When we reach that point, LYOS.TV will have $ 17,777 usd of funding… little more than half of the total money that it´s needed to start and finish the new $ 33,000 usd 2 year Vlog until BCN.Half of money is enough to cover the expenses of many months with the weekly capsules on real time of the KL to BCN project.After the “first season” with the 16 chapters, you will see that the main porpuse of LYOS.TV is to show reality…Some chapters are about beautiful places, victories and summiting mountains… some about happy, relaxing and party times… some about failures… some others are sad and even about illness recoveries… learning at the end, that no matter what shit happens in our life... we have to get up again… yes, get up... always…The thing of LYOS.TV is showing you “travel life”… just as it is… with the goals, the dreams and the obstacles… with the ups and downs that we all have… because at the end, everybody knows that… life is not easy…So after the Indonesian Vlog, the real time travel capsules of the new Vlog will have a different format.Each chapter of the fist Vlog resumed the story traveling time of months in 15 minutes.Some were formed with 1 month of traveling, others with 2 months and another with 2 weeks… and even there is one chapter, done with 11 days of traveling time…The new Video Blog format on weekly chapters to cover the Motorcycle Trip, will be that every Sunday, Lyos will grab the camera and tell you all what happened in the last week… from Monday to Sunday…We think each chapter will be a 4 or 5 minutes video, illustrated with footage and photos… or maybe more with special edition and music.But each chapter duration will depend on reality… on how entertaining were the places and the activities of that single week.And the best thing in this new project, is that we can focus the chapters on more interesting details.We will have seven days of storytelling in 5 minutes and we don´t have to rush taking away a lot of stuff and details, just to focus on the most amazing things of the trip…And don´t get confused, the most amazing parts of the trip will be there... just this time the narration will get more detailed and personal… A motorcycle trip from Kuala Lumpur to Barcelona by land… crossing 33 countries and some of the most difficult places in the world… alone… telling the story as it goes on a limited budget... trust LYOS.TV, we are sure it will be amazing and totally worth it.  The motorcycle gives a different perspective when you travel…It is freedom… and gives you the opportunity to get to the corners where no foreigner or even average locals go… just because we can… and just because going to hidden and unknown places, is exactly the way in which we can use the word "explore"…So let´s go and see what happens… let´s discover real people, real places and real stories…Doesn´t matter in what you are interested… Rivers, Temples, Waterfalls, Animals, Religions, Villages, Mountains, Jungles, Sports, Orphanages, Beaches…Whatever you are looking for, the motorcycle is destined to take us there and beyond to find something new…And this time, even with the option that if you are passionate about something else… or you know anything interesting somewhere… an orphanage or a special secret place along the route… write us... we will make sure it will be soon on LYOS.TV… Amazing Trip that with your Help… will be a Reality very Soon…  
ℒ५٥೭   ​ If you can´t Help us with Donations,please Help us Sharing this Campaing with your Family and Friends or the video.https://youtu.be/ouzTt_HbHhoAll the Complete Details of the Perks for Supporting LYOS.TV in this Link:https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/757c3955                                                       *************************************************************************************ESPAÑOLVisita nuestra Trip With a Mission page en:  YouCaring.com/LyosTV La primer pregunta que habría que responder es... ¿Porqué?¿Porqué cruzar esos países en una motocicleta?El objetivo es salir de la rutina para inspirarnos a explorar lo desconocido... con culturas reales, nuevos países, personas únicas... visitando niños en orfanatorios de todos los países.Éste proyecto con presupuesto limitado tratará de mostrarte la realidad de viajar... con las cosas buenas y las cosas malas... tal como sucede con los altibajos de la vida.No hay una mejor manera para poder entender a la humanidad y la forma de pensar de otras personas, que viajando por los rincones de sus países.Acompañen a LYOS.TV en éste viaje para poder aprender un poco, ayudando a los niños más necesitados de ésta parte del Mundo, juntos... Éste nuevo proyecto de LYOS.TV es un Video Blog de un Viaje en Moto de Malasia a España... Video Blog de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona, donde LYOS, un Productor de Video/Alpinista/Explorador de México, documentará todo lo que pase... Te tenemos que contar la historia un poco rápido...Pasado:LYOS salió de México hace 11 años y ha capturado con sus cámaras 40 países en 5 continentes.En 2008 empezó un viaje en Moto de KL a Madrid... pero el viaje fue interrumpido por una Avalancha cuando estaba escalando el Monte Everest y tuvo que cancelar el viaje...Solo pudo hacer la cuarta parte de la ruta...  Hoy:Después de 9 años, Lyos quiere terminar ese viaje, documentando todo lo que pasa en capítulos semanales de un Vlog Viajero.Así, éste Crowd Funding es para preparar dicho viaje.También necesitan saber que es lo que obtendrán si nos ayudan. Y para ello, Lyos subirá los capítulos del Vlog de Indonesia que hizo y editó, para mostrar que el viaje de KL a BCN será aún más increíble y nos apoyen para realizarlo... Y el Capítulo 01 de LYOS.TV es este:Son 16 Capítulos del Vlog de Indonesia. Futuro:Después de recaudar el dinero para el viaje, Lyos hará capítulos semanales del nuevo Vlog en Moto en tiempo real.Viaje que cruzará 33 países empezando de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona en el 2018.Necesitamos de tu AYUDA... por favor apoya a LYOS.TV para hacerlo realidad... Si no puedes Ayudarnos con Donaciones,por favor Comparte este Crowdfunding con tus Familiares y Amigos o el video.https://youtu.be/ouzTt_HbHhoTodos los detalles de los Premios por Apoyar a LYOS.TV en éste Link:https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/757c3955 Esa fue la versión corta de la historia... ahora, porque sabemos que quieren enterarse y los necesitan, les vamos a dar todos los detalles del proyecto... Lyos salió de México hace 11 años... y en ese tiempo ha hecho cosas un poco raras: Viajar de Acapulco a Cancún en Bicicletahttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GNBapesTV5s Viajes en Motos, Coches y Jeeps por México https://youtu.be/5Wv2frYSIBc?t=385https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0PORpqhNCj0https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yITWaC10xqI Correr con Toros, Rapelear el Sótano de las Golondrinas y Vivir la experiencia de "Volar" tal como un Volador de Papantlahttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qbxm0ywyCvchttps://youtu.be/al3ncaCK_EM?t=197 Viajado los sitios Mayas importantes en coche de México a Costa Rica en 25,000 kmshttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9cJTZQX5ot8 Producir, presentar y editar cápsulas de Deportes Extremos en la TV de Melbournehttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1CDUSpPGagYhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mcssGFgnOE4https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RiWCDJDsIkw Viajado 11 países del Sudeste Asiático en una Moto Chopper por 33,000 kmshttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K_oa-lVAEhQ Escalado a la Cima de 38 Montañas, incluyendo casi morir por una Avalancha y perder un dedo para poder llegar a la cima del Monte Everest Sus cámaras lo han puesto en problemas y detenido en 4 países, y ahora incluso da pláticas motivacionales… no toma, no fuma y no consume drogas...Todas estas actividades raras están incluidas en el primer capítulo del proyecto LYOS.TV...  Éstas son las Redes Sociales que ya tiene el proyecto:   LYOS.TV        LyosTV         LyosTV         LyosTV         LyosTV         LyosTV    FB Group        FB Page        Indiegogo        PayPal        Lyos.TV@lyos.tv También tenemos un equipo de traductores totalmente listos y esperando para poner los subtítulos en LYOS.TVHasta ahora tenemos en Español, Inglés, Indonesio, Francés, Ruso, Alemán, Italiano, Holandés, Finlandés, Polaco, Turco y Catalán.Ellos están esperando que LYOS.TV sea apoyado por ustedes... así LYOS.TV podrá alcanzar al mayor número de personas posible en todas partes del mundo al tener subtítulos en 11 o más idiomas...​​Si después de lanzar los capítulos, no puedes encontrar los subtítulos de alguno de los idiomas de aquí arriba, significa que aún necesitamos ayuda para hacerlos... tú también puedes formar parte del equipo de traductores para ayudarnos con esos y con otros idiomas, uniéndote a LYOS.TVSi te interesa por favor contáctanos.Serías parte de nuestra Comunidad VIP y te daríamos créditos con tus links personales en nuestra página LYOS.TV y en las descripciones de los videos de YouTube de cada uno que traduzcas... tal como aquí se ve:LYOS.TV/who  Éste nuevo proyecto para 2018 será un Viaje en Moto de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona.Incluyendo todo tipo de actividades como Deportes Extremos, Lugares Turísticos, Montañas Altas, Playas Chidas, Lugares Raros y Visitando Orfanatorios... cruzando un Total de 33 Países. 1. - Malasia2. - Tailandia3. - Cambodia4. - Vietnam5. - Laos6. - Myanmar7.- India8.- Pakistán9.- Afganistán10.- Tayikistán11.- Kyrgyzstán12.- Kazakstán13. - Uzbekistán14. - Turkmenistán15. - Irán16. - Georgia17. - Turquía18. - Grecia19. - Bulgaria20. - Rumania21. - Ucrania22. - Hungría23. - Eslovaquia24. - Polonia25. - Republica Checa26. - Austria27. - Italia28. - Suiza29. - Alemania30. - Holanda31. - Bélgica32. - Francia33. - EspañaEsta ruta durará, aproximadamente, 2 años en completarse con los 33 países.No es una ruta fácil y puede cambiar debido a varios factores externos como problemas políticos... aún así, empezará en 2018 de Malasia y terminará en España... tal vez en el 2020.Después de 11 años viajando fuera de México y su experiencia con el viaje en Moto anterior en Asia que duró 20 meses... Video que ya les enseñamos antes... Lyos ha calculado que necesita $33,000 usd para el viaje de KL a BCN en moto.Recaudación de Dinero:Costo de viajar por mes = $ 1,000 usd.Eso fue calculado con gastos por día: $10 usd para comida, $10 usd para gasolina y $10 usd para el hotel.Eso significa que son $ 30 usd x 30 días… $ 900 usd. Pero siempre hay algunos gastos extras y para hacerlo más fácil, diremos que son $ 1,000 usd por mes.2 Años de Viaje = 24 meses = $ 24,000 usd de gastos de viaje.Costo de una motocicleta usada y el Carnet de Passage internacional, para que la moto pueda cruzar fronteras con Lyos = $ 5,000 usd.Costo de la Cámara de Video y la Action Camera = $ 2,000 usd.Página Web para mantenerlos informados con los capítulos y fotos actualizadas del viaje = $ 1,000 usd.Costo de Visas, Subtítulos, Reparaciones, Indiegogo y más = $ 1,000 usd.Costo Total Vlog de Viaje de 2 Años de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona = $ 33,000 usd. Realizar éste proyecto con presupuesto intentando ahorrar dinero es importante.$10 usd para comida y $10 usd de hotel, hará que Lyos mantenga una vida simple y más conectada con las personas locales en su día a día.Algunas veces tendrá que compartir cuartos en hostales, comer en la calle o regatear cualquier actividad o servicio turístico o expediciones en el viaje…Todas estas situaciones lo forzarán a conocer gente y hacer nuevos amigos en todas partes... haciendo que las historias en el viaje sean más valiosas y únicas...  Ya que ustedes no saben que esperar de este viaje en moto, vamos a dividir la recaudación de fondos del Vlog LYOS.TV en 2 etapas.La primera etapa será ésta campaña en Indiegogo para empezar el Viaje en Moto a Barcelona, pidiendo los primeros $ 5,555 usd. Eso es solamente para cubrir los 2 costos principales:1. - Comprar la Motocicleta Chopper usada por = $ 3,555 usd2. - Comprar la Cámara de Video y la Action Camera por = $ 2,000 usd Los precios de las cámaras en línea y también en varias tiendas electrónicas de Kuala Lumpur, nos dice que $ 2,000 usd son suficientes para cubrir el costo de comprarlas nuevas.El precio de la moto usada será más difícil de calcular.Lyos checó precios la última vez que estuvo en algunos lugares de Malasia y KL, y una Chopper con 5 años de uso estaba entre $ 3,000 y $ 3,500 usdAsí que pondremos el precio en $ 3,555 usd para asegurarnos de que se pueda comprar además de que 555 es el número favorito de Lyos. El sabe que alcanzar esa primer meta para comprar ésto no será fácil…E incluso un poco difícil si ustedes no saben qué va a resultar de este viaje o si están dudando si el trabajo de Lyos vale la pena o no.Por ello si no lo vieron antes, lo primero que queremos enseñarles es el Capítulo 01 del primer proyecto de LYOS.TVUn Video Blog de Indonesia en Español con subtítulos en Inglés y Francés por ahora, totalmente producido y editado por Lyos.LYOS.TV - Chapter 01 – The Dream…

 
Éste capítulo y todo el Vlog de Indonesia, no tiene script ni asistentes de cámara, es un viaje en solitario grabado en 10 países: España, Inglaterra, Australia, Nueva Zelanda, Sri Lanka, Malasia, Filipinas, Singapur, Tailandia y las narraciones fueron grabadas en Indonesia, con capítulos en Borneo, Sumatra, Java y Bali.  La historia es exactamente como se vivió... sin dinero extra, sin reglas y sin planes... tiene 16 Capítulos… y son éstos:1       The Dream…2       See You Later3       Return to Melbourne4      The Project5       Living in the Car6       Mount Cook Fall7       Sri Lanka Fix8       Philippines Fall9       A Better Year10     Exploring Borneo11      Sumatra Fall12     Thay Relyoaded13.1   Crossing to... Bali13.2  Macho Motorcycle Dream Trip13.3  The Immortal13.4   Ubud  Todos los capítulos durarán entre 14 y 15 minutos… pero recuerden que lo más importante de éste proyecto, es la VERDAD.Así, trataremos de hacer la duración de los capítulos lo más estándares posible, aunque algunas veces la realidad sea muy diferente a lo que se esperaba y no la podamos controlar.Aún así, jamás aburriremos al espectador con capítulos más largos de lo que deberían ser... o tan rápidos que no los puedan disfrutar...Entonces el primer trato antes de que el Vlog de KL a BCN empiece, es que si nos ayudan a alcanzar la meta para comprar la moto y preparar el siguiente viaje de LYOS.TV, les daremos 5 Capítulos al llegar a la meta de los $ 5,555 usd.Ustedes ya vieron el primero:Chapter 01 – The Dream… Después de  alcanzar la meta, les subiremos:Chapter 02 - See You LaterChapter 03 - Return to MelbourneChapter 04 - The ProjectChapter 05 - Living in the Car Eso significa que serán $ 1,111 usd por capítulo.En ese esquema siempre estarán motivados para ver más capítulos, sabiendo que lo que tendrán será de calidad, mientras que el proyecto que de verdad están financiando ni siquiera ha empezado.En pocas palabras les estamos dando y forman parte de 2 Vlogs por financiar 1…Esto debe convencerlos de ayudarnos y compartir ésta campaña con sus amigos para que más personas nos ayuden y se nos unan para empezar el Vlog de KL a BCN. Entre más rápido financien y compartan éste proyecto, más rápido tendrán más capítulos de Indonesia y más rápido podrá empezar el viaje de KL a BCN. Después de ésta primer meta, la campaña crowd funding seguirá on Demand, lo que significa que continuará para seguir financiándonos y podamos darles los siguientes capítulos 6, 7, 8, 9… y así cada vez que juntemos $ 1,111 usd se subirá uno más hasta llegar al 16.  Cuando lleguemos a ese punto, LYOS.TV tendrá $ 17,777 usd financiados… un poco más de la mitad del dinero total que se necesita para empezar y terminar el nuevo Vlog de $ 33,000 usd de viaje por 2 años hasta BCN.La mitad del dinero es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de varios meses de viaje con los capítulos semanales en tiempo real del proyecto de KL a BCN.Después la "primer temporada” con 16 capítulos, ya habrán visto que el objetivo principal de LYOS.TV es mostrar la realidad…Algunos capítulos son acerca de lugares chidos, victorias y escaladas de montañas… algunos son felices, relajados y de fiesta... algunos de fracasos... algunos otros tristes y recuperándose de enfermedades... aprendiendo que al final, no importa la chinga que nos ponga la vida... nos tenemos que levantar otra vez... así es, levantarse...  siempre...En LYOS.TV queremos mostrarles lo que es “estar de viaje”… tal cual es… con las metas, los sueños y los obstáculos… con los altibajos que todos tenemos... porque al final, todos sabemos que… la vida no es fácil…Así que después del Vlog de Indonesia, las cápsulas de viaje en tiempo real del nuevo Vlog tendrán un formato distinto.Cada capítulo del primer Vlog resume la historia de tiempo de viaje de meses en 15 minutos.Algunos se hicieron con 1 mes de viaje, otros con 2 meses y otro con 2 semanas… e incluso hay un capítulo que se hizo con 11 días de tiempo de viaje…El nuevo formato del Video Blog semanal para el Viaje en Moto, será que todos los Domingos, Lyos agarrará la cámara y les contará todo lo que ha pasado en esa semana… de Lunes a Domingo…Creemos que cada capítulo será de 4 o 5 minutes de video, ilustrado con imágenes y fotos… o tal vez más con edición especial y música.Pero la duración de cada capítulo dependerá de la realidad… de que tan entretenidos fueron los lugares y las actividades de esa semana.Y la mejor parte de éste nuevo proyecto, es que podremos enfocar los capítulos en los detalles más interesantes.Tendremos 7 días de historias que contar en 5 minutos y no tenemos la presión de quitar muchas cosas y detalles, sólo para enfocarnos en las cosas increíbles del viaje...Y no se confundan, las cosas más increíbles del viaje van a estar... sólo que ahora la narrativa será aún más detallada y personal... Un viaje en motocicleta de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona por tierra... cruzando 33 países y algunos de los lugares más difíciles del mundo... sólo... contando la historia tal como pasó con presupuesto limitado... confía en LYOS.TV, estamos seguros que valdrá la pena y será increíble.  La motocicleta te da una perspectiva diferente cuando viajas…Es completa libertad… y te da la oportunidad de llegar a lugares remotos donde ningún extranjero ni los locales normalmente van... sólo porque podemos ir... y sólo porque ir a esos lugares ocultos y desconocidos, es exactamente la forma en la que podemos usar la palabra "explorar"...Así que vamos a ver qué pasa… descubramos personas, lugares e historias reales…No importa que es lo que te interese… Ríos, Templos, Cascadas, Animales, Religiones, Aldeas, Montañas, Selvas, Deportes, Culturas, Playas... Lo que sea que estés buscando, la motocicleta está destinada a llevarnos allá y aún mucho más lejos, para encontrar algo nuevo…Y ésta vez, con la opción de que si te apasiona alguna otra cosa... o sabes de algún lugar interesante por ahí... algún orfanatorio o algo por la ruta especial y secreto... escríbenos... lo visitaremos para ponerlo próximamente en LYOS.TV… Un Viaje Increíble que con tu Ayuda… será una Realidad muy Pronto…  ℒ५٥೭   ​Si no puedes Ayudarnos con Donaciones o en YouCaring.com/LyosTVpor favor Comparte este Crowdfunding con tus Familiares y Amigos o el video.https://youtu.be/ouzTt_HbHhoTodos los detalles de los Premios por Apoyar a LYOS.TV en éste Link:https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/757c3955

story:
About Centered Web Series:

Drawing on personal accounts, 'Centered' addresses mental health, recovery, and the stigma surrounding them. We strive to give a window into how limited resources are for women of all backgrounds and the difficulty of obtaining strategized programs and the help and support that's needed for recovery. With so many facilities underfunded and programs cut from budgets across the country, we aim to bring these issues to the forefront of 'Centered' through comedy and complex characters; and as creators we aim to use this as a platform for voices that are not heard, as well as showcasing Chicago's talent in the comedy community.

Risks and Challenges:

Because we are producing, writing, and acting in this project; we are aware that the timeline for the completed episodes will be a challenge. We are ready to take on that challenge with a stellar, hardworking team: a DP, editor, sound engineer, and talented cast that brings our text to life through extended improvisational background; they truly make our jobs easier. We are trying to pull from as much of our professional on-set experience as possible and can guarantee that even though this is not a union project, it will be produced and directed like one. With block shooting over the month of July, we will hammer out all of our scenes in an organized way that makes sense for the creative team involved, and will ideally make editing easier. Our editor is top-notch and will be on set as much as possible, which ultimately will make the editing process smoother and timely-- resulting in a quicker timeline for us to drop the remainder of the nine episode season of 'Centered'. We have the passionate, creative team to tell this important story; we just need the funding to do so. After self-producing the pilot, we have a better sense of what we need to make this project a reality.. and it's you!

story:
On Site is a musical travel series about the cultures that inspired the Disney Princesses™. This past spring, we traveled to ten countries: The USA, England, Scotland, France, Germany, Denmark, Norway, India, China, and Fiji. For each country we did an on location music video of a Disney song, and an interview to learn a little bit more about the culture. 

I began working on On Site over a year ago, wanting to put my own spin on the Disney music videos I'd seen circulating around youtube. I was also very much inspired by the Netflix series Sense8. As an actress and singer of color, of course I loved its diversity. However, what really struck me about the series was its joyfulness. It is a celebration of all walks of life. I truly believe that we need more inclusive and uplifting media in a time of so much divide. Not only does Disney have a global audience, but especially in recent years, its characters come from all over the world. It felt like the perfect medium. (Also, I've always wanted to be a princess.) 

Ana Mirabal (Creator, Co-Director, Producer, Host) 

Ana is a New York based actress, singer, and writer.  She is a senior at Sarah Lawrence College concentrating in theatre and film, though she recently spent a semester studying with the National Music Theatre Institute at the Eugene O’Neill Theatre Center.​ She performed as Fleance in SLC's production of “Macbeth,” directed by Will Frears, and as Sally Bowles in the SLC Musical Theatre Collective’s production of “Cabaret.” She has also been featured in two new plays produced by the Exquisite Corpse Company in New York, and is currently working on a third. 

Austin Crudo (Co-Director, Cinematographer) 

Austin is a Baltimore based freelance film maker and student. He is currently a senior at Towson University with a concentration in Electronic Media and Film, with a minor in Theatre studies.  Although his passion is in Art Department, Austin has help most roles on set. In addition he also specializes in cinematography and photography.  New to the professional world of film, Austin has been working on a number of both student and indie sets and will continue working in Maryland film until his graduation in December 2018. 

Financing 

Since all of the song recording, traveling, and filming has already taken place, we're raising $10,000 for editing. This will allow the project to be the best that it can possibly be since we did so much shooting on location. A good editor could help us to fix any sound or lighting issues we might have encountered on our travels. (And, there were quite a few. It's a big world out there and we can't always control it.)

Should you decide to donate, we have some awesome perks! Our brand new logo stickers (including a limited edition princess version), an exclusive signed On Site: Poster, a skype chat with yours truly, and more!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! 

  • Follow us on facebook and instagram for updates: @onsiteofficial
  • Check out our website: onsiteofficial.com
  • Share this video with #JoinTheAdventure

Princesses always follow their dreams, thank you for making mine come true.
story_txt:
On Site is a musical travel series about the cultures that inspired the Disney Princesses™. This past spring, we traveled to ten countries: The USA, England, Scotland, France, Germany, Denmark, Norway, India, China, and Fiji. For each country we did an on location music video of a Disney song, and an interview to learn a little bit more about the culture. 
I began working on On Site over a year ago, wanting to put my own spin on the Disney music videos I'd seen circulating around youtube. I was also very much inspired by the Netflix series Sense8. As an actress and singer of color, of course I loved its diversity. However, what really struck me about the series was its joyfulness. It is a celebration of all walks of life. I truly believe that we need more inclusive and uplifting media in a time of so much divide. Not only does Disney have a global audience, but especially in recent years, its characters come from all over the world. It felt like the perfect medium. (Also, I've always wanted to be a princess.) 

Ana Mirabal (Creator, Co-Director, Producer, Host) 
Ana is a New York based actress, singer, and writer.  She is a senior at Sarah Lawrence College concentrating in theatre and film, though she recently spent a semester studying with the National Music Theatre Institute at the Eugene O’Neill Theatre Center.​ She performed as Fleance in SLC's production of “Macbeth,” directed by Will Frears, and as Sally Bowles in the SLC Musical Theatre Collective’s production of “Cabaret.” She has also been featured in two new plays produced by the Exquisite Corpse Company in New York, and is currently working on a third. 
Austin Crudo (Co-Director, Cinematographer) 
Austin is a Baltimore based freelance film maker and student. He is currently a senior at Towson University with a concentration in Electronic Media and Film, with a minor in Theatre studies.  Although his passion is in Art Department, Austin has help most roles on set. In addition he also specializes in cinematography and photography.  New to the professional world of film, Austin has been working on a number of both student and indie sets and will continue working in Maryland film until his graduation in December 2018. 


Financing 
Since all of the song recording, traveling, and filming has already taken place, we're raising $10,000 for editing. This will allow the project to be the best that it can possibly be since we did so much shooting on location. A good editor could help us to fix any sound or lighting issues we might have encountered on our travels. (And, there were quite a few. It's a big world out there and we can't always control it.)
Should you decide to donate, we have some awesome perks! Our brand new logo stickers (including a limited edition princess version), an exclusive signed On Site: Poster, a skype chat with yours truly, and more!

Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word! 

Follow us on facebook and instagram for updates: @onsiteofficial
Check out our website: onsiteofficial.com
Share this video with #JoinTheAdventure

Princesses always follow their dreams, thank you for making mine come true.

story:
JAM FAM!

So glad you are reading this because that means you're one step closer to donating to the family!

Just a SUPER BRIEF bio about me...my name is Jade Angela Moore. Yes I always introduce myself using my entire name lol. Anyway, I was born and raised in Atlanta, Georgia. I began producing films and series in 2012 at the age of 20 in my college dorm room. I ended up starting my own production company - Jade Angela Moore Entertainment - on my 21st birthday. Today, I have over 10 credits in the categories of writing and producing. 

ON MY RADIO // CARL & CHANEL...

Sooooo I started a YouTube Channel back in June 2019, releasing A LOT of series and films...

SHAMELESS PLUG - CHECK OUT THE CHANNEL - https://www.youtube.com/jadeangelamoore

Back in May & June I released two new series called ON MY RADIO and CARL & CHANEL.

Long story short...they BLEW UP!

These two shows are currently the TOP TWO SERIES ON THE YOUTUBE CHANNEL!    

Combined they have over 15,000 views! 

Dope right?!

MO' MONEY!!!

Well, what do people need when they do an Indiegogo campaign: MONEY!

Yes, ON MY RADIO and CARL & CHANEL are the top shows on the channel. Annnnddd....WE ARE OFFICIALLY BROKE! Myself and other producers have come out of our own pockets to produce these successful first seasons. But the well has run dry...*sad face*

THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN! HELP US PUT OUT A DOPE SEASON 2!

When you donate to the JAM FAM Campaign, there are a lot of perks that come with it: 

  • Digital downloads of the first season of the series of your choice
  • Extras including behind the scenes and outtakes of the first season of your choice
  • Digital downloads of the sophisticated, sexy, and sensual soundtracks of the series of your choice
  • JAM FAM t-shirts
  • Personal video messages from the cast and producers of the series of your choice
  • Early release of the Season 2 Premiere of the series of your choice
  • Sponsorship of an episode from the series of your choice

Sounds sweet if you ask me!

This PANDEMIC though...

We know times are uncertain and employment has been inconsistent so we understand if you cannot give MONETARILY. However, you can definitely give VERBALLY which is FREE!

  • SPREAD THE WORD! (open your big mouth)
  • SHARE THE CAMPAIGN! (the click of a button)

We appreciate all you do JAM FAM! We love you!

- JAM (Jade Angela Moore)

story:
The Power of Sharing True Stories

storybooth is an award-winning animated storytelling platform that collects real stories from kids in their own words and voices, animates the best of them and publishes them on our YouTube channel, website and mobile app.

The power of sharing true stories.

At storybooth, kids can be real. They are bold and brave, revealing their secrets, embarrassing moments, strengths and flaws, tragedies and triumphs. 

Like Pilar, who admits to being a bully on Instagram and inspires us to learn from our mistakes. Katherine, who through the pain of losing a best friend to suicide encourages others to "be the writers of their own lives and end their sentence with a semi-colon, and not a period." Chloe, who shares the terror she experienced in her homeroom during a lock-down at school. Or Jack who tells the story of losing his best friend - his dog Leo - and how he got through it.

 

    The Impact

    Every day, hundreds of thousands of kids come to storybooth, inspiring and empowering each other and themselves, coming out of hiding, sharing their truths, and bringing light to the world. 

    Why IndieGOGO?

    storybooth is a by-kids-for-kids platform. It is authentic, organic, and co-created – the community makes it as good as it is. storybooth is committed to going anywhere that the audience needs it to go, and promises to cover the topics that the community wants to hear and talk about.

    That’s why we decided to do this, to allow the widest possible community of people who care deeply about young people, and the stories they share, to be a part of what makes storybooth as good as it is – a powerful community of backers – and to make it better.

    We have watched the power of our community of young people elevate storybooth, and we have watched storybooth, in turn, elevate them. 

    We believe our community of backers can do the same, allowing us to continue to start and be in the tough topics and conversations that young people want and need, and to let the audience guide us where they need us to go.

    What we will do with the funds.

    Every story that we are able to animate and post, each week, brings millions of kids to the platform. 

    There are so many stories that need to be told and shared and we can't afford to stop being that platform and channel for young people. We didn't expect to receive over 40,000 stories from kids all over the world in such a short time, or that we would grow our audience this quickly. 

    Kids want to see more of their stories animated and we want to give that to them. The more stories we produce, the bigger the impact we can make.  

    That's why we need your help - to move fast, animate more amazing stories told by amazing kids, and share them with the world. 

    Reaching our goal will let us put more stories into production, and impact more and more kids. Exceeding it will help us impact even more! This is Indiegogo after all. We could exceed our goal, and all have an amazing story to tell!

    storybooth accolades.

    We're young, just over a year old, but we've already received great recognition and won some highly coveted awards. We even beat out some of the big guys like Sesame Street, PBS Kids, and TeenVogue. 

    2017 Webby Award - Best in Youth

    2017 Shorty Award - Best Kids and Lifestyle App

    Watch more stories...

    CLICK HERE to see all our stories on YouTube 

    Or watch some below....

     

    Stretch goals.

    If we all didn't dream big nothing big would ever happen. Our goal allows us to keep going with our audience, to hopefully lift up and empower millions more kids, for now - but - exceeding our goals and really stretching, that can help us touch so many more lives with so many more stories!

    Who we are.

    Risks and challenges.

    storybooth has produced over 75 of its unique animated shorts in the past 18 months, working with an amazing and dedicated team of directors, producers, and animators. With proper funding there is no risk that storybooth videos won't be produced and distributed at the cadence and on the platforms we are currently on.

    The rewards that we have committed to our fans, backers, and supporters are not contingent on anything beyond reaching or exceeding our funding goal.

story:
Stacks is a television pilot being produced as a senior thesis for Azusa Pacific University!

 

When his grandmother unexpectedly dies and leaves him her bookstore, Finley, a failed young businessman, and a group roleplaying nerd’s help continue her secret operation of getting illegal immigrants across the border.

 

We are a multiethnic and mainly female lead crew.  We are very excited to get to make this pilot for a series that we want to be inclusive and heartfelt. Telling these kinds of stories is extremely important to all us!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise 5000 through Indiegogo and we need your help! There is a lot that goes into making something like this and every dollar helps. If we succeed we maybe able to pitch our pilot to networks and submit to festivals! As well as make an impact in our community.

 

Money we raise goes directly to our production and would help: production design, camera equipment, locations, and of course feeding our crew!

 

And of course helping us out through indiegogo will get you some perks as well. Including: A thank you letter, personalized bookmark, a copy of our script, or a executive producer credit!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can follow us and our progress at any of our social media pages @stacksapu!

 

And if you’d like to make a tax deductible donation instead please email stacksapu@gmail.com for more infomation!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I am Evie Marie Warner. I am an indie filmmaker from Dayton, Ohio. I have been doing short films for several years. I love creating content that makes people think, educate or laugh.  Sometimes all at once. 

I am currently working on a superhero web series that will do a little bit of both. Super Z will consist of around 3 to four roughly  ten minute comedic female centric episodes that highlights the rise and fall of a woman named Zoe, known as Super Z.  Just like Batman, and scores of other DC and Marvel heroes, she thinks her father is dead. But what if it was all a lie?

What is exciting is that we will be able to use our filming location to help other filmmakers and small businesses in the community.  

Thanks to the generousity of friends and family we already  have a 9 x 13 green screen,  new softbox lights, and a new zoom recorder with lavs. We are going to need a floor air conditioner. We are also making some DIY Sound Absorption Panels

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pABvTWSxOes&amp...

We think you will enjoy watching Zoe cope with facing her new reality with heart and humor as we parody the biggest tropes and themes of our beloved comic books that is like an adult version of Henry Danger and The Thundermans.

We hope you will join Team Z and help us make a fun and exciting show for the kid in all of us. And by supporting our campaign you are also going to help other artist needing studio space but don’t have hundreds or even thousands of dollars to rent a professional studio space.

What We Need & What You Get

For this superhero comedy to be successful we are going to need the following:

  1. Costumes which will be about half of our over all budget.
  2. Floor air conditioner
  3. Food
  4.  Rental equipment
  5. Studio space monthly rental cost
  6. Post-Production such as sub-titles 
  7. Possible submission to festivals. 

If we make more than our $500.00 dollar goal, we will be to use that on costumes and food and better, highter quality absorption panels.  If we get $800.00, We can put some of that towards a camera other creatives can use.  If we get a $1,000.00, we would put that towards greater sound insoluation of the space.  

We have opportunities for your name to be permanently displayed on our wall, letting people know who made this unique space available to the filmmaking community. You can also name a future character and be part of a special facebook group where you can continue to  follow our journey. 

The Impact

By supporting our efforts, you will help providing a unique space that can be used by other small productions to make shorts,  student film projects, and small business to make youtube videos.  Also, help support diversity in film by supporting a female  director. Every gift is making artistic expression thru digital media more accessible for filmmakers of all levels. 

Risks & Challenges

 I have made a total of six films.  I have never been invilved in a film that never made it out of post-production once shooting wrapped.  Some times that can be a huge challenge for filmmakers.  But whether a pip bursts at a film location, an actor drops out or an unexpected illness, I have learned to adapt and overcome these obstacles.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't forget to like and share our campaign!

story:
Gator Greg is the launch project for MiTribe Productions. We are excited to be bringing this story to life in an animated format and hope you will help us to make our trailer! We plan on using this sizzle as a pitch for network television and other media outlets. The better our pitch is delivered, the more likely we are to be involved in the show once it is picked up.

WHO WE ARE:

Rowan Jang is a founder and co-owner of MiTribe Productions. An actor at heart, Rowan’s passion for story telling began at a young age, performing in school plays with Henry Corbet. After graduating from the Vancouver Academy of Dramatic Arts in 2014, Rowan established himself in the industry with roles in TV, theatre and independent film. Reuniting with Henry Corbet in April 2016 to make the short film “Dark Day And Night” Rowan was inspired to become involved in the creation process of film and TV and decided to become a producer. Rowan and Henry co-founded MiTribe Productions and began working on their launch project “Gator Greg.” Rowan is excited to start this new venture and looks forward to seeing Gator Greg come to life.

Henry Corbet was born in Burnaby B.C. Being the youngest of five he has always been in a character driven environment. Henry has played guitar since age 14 and piano since age 6. Henry has since used his musical skills to compose his own music for film related projects. After take a film course in his last year of high school he attended the motion picture arts program at Capilano University. After gaining his certificate Henry went on to write/direct and score his first indie short film "Dark Day And Night."  https://mitribeproductions.com/our-projects/dar...

Since then he has co-founded the company MiTribe Productions with actor/producer Rowan Jang and is excited to be developing the animated series Gator Greg.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to produce our sizzle reel we will need $6,615.00 to cover expenses.

    Budget Breakdown

    Total budget estimate (w/GST): $6,615.00

    Pre-production: $1200

    Producer: $400

    Storyboard Artist: $2800

    Sound Designer: $200

    Editor: $400

    AFX Compositor/VFX: $1200

    Post Materials: $100

     

    Our perks range from a personal thank you from our recording studio to an executive producer credit.

    If our goal isn't reached, the money we do raise will go towards character animation and we will bootstrap the rest, but we believe you would much rather our reel looks the best it can. 

    The Impact

    The tagline for the show is "old souls stay young forever." The Gator Greg story emulates the power of youth and the importance of younger generations to the world. This is at it's heart a show about family and we think it is very important to try and get younger viewers to respond to this message. Being an animation, the issues Greg faces that mirror society are far more digestible to viewers young and old.

    The Gator Greg world clearly and vigorously mirrors societies we see today in the real world. Being a cartoon it can be easily digested by audiences young and old who may turn a blind eye to the obvious problems in the world. Many people today in western society believe that we are in a post-prejudice environment. Gator Greg is here to prove that far more progress is in order to create an ideal world.

    Greg’s world constantly has implicit or explicit themes of tolerance and prejudice, which young people need to hear. They’ve had some exposure to these themes in recent movies, but a televised series would be able to present multiple examples in more in-depth ways, and more frequently. Writers of the show would also be able to take examples from real-life incidents and apply them to the story to an extent. This creates a parallel that is easy to understand for young minds. Issues that affect the children of today would be portrayed.

    Portrayal is important. The creators of Gator Greg have put a lot of effort into making the characters’ experiences representative, including issues that many children and adults have faced, such as childhood trauma or prejudice, or even extreme experiences such as neglect and or other forms of abuse. Like everyone, all the characters in this show have their own flaws and we as the audience are waiting for them to redeem themselves so we too may feel their victory to inspire our everyday actions.

    It also features a gritty yet escapist tone that hasn’t been present since the Batman Animated Series. This aspect could appeal to older audiences looking for a film noir edge with a borderline anti-hero at its helm to harken them back to a time when western 2D animation played in a majestic fashion such as older Warner Brother and Disney projects.

    The culture manifested for this series stems from a multitude of music genres and important eras in human history that would invite fans from of a great number of demographic divisions and sub-divisions. Being a fictional world of animals, there are many opportunities to relive iconic periods from all ages and in turn concoct original artistic societies and sub-cultures.

    All in all, it’s a show about characters doing the right thing, even if it’s not what their society allows. It’s fun, entertaining, and real, and could inspire a whole new generation of social activism.

    Risks & Challenges

    If the show is to go into production, there is a risk of losing a great deal of creative involvement. Our plan to combat this possibility is to prove our capabilities via execution of the sizzle reel.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If money is tight for you, you can still help us get this project off the ground! Sharing this page with your friends can go a long way! Visit our website https://mitribeproductions.com/ for updates on the show and follow us on Instagram at _mitribe_ to see our character designs emerge! Most importantly make sure to tune in when Gator Greg comes to life.

    We appreciate all your generosity and support and hope we can deliver a truly outstanding show for you!

After graduating from the Vancouver Academy of Dramatic Arts in 2014, Rowan established himself in the industry with roles in TV, theatre and independent film. Reuniting with Henry Corbet in April 2016 to make the short film “Dark Day And Night” Rowan was inspired to become involved in the creation process of film and TV and decided to become a producer. Rowan and Henry co-founded MiTribe Productions and began working on their launch project “Gator Greg.” Rowan is excited to start this new venture and looks forward to seeing Gator Greg come to life.
Henry Corbet was born in Burnaby B.C. Being the youngest of five he has always been in a character driven environment. Henry has played guitar since age 14 and piano since age 6. Henry has since used his musical skills to compose his own music for film related projects. After take a film course in his last year of high school he attended the motion picture arts program at Capilano University. After gaining his certificate Henry went on to write/direct and score his first indie short film "Dark Day And Night."  https://mitribeproductions.com/our-projects/dar...
Since then he has co-founded the company MiTribe Productions with actor/producer Rowan Jang and is excited to be developing the animated series Gator Greg.
 

What We Need & What You Get
In order to produce our sizzle reel we will need $6,615.00 to cover expenses.


Budget Breakdown
Total budget estimate (w/GST): $6,615.00
Pre-production: $1200
Producer: $400
Storyboard Artist: $2800
Sound Designer: $200
Editor: $400
AFX Compositor/VFX: $1200
Post Materials: $100
 
Our perks range from a personal thank you from our recording studio to an executive producer credit.
If our goal isn't reached, the money we do raise will go towards character animation and we will bootstrap the rest, but we believe you would much rather our reel looks the best it can. 
The Impact
The tagline for the show is "old souls stay young forever." The Gator Greg story emulates the power of youth and the importance of younger generations to the world. This is at it's heart a show about family and we think it is very important to try and get younger viewers to respond to this message. Being an animation, the issues Greg faces that mirror society are far more digestible to viewers young and old.
The Gator Greg world clearly and vigorously mirrors societies we see today in the real world. Being a cartoon it can be easily digested by audiences young and old who may turn a blind eye to the obvious problems in the world. Many people today in western society believe that we are in a post-prejudice environment. Gator Greg is here to prove that far more progress is in order to create an ideal world.
Greg’s world constantly has implicit or explicit themes of tolerance and prejudice, which young people need to hear. They’ve had some exposure to these themes in recent movies, but a televised series would be able to present multiple examples in more in-depth ways, and more frequently. Writers of the show would also be able to take examples from real-life incidents and apply them to the story to an extent. This creates a parallel that is easy to understand for young minds. Issues that affect the children of today would be portrayed.
Portrayal is important. The creators of Gator Greg have put a lot of effort into making the characters’ experiences representative, including issues that many children and adults have faced, such as childhood trauma or prejudice, or even extreme experiences such as neglect and or other forms of abuse. Like everyone, all the characters in this show have their own flaws and we as the audience are waiting for them to redeem themselves so we too may feel their victory to inspire our everyday actions.
It also features a gritty yet escapist tone that hasn’t been present since the Batman Animated Series. This aspect could appeal to older audiences looking for a film noir edge with a borderline anti-hero at its helm to harken them back to a time when western 2D animation played in a majestic fashion such as older Warner Brother and Disney projects.
The culture manifested for this series stems from a multitude of music genres and important eras in human history that would invite fans from of a great number of demographic divisions and sub-divisions. Being a fictional world of animals, there are many opportunities to relive iconic periods from all ages and in turn concoct original artistic societies and sub-cultures.
All in all, it’s a show about characters doing the right thing, even if it’s not what their society allows. It’s fun, entertaining, and real, and could inspire a whole new generation of social activism.

Risks & Challenges
If the show is to go into production, there is a risk of losing a great deal of creative involvement. Our plan to combat this possibility is to prove our capabilities via execution of the sizzle reel.
Other Ways You Can Help

If money is tight for you, you can still help us get this project off the ground! Sharing this page with your friends can go a long way! Visit our website https://mitribeproductions.com/ for updates on the show and follow us on Instagram at _mitribe_ to see our character designs emerge! Most importantly make sure to tune in when Gator Greg comes to life.
We appreciate all your generosity and support and hope we can deliver a truly outstanding show for you!

story:
What's the Story, Morning Glory?

Clickbait: The Show is about a twenty-three year old writer named Spencer Silla, who' s having trouble balancing her creative freedom with the constant need for shameless self-promotion in our modern age. She creates a new YouTube account out of a need for some creative fulfillment and is shocked to find Elton Tube, son of the president of YouTube, in her apartment offering her a job. Elton explains that he and his siblings, Joplin and Joel Tube, are in a race to inherit the Tube family fortune and whoever makes the most popular channel wins it all. Now Elton and Spencer must gather a crew of filmmakers and start churning out videos as fast as they can, all the while forming love triangles and exploring the city.

So who's this Birney boy I'm hearing about?

Alright! Awesome, you've read this far, so that must mean I'm doing something right!

Before I talk about me, it'd be wrong of me not to give a huge thank you to our photographer Nathalie Basoski (@not.a.russian.spy and @nathaliebasoski), our animator Hyo Bin Kang  @hyoncebinaj), and our graphic designer Summer Synder (@summercsynder and www.ssnyderdesign.com).

Most of you already know me, but Malcolm said he'd probably share this with his grandma, so this is for her!

My name is Ephraim Birney. I am an actor, writer and aspiring Topher Grace look-a-like. Most of my credits are theatrical, where I seem to have been typecast as the character with no lines. You can also see me smoking weed in The Americans or getting stabbed in the neck in Gotham. Truly as journeyed a career as they come.

"So Ephraim," you might ask, "Why are you going through all the trouble of writing and producing a web-series if you're so artistically fulfilled by the auditions you don't get?" It's because this show is about more than me now. Sure, when I started writing, I was doing it to give myself a nice part to act. I'd get my friends together, we'd laugh at my self-deprecation and then we'd be done. But over the last couple of months, Clickbait has turned into a community of sorts. All of a sudden I was laughing and working with people I hadn't seen for years. Friends of mine who hadn't ever met were collaborating. Clickbait: The Show is going to be a home for the aspiring artist. For the actors who don't look like Emma Stone and Chris Hemsworth. For the filmmakers who want to experiment and the editors who have another idea entirely. I want to build a staircase for all of us who don't have a VIP pass into Hollywood, and every donation and helping hand gives us another step to climb.

Soooooo how much are we talking here?

Well, as you can see with my very candid reaction to our producer, we are asking for thirty thousand dollars. If you're still reading this after that number, then you've given me the benefit of the doubt and I will explain myself. All of us working on this show are abiding by the philosophy that if we do something, we're gonna do it well. Pretty much all of the footage you will see on this campaign was filmed four times. And we're still not happy with it. Now I'm perfectly fine working for free, but I can't do this all on my own. We need equipment, we need transportation, editing, pre-production, post-production, we wanted to give everyone custom Air Jordans, but honestly I'll be thankful if I can get everyone fed. Thirty thousand dollars is what we need to take this from a student film to something worthy of television.

But we at Clickbait aren't the only ones benefitting from your donations. We have plenty of nifty little perks for you to enjoy! I know what you all are really excited about; my desperate attempts to please you. 

We've got a wide variety perks to offer to our generous donors, ranging from a special thank you in the credits to full-on cameo appearances. My personal favorite is the custom clickbait article. With a donation of a hundred dollars or more, I will compose a clickbait article tailor-made for you and your achievements in a field of your choosing! The best part is that it's not a t-shirt that you'll never wear!

How will History view Clickbait?

Let's talk about impact. Our objective here at Clickbait: The Show is, and always will be, the creation of a giant robot mech suit that I can use to fight crime. We just have a very roundabout way of doing that. No, really, as nice as that would be, we're setting our first goals a little more realistically. Our hope is to use whatever we raise here to fund the production of at least one of the planned episodes. With a pilot filmed, edited, and looking nice and glossy, we'll have something to pitch to networks and online media outlets.

This whole journey is the first time most of us involved have attempted something like this. So I encourage everyone to use the show as a learning experience. That way we get plenty of fresh ideas and we develop something of a style unique to us. We're all working non-stop and everyday we get a little better, it's a very exciting feeling!

Risky Business and Business Risks

I'd say the risk is not raising enough money, but as my team has made abundantly clear to me, we're making this show whether you all want it or not. So if we raise five dollars, we will make this with tape recorders and Nokia phone cameras. And as hardcore and edgy as that might sound, I'd really appreciate it if you guys donated so we won't have to come to that.

The money obviously is important in regards to quality of our product, but it's also important to me to pay back all the hard work that our team has consistently provided. Everyone went into this expecting nothing in return for their work, and of course your donations go straight to the necessities first, but I want to treat this little family right and at least keep them fed during film shoots.

How can I do more?

Of course not everyone can give money, because not everyone has money to give. I fall into that category so I understand where you're coming from! Not to fear! There is still more that you can do for me! Mwahaha!

The first thing you can do is share this link on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and your Club Penguin account. You should also follow us on all our social media, @Clickbaittheshow (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter). I know it's an annoying thing to do, but it costs nothing from you and you'd be doing us an enormous favor. The more people who are talking about this, the better, so spread the word! There's a new sheriff in town!

The second thing you can do if you live in or around New York, is to come by and help out! We will always be in need of creative people. Whether you're an actor or director or just want to add a professional credit to your resume and learn a thing or two, we'd be happy to have you! 

Lastly, and this probably only applies to a few of you, if you'd like to become an Equity Investor, please contact us separately at TheClickBaitShow@gmail.com. 

AND THAT'S EVERYTHING!

Thank you all so much for sticking with me through this essay of a campaign pitch! Please, please, please help in whatever way you can. I know that this is going to be something special, and every dollar helps! 

Our campaign will be releasing new photos and videos pretty frequently so do remember to check in and see if we've got any new fun updates for you! We'll be here for 31 days, which goes by faster than you'd think, so don't procrastinate as much as I did with writing all of this!

I can't thank you all enough, so hopefully the show and it's quality will suffice! So keep an eye out, because you won't believe what happens next!

story:
The Mission

Our mission through this web series is much like the many goals our characters themselves experience through this story. To persevere, to fight, and to work towards something bigger than ourselves.

We as the audience will learn through the lessons of the characters. 

"Alone we can do so little, together we can do so much."

- Helen Keller

The Story

The story of “Dingos” will take us on an ultimate journey of the fight for freedom as our protagonist, James Stone, leads a renegade of the most hardened and ruthless against the criminal underworld that ravages through Sydney.

DINGOS will explore the relationship between friends and foes, and the courage it takes to unite them for the one thing all they all lack.

Freedom.

To you

To our families, our friends and our supporters.

We have chosen to tell this story as we believe it has the potential to set a new benchmark for the Australian media environment.

A story of young people forming a union against all odds, to achieve their most precious goal. Much of what we witness within the story describes many of the artists involved with bringing this story to the screen. But we can't do it alone.

A project of this size requires a lot of help. The project has a budget of $5000 AUD.

With that, we will produce the Pilot episode of DINGOS, to use as a proof of concept in order to gain funding for the entire First Season.

Any contribution you bring to to make this happen, no matter how big or small, makes a huge difference.

We have a range of perks from a “Thank You” Credit, to Official Merchandise, to various on-screen Producers Credits. 

Thank You!

Thank you for reading and we look forward to having you on board.

story:
Écrire ce que l’on connait, voilà le point de départ de Beddin’

La dépression est un mal physique. La dépression est une peine de cœur avec la vie. La dépression est un cancer de l’âme.  La dépression fait mal autant à la personne qui en souffre qu’aux personnes qui l’aiment et qui sont impliquées dans sa vie.

Avec la prise en main de ma guérison, par la thérapie et les lectures diverses, j’ai réalisé que j’avais le privilège d’être capable d’exprimer ce par quoi j’étais passé, de manière créative.

Non seulement, je trouvais important de partager l’expérience de ma dépression, je trouvais aussi nécessaire de le faire. Je ne suis pas la seule grande blessée par la vie. Nous sommes plusieurs et ça me brise le cœur de nous voir tous nous cacher dans la douleur et la honte.  Je veux que Beddin’ mette en lumière ce qui nous fait mal.  Plus vite on accepte notre fragilité, plus vite la vie devient plus facile.

 

Beddin’ est né il y a 2 ans

Nous travaillons seuls sur Beddin’ depuis deux ans, mais pour passer à l’étape suivante, nous devons agrandir l’équipe. Nous débutons le tournage des épisodes de fiction à la fin octobre et nous devrons payer des salaires, nous incluant pour la première fois depuis deux ans.

De plus, afin d’approfondir le travail de sensibilisation sur la dépression, nous avons décidé d’accompagner chaque épisode d’une capsule explicative où des intervenants analyseront les thèmes et les enjeux soulevés.  Nous devrons donc payer leurs cachets.

Nous nous engageons à tourner, quoiqu’il arrive. Le lancement aura lieu en 2018.

 

Les contreparties et les évènements sociaux

La dépression peut être considérée comme un sujet parfois lourd, nous avons donc décidé de faire une campagne de sociofinancement ludique qui célèbre la vie.

Nous sommes très heureux de réaliser tout le support que nous avons des commerces de notre quartier, Hochelaga-Maisonneuve et nous avons très hâte de dévoiler les récompenses que vous pourrez obtenir en échange de votre soutien financier.

Afin de rester dans l’esprit du partage et de l’engagement social, plusieurs évènements et performances sont prévus tout au cours de la campagne. Restez à l’affut, vous pourriez rencontrer le personnage de Claudia en pyjama et robe de chambre dans un café près de chez vous.

 

Merci!

Nous espérons rester en contact avec vous, tout au long de notre campagne de sociofinancement. Nous voulons en faire un évènement interactif où vous pourrez partager vos expériences personnelles avec nous, grâce à nos réseaux sociaux.

Aidez-nous à faire grandir la famille Beddin’. Parlez-en autour de vous.

Merci de votre précieux soutien.

story:
UPDATE ! Sneak Peek animatic here !

FULL SONG HERE !
 

 

Short Summary

Welcome to our spooky campaign ! Let me introduce ourselves - Paul and I, Magpie, are the two creators of Zombie Oblivion, a short 2D animated musical number about our characters, Sir Mayhem and his assistant, Vee, who accidentally created a horde of zombies.


Paul and I have both been passionate about art our entire lives. I (Magpie) have previously worked on shows such as Hazbin Hotel, Holidaze, Zoophobia and Helluvaboss. I've also directed our first short film, MAYHEM, which was  the pilot introducing our characters.

I've learned a lot from the pilot, and am planning on using what I've learned during production to make a new short of even higher quality !

If this campaign succeeds, we'll be able to fund all the hard work that goes into making an animated short film - paying animators, sound designers, music composers and voice actors/singers.

As you can tell by the animated intro used as this campaign's introduction video, we have improved a lot since the pilot episode, especially regarding art consistency, and the Halloween special will be even better ! But if you want to see what we have previously completed in just 5 months of production, here is the MAYHEM pilot short film :

 

Meet the team ! 

Our lovely voice actors for this short are, Kieran Flitton as Sir Mayhem - Black Gryph0n (Gabriel C. Brown) as Sir Mayhem's singing voice - Monica Franco as Vee, Elsie Lovelock as Queen Bee and Wiley Koyote making a bunch of really gross Zombie noises :D

Our Artist & Animators !

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're aiming for a budget of £15 000 (we are British !) for this short film. It does seem like a huge amount, tho let me break down for you the costs that will go into this animation :

Animation costs on average about $50 per second (tho effects like explosions, etc, can go way over  that !) I want to make sure that everyone in my team is being paid fairly and consistently throughout production.

In summary, the budget will be :
$10-11k for animation/effects, 1.5k in audio (sound effects, music and voice acting), the rest towards background paintings/art supplies for said backgrounds/direction/perks/fees (Indiegogo & Paypal)

The rest of the budget will go rewards, Indiegogo fees, and into  paying Paul and myself for our work : hand painting all of the backgrounds of the film, helping with animation cleanup, compositing, and pre production.
Directing a short film takes a huge amount of time, and because of this we won't be able to do much work on the side to have an income, which is why we need a share of the budget.
We had previously done a small campaign to help finance the end of production for MAYHEM : and you may notice that the amount was considerably low compared to this new one, and the reason for this was because I had used my personal savings to finance the first film, which I can't afford to do a second time.


We have a bunch of even more unique perks than the last campaign we did to help fund the first Mayhem pilot ! 

We're proud to offer new enamel pins of Sir Mayhem, Vee and Queen Bee !



We'll also be offering a selction of button pins, A4 prints (signed by Paul and I if you so desire), postcards, hand painted water color characters - AND we'll be selling once again  the tradirionally hand painted backgrounds used for the production of the film !

 

BACKGROUNDS CURRENTLY AVAILABLE !

More will be added in there as production continues.



We are also currently working a comic about Sir Mayhem's origin story, and all the pages of this comic are inked traditionally by Paul and I - those pages will be offered as perks in this campaign as well. (Note : the pages are sketched digitally, printed out, and then inked tradirionally.)
 




Now, the unpleasent part : what if we DON'T reach our goal ?
Well, we're aiming to get the film out on Halloween day, October 31st.
I'll make this campaign a flexible funding, so we'll use any funds we'll get - however, if we don't reach our goal, we might not be able to hit the Halloween deadline. I'll still make sure that  the film gets done, but I will have to save up myself for the amount of the campaign with my spare money, which will most likely take a few month, hopefully under a year if I manage to still sell some merchandise on  the side etc.

If by some miracle we get more donations than we need, we'll make sure to save the money for the next project, because you haven't seen the last of us yet ! :D

 

The Impact

This year has been a very difficult one for everyone : most of us have been depressed, scared, got our vacations ruined, were unable to see our friends and loved ones for a ridiculous amount of time. I may not be able to fix that, but I like to believe that people who create entertainment such as animations, comedy videos, etc, help to bring a few smiles to people (this is even true without the current situation this year, too !)
I will make sure that this Halloween musical does not disappoint you guys !

My last campaign may not have reached its goal, but the project got completed anyway ! It was my frist ever short film I directed with a team of people, and I'm very proud of what we managed to accomplish in just 5 months of production !

Risks & Challenges

The only real risk is that we won't reach the goal of this campaign, and therefore not be able to meet the deadline.
However, as our previous project shows, we don't give up easily ! And even if this takes us quite awhile to gather the funds by saving our own money, we will make it happen ! It might just take us a lot longer.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate, it's okay ! You can still support us on our Twitter page @Villains_Co ! We'll be posting a lot of updates on the project on there and interact with people as often as we can :D

Share the link to this campaign on your social media and this will help us a lot more than you think !

Thanks a lot everyone for reading this and helping us to make our dreams come true :D

See you during the spooky month !
story_txt:
UPDATE ! Sneak Peek animatic here !

FULL SONG HERE !
 


 

Short Summary
Welcome to our spooky campaign ! Let me introduce ourselves - Paul and I, Magpie, are the two creators of Zombie Oblivion, a short 2D animated musical number about our characters, Sir Mayhem and his assistant, Vee, who accidentally created a horde of zombies.
Paul and I have both been passionate about art our entire lives. I (Magpie) have previously worked on shows such as Hazbin Hotel, Holidaze, Zoophobia and Helluvaboss. I've also directed our first short film, MAYHEM, which was  the pilot introducing our characters.I've learned a lot from the pilot, and am planning on using what I've learned during production to make a new short of even higher quality !
If this campaign succeeds, we'll be able to fund all the hard work that goes into making an animated short film - paying animators, sound designers, music composers and voice actors/singers.
As you can tell by the animated intro used as this campaign's introduction video, we have improved a lot since the pilot episode, especially regarding art consistency, and the Halloween special will be even better ! But if you want to see what we have previously completed in just 5 months of production, here is the MAYHEM pilot short film :

 
Meet the team ! 
Our lovely voice actors for this short are, Kieran Flitton as Sir Mayhem - Black Gryph0n (Gabriel C. Brown) as Sir Mayhem's singing voice - Monica Franco as Vee, Elsie Lovelock as Queen Bee and Wiley Koyote making a bunch of really gross Zombie noises :D

Our Artist & Animators !



 
What We Need & What You Get
We're aiming for a budget of £15 000 (we are British !) for this short film. It does seem like a huge amount, tho let me break down for you the costs that will go into this animation :
Animation costs on average about $50 per second (tho effects like explosions, etc, can go way over  that !) I want to make sure that everyone in my team is being paid fairly and consistently throughout production.
In summary, the budget will be :$10-11k for animation/effects, 1.5k in audio (sound effects, music and voice acting), the rest towards background paintings/art supplies for said backgrounds/direction/perks/fees (Indiegogo & Paypal)The rest of the budget will go rewards, Indiegogo fees, and into  paying Paul and myself for our work : hand painting all of the backgrounds of the film, helping with animation cleanup, compositing, and pre production.Directing a short film takes a huge amount of time, and because of this we won't be able to do much work on the side to have an income, which is why we need a share of the budget.We had previously done a small campaign to help finance the end of production for MAYHEM : and you may notice that the amount was considerably low compared to this new one, and the reason for this was because I had used my personal savings to finance the first film, which I can't afford to do a second time.

The Impact

I may not be able to fix that, but I like to believe that people who create entertainment such as animations, comedy videos, etc, help to bring a few smiles to people (this is even true without the current situation this year, too !)I will make sure that this Halloween musical does not disappoint you guys !My last campaign may not have reached its goal, but the project got completed anyway ! story:
Hey Loyal Fans!

 

We are really excited that you have found your way to our Indiegogo campaign! If you support us in this journey, you'll be supporting a really cool lemons/lemonade situation.

 

WHO WE ARE

ComedySportz is the longest-running, game-based, short form improv comedy show in the comedy capital of the world, perfect for all ages, offering comedy for everyone! ComedySportz's interactive format is emceed by a referee overseeing a hilarious battle of wits between the home team, the blue Downtown Chicago Bosses, and the "visiting" red team, scored by live keyboard music and rocking popular music between scenes!  Using audience suggestions and willing volunteers, our professional players  create short games, scenes and songs on the spot, and the winner is determined by the Applause-o-Meter and your laughs.

 

OUR CURRENT SITUATION

COVID has been especially hard on entertainment venues like our improv theater, ComedySportz. We were among the first to close and we'll be among the last to open. CSz Theater Chicago has pivoted to doing virtual shows on Zoom, but Zoom is definitely not the final destination of virtual comedy. We want to be pioneers taking things to the next step.

 

THE OPPORTUNITY

We have an intriguing but expensive opportunity to stream our shows on Twitch. We've done some prototyping. We know we can make this work. In order to do this though, we basically have to make ourselves into a TV studio. That mostly means purchasing new computer hardware and software, graphics support and so much more nerd stuff.

 

IT'S NOT FOR SURVIVAL, IT'S FOR INNOVATION!

In case you're wondering, we intend to keep producing content on Twitch long after people are allowed back into theaters. Indeed, we are hoping it becomes a new revenue source for us. So we are not asking for this money for our survival, this ask is for you to support evolution and innovation.

 

THE ACTUAL ASK 

We are asking for a one-time donation of literally any amount to help us purchase the equipment necessary to make the next step. 

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES 

Like anyone who is innovating, there is a pretty good chance we will need to revise our expectations along the way, but..... we have received A LOT of coaching and education along the way so far! We have done some prototyping (which showed us that we need more powerful equipment to run it!) and have learned some of the do's and don'ts with streaming, landing on the tWitch platform, which gives us the most opportunity for audience interaction and best case scenario, this will turn into a juicy new revenue stream for us.

story:
Overview

Rithvic Kumar and Erica Smith are two college students who would NEVER give each other the time of day. Unless they were in a pandemic. Which... they are.
 

What is Using Protection?

“Using Protection” is a web series co-written by Valen-Marie Santos, Rishi Mahesh, and Madi Hart, and directed by Valen-Marie Santos. The series shot April 30-2, May 7-9, and May 14-16, 2021. In “Using Protection,” two lost weirdos search for someone to connect to and something to believe in. 

How will my donation help?

“Using Protection” is a not-for-profit student web series with the help from crew members generously volunteering their time. The money raised from this Indiegogo page will directly contribute to post-production costs of the series, including but not limited to: editing, music licensing, and festival submission expenses. We greatly value your donation and want to recognize you through the available perks. The entire team of “Using Protection” wants to make sure this captivating and ambitious project comes to life!

 

Post Production

We want to thank EVERYONE who supported our first campaign! We had an incredibly successful shoot and are so hopeful for the finished product! But now it is time for us to commence and complete our post-production process! This means EDITING! MUSIC! SOUND DESIGN! FILM FESTIVALS! 

That being said, all of these things cost MONEY ($$$). We would love and appreciate any and all help that you are able to offer! As incentive we have the following perks available to make your donation more fun: 

  • $5: truth from team member of your choice
  • $10: team member of choice will make a TikTok of your choice
  • $15: playlist from a team member of your choice
  • $20: dare a team member of choice
  • $25: we will prank call your ex (or someone u just want us to)
  • $30: Ariella tells her family a secret
  • $50: Madi Gets an Eyebrow Notch
  • $100: Arie gets a nose piercing

FURTHERMORE, if we manage to reach $2000 by August 1st we will get matching Using Protection tattoos! That's right! You read it right! MATCHING. TATTOOS. 

Email ariannacu2020@u.northwestern.edu with details of your perk (which team member you choose, etc.).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Like we said, we appreciate any support you are willing to give. Some other ways to support our project include: 

  • Sharing our page to other friends and family! 
  • Following our Instagram for updates (@UsingProtectionWebSeries)!
  • Venmo @ArieCu if preferred over Indiegogo!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you again! We LOVE YOU!

- Using Protection Team

story:
Who Are We?

We're three sketch comedy friends that met at The Pack Theater in Hollywood, CA.  

What We Need

We did the math (HARD) of what it would take to get this pilot going, and we need funds for our director, AD, makeup, sound, craft services, location fees, etc.  We want to do this right, and even if we meet our goal, we expect to fund a decent amount of this ourselves.

Risks & Challenges

It's hard to produce a pilot!  Heck, it's hard to put together one good video sketch, we're looking to shoot at LEAST 8.  We already have half of them scheduled out, and the other half all take place in unique locations so it will take scouting, location fees, and we may not have the ability to combine sketches on certain days (which saves money).

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute yourself (we get it!) - you'd be doing us a great service by simply sharing it and encouraging your friends to share it.  Seriously, please do this if you are reading this sentence with your eyeballs.
