story:
Short Summary

SETTLING is a 6 x 5 minute comedy web series about a girl who wants to propose in 2017. The fight for gay marriage is still raging on, 70% of millennials still list marriage as a goal, and we've all seen those engagement pictures plastered on social media (apparently everyone loses their sense of irony once they've bought a diamond). Yet a surprising number of people still respond to the idea of a woman proposing to a man with questions like: ‘Is it a leap year?’ or, ‘The bastard, how long has he made you wait?’ This series asks what marriage means to us today, from a contemporary, female perspective.

Mattie is in love with Leo, but they still live in a flatshare, get paid minimum wage and hang out with a group of friends who use apps called Threender. Each bite-sized episode follows Mattie as she tackles doubts and questions from her friends, her boss, her parents, strangers and even her ex-boyfriend, before finally deciding whether to pop the question. Proposing as a girl has never been easy, but why is it still so hard?

We are a young team, with collective past experience of working in production on big-budget movies, self-making other comedy web series and writing and acting in comedy for TV and stage. Now we want to bring together our skills to tell a story we haven't seen told before, in a tone that we don't feel we hear enough on the UK comedy scene. Naturalistic, ironic, contemporary, but also warm, and centred on the female experience; we have been inspired by series like Transparent, Girls, Easy, Master of None, Catastrophe and Him & Her.

What We Need & What You Get

We are creating this off our own backs, by and large using locations, actors and crew who are kind and passionate enough to give up their time, to make something truly collaborative. This is about  taking some agency and making something of our own, which we can be proud of, rather than waiting for it to be handed to us.

So what we need is enough money to provide our actors with food and travel, pay for the pieces of kit that our production team don’t have, buy some specialist props and cover the cost of the less accessible locations. We are not asking you for anything that we don’t absolutely need, because we are willing to put everything we have into this ourselves. So, in the same spirit of collaboration, you can truly feel that you have given what you can – nothing more and (ideally) nothing less!

The Creative Team

RUBY THOMAS (writer/director/actor) - Ruby Thomas has acted in film, theatre and television, including the BBC comedy FAIL, BLANDINGS, AGATHA RAISIN, ENDEAVOUR, WILD CHILD and SPRING AWAKENING. She completed the Soho Writers Lab in 2016/17 and is on commission at Soho Theatre working on her comedy-drama EITHER, about monogamy and the paradox of choice. As a writer-performer she created comedy show CHICK for the Edinburgh Festival, which transferred to Soho Rising. She felt inspired to write this web series after proposing to her partner last year. The number of people who said, 'wow, you proposed to him, that's amazing!!' made her think about how proposing is one of the last bastions of gendered 'tradition' we seem reluctant, as a culture, to dismantle. And what better way to dismantle it than comedy? This will be her screen directing debut.

NEURON PRODUCTIONS (DOPs) - Sami and Hunter have been making films together for almost 15 years. They started out on their bedroom floors and founded NEURON two years ago. Since then, they’ve made a whole heap of videos - from comedy series, to music videos, to documentaries, and beyond. Comic Relief commissioned them to make the summer anthem SUMMER’S GONNA LAST FOREVER, and they’re finishing off work on the comedy web series NOT ALL MEN at the moment. They’ve made music videos for artists like Maz O’Connor and have created a documentary series about student life for CAMPUS SOCIETY. They’ve also been commissioned to produce videos for the NHS as well as businesses such as LEON and BAIN AND COMPANY. On top of all that, they’ve even filmed a wedding or two in their time - but this will be their first proposal.

VIVIEN KENNY (producer)- Vivien graduated from Falmouth University with a degree in Film in 2014. One of Vivien's graduate films STYLE BROKERS (Cairns, 2014),  a short documentary about the fashion brand Duffer Of St George, went on to compete in festivals such as Aesthetica Film Festival and BFI Future Film Fest. Once Vivien moved back to London in 2014 she joined DNA Films & TV as the in house production assistant, she then moved onto one of their productions as a production assistant and she now works at Heyday Films as an assistant to Producer David Heyman. Her feature film credits include THIRD STAR (Dalton, 2010), FAR FROM THE MADDING CROWD (Vinterberg, 2015), ANNIHILATION (Garland, 2018), PADDINGTON 2 (King, 2017) and the unnamed sequel to FANTASTIC BEASTS AND WHERE TO FIND THEM (Yates, 2018). 

The Cast

Our most persuasive feature is surely our utterly brilliant cast. From sitcoms to franchise movies to the West End stage, these actors have seen more trailers than a campsite. Yet every single one of them has agreed to perform in this for free, simply for the joy of it. Please, for the love of god, help us pay for their breakfasts.

MATTIE - Ruby Thomas (Endeavour, Fail, Agatha Raisin)

LEO - Ken Nwosu (Killing Eve, Christopher Robin)

THE FLATMATE - Alice Orr-Ewing (The Theory of Everything, Victoria)

THE BEST FRIEND - Isabella Laughland (Slaughterhouse Rulez, Chubby Funny)

THE OTHER BEST FRIEND - Amrou Al Kadhi (Run(a)way Arab, Absolutely Fabulous)

THE DAD - Gerard Horan (Outlander, The Detectorists, The Ferryman)

THE BOSS - Mathew Horne (Agatha Raisin, Bad Education, Gavin & Stacey)

THE BOSS'S WIFE - Niky Wardley (Are you Being Served?, Coronation Street)

THE JEWELLER - Corinna Powlesland (Pride and Prejudice, Doctors)

THE EX BOYFRIEND - Jeremy Neumark Jones (The Last Post, Jekyll & Hyde)

The Impact

As everyone knows, funding is hard to come by as a producer; interesting roles are hard to come by as an actor; and pretty much everything is hard to come by as a writer. So we wanted to do this ourselves, to show what we are capable as creatives, and to make something genuinely funny and real for an online audience. The series will be available to view on Vimeo and there will be a launch party and a screening for the public too.

We want this series to be a calling card for everyone involved, and we will use it to pitch to production companies and commissioners, in the hope of making SETTLING into something bigger: a full length series, or at the very least a second mini-series (bring on the wedding!), which you won’t have to pay for.

This is all about giving a platform to an utterly brilliant cast, in the funny, naturalistic, diverse roles that we don’t see often enough on TV.

NEURON PRODUCTIONS (DOPs) - Sami and Hunter have been making films together for almost 15 years. They started out on their bedroom floors and founded NEURON two years ago. Since then, they’ve made a whole heap of videos - from comedy series, to music videos, to documentaries, and beyond. Comic Relief commissioned them to make the summer anthem SUMMER’S GONNA LAST FOREVER, and they’re finishing off work on the comedy web series NOT ALL MEN at the moment. They’ve made music videos for artists like Maz O’Connor and have created a documentary series about student life for CAMPUS SOCIETY. They’ve also been commissioned to produce videos for the NHS as well as businesses such as LEON and BAIN AND COMPANY. On top of all that, they’ve even filmed a wedding or two in their time - but this will be their first proposal.
VIVIEN KENNY (producer)- Vivien graduated from Falmouth University with a degree in Film in 2014. One of Vivien's graduate films STYLE BROKERS (Cairns, 2014),  a short documentary about the fashion brand Duffer Of St George, went on to compete in festivals such as Aesthetica Film Festival and BFI Future Film Fest. Once Vivien moved back to London in 2014 she joined DNA Films & TV as the in house production assistant, she then moved onto one of their productions as a production assistant and she now works at Heyday Films as an assistant to Producer David Heyman. Her feature film credits include THIRD STAR (Dalton, 2010), FAR FROM THE MADDING CROWD (Vinterberg, 2015), ANNIHILATION (Garland, 2018), PADDINGTON 2 (King, 2017) and the unnamed sequel to FANTASTIC BEASTS AND WHERE TO FIND THEM (Yates, 2018). 

The Cast
Our most persuasive feature is surely our utterly brilliant cast. From sitcoms to franchise movies to the West End stage, these actors have seen more trailers than a campsite. Yet every single one of them has agreed to perform in this for free, simply for the joy of it. Please, for the love of god, help us pay for their breakfasts.
MATTIE - Ruby Thomas (Endeavour, Fail, Agatha Raisin)
LEO - Ken Nwosu (Killing Eve, Christopher Robin)
THE FLATMATE - Alice Orr-Ewing (The Theory of Everything, Victoria)
THE BEST FRIEND - Isabella Laughland (Slaughterhouse Rulez, Chubby Funny)
THE OTHER BEST FRIEND - Amrou Al Kadhi (Run(a)way Arab, Absolutely Fabulous)
THE DAD - Gerard Horan (Outlander, The Detectorists, The Ferryman)
THE BOSS - Mathew Horne (Agatha Raisin, Bad Education, Gavin & Stacey)
THE BOSS'S WIFE - Niky Wardley (Are you Being Served?, Coronation Street)
THE JEWELLER - Corinna Powlesland (Pride and Prejudice, Doctors)
THE EX BOYFRIEND - Jeremy Neumark Jones (The Last Post, Jekyll & Hyde)

The Impact
As everyone knows, funding is hard to come by as a producer; interesting roles are hard to come by as an actor; and pretty much everything is hard to come by as a writer. So we wanted to do this ourselves, to show what we are capable as creatives, and to make something genuinely funny and real for an online audience. The series will be available to view on Vimeo and there will be a launch party and a screening for the public too.
We want this series to be a calling card for everyone involved, and we will use it to pitch to production companies and commissioners, in the hope of making SETTLING into something bigger: a full length series, or at the very least a second mini-series (bring on the wedding!), which you won’t have to pay for.
This is all about giving a platform to an utterly brilliant cast, in the funny, naturalistic, diverse roles that we don’t see often enough on TV.

story:
What This Project Is:

These are stories of four expats, who live and work in Kyiv. They admire the architecture, the food, the music, the people, the history, the parks, the hilly streets, the secret bars, the whimsical statues, the gorgeous murals. They call Kyiv home and will let you see it through their eyes. There are four video chapters – each under 2-minutes, narrated in English by our characters – a journalist, an NGO worker, an IT specialist, and an artist.

Why This Is Important:

We have embarked on this journey to fix the unfortunate reality that, unlike New York, Paris, Berlin or Moscow, which all have been featured in multiple movies, music videos and commercials, Kyiv remains largely visually unknown to wide audiences abroad. Sadly, it hasn’t even gotten a decent video promo for the Eurovision 2017 song contest. We want to fix this injustice. We want to show that Kyiv is cinematic in its greenery and serenity, in its energy and movement, in its old and new facades and in the interesting characters inhabiting it, foreign and local. 

This will be the first project of its kind in English - personal accounts of four expats, who work in different industries in Ukraine's capital and who know and love Kyiv. For them, it's a city that inspires them, they see huge potential in it and want to tell you why Ukraine's capital is a special place!

Why You May Be Interested in Supporting Us:

If you have visited Kyiv before and have a special relationship with it in your heart, please help us express the love we share for this city. If you are someone who’s intrigued by what Kyiv is like, but have never visited, please help us create something that will allow you and others to experience Ukraine’s capital through our stories. 

If you live in Kyiv and are proud of our city, please help us show that Kyiv is Europe's best kept secret! 

Who We Are:

Elena Serdyuk is the author of the idea and director of the chapters. Elena works in film and commercial production in New York as a script supervisor and has worked as a journalist and video producer in Kyiv. Her love for Kyiv inspired her to seek out the like-minded foreigners, living in the city, and the project began to take shape. 

Olya Chernykh is the director of photography and producer. Olya has worked at one of Ukraine’s most successful production companies Toy Pictures as a producer, before moving onto working on independent projects. She has a full understanding of the production process and is passionate about her work.

Why We Need Your Help: 

With this campaign we are looking to cover our production and post-production costs. This is not in any way a money-making project for us - we believe in the potential of this series for spreading awareness about Ukraine's capital among people from other countries and cultures. 

We aim to produce commercial-quality stories on a shoe-string budget. An average rate for a 60-second TV commercial spot, shot in Kyiv these days is around $30,000, and we are trying to carry out a project that we feel strongly about for a small fraction of that. Our goal is $1,500 for each of the four chapters.

The funds we raise will allow us to pay for equipment rental, transportation, food for the crew, and post-production work. Everyone on the production team is enthusiastic about this project and agreed to rates much lower than normal, because we really want to show you Kyiv for what we all love it.

We hope to reach our monetary goal, but if we don't right away, we will still focus on the production of at least one or two chapters and then continue fundraising. We are serious and passionate about this. 

Challenges We Face:

We realize that this is an ambitious project, involving many moving parts - coordinating the schedules of our characters, arranging locations, some of which we have to pay for, requesting that our crew members work for less than they usually charge. Nonetheless, we feel strongly about embarking on this journey and hope you will support us along the way.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't contribute yourself, please share this campaign with friends and family. Any contribution, however small, will help us tell these Kyiv stories and share them with the world!

From Kyiv with love.

story:
Short Summary

Jake Iorio and Krystina Bailey are actors, producers and directors. They are both looking raise fund to complete their web series Two Singles.  

Jake Iorio (Credits: Karaganda, Glee) and Krystina Bailey (Credits: Blue Bloods, My Crazy Ex) met in an acting class a couple years ago and have stayed in touch since. They both starred in a comedic short film that Jake wrote called "An Online Engagement". It went on to win Award of Recognition in the 2018 Global Accolade Film Competition. You can view the short here  https://vimeo.com/262116928

Two Singles stars Carla Betz (Credits: Criminal Minds, Blood Relatives) and Jake Iorio as two friends who are single in the midst of their two other friends who get engaged. It's a hilarious story about looking for love and having acceptance for the now.  

We have shot all five episodes. However, in order for us to move forward we need to raise funds to help us get done with post production. This includes editing, sound editing/mixing, marketing, music and web festival fees. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise a flexible goal of $3,000 so we can get the costs covered for post production. Every dollar counts and whatever we raise it will go towards post production. It will help us bring the quality web series we want to provide you. There are also perks for each donation you have. 

 

Risks & Challenges

We need funds to help us complete post production. However, whatever we raise we will use all of it to get the project completed with all the available resources. If there's anything we have learned from shooting, when challenges arise we face them with a solution. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you donate, we would appreciate it if you mention it on any of your social media accounts! We want to get the word out. The more the merrier!

story:
I kid you not – the other week my seven-year-old Siena watched an iPad, an iPhone and the tv all at once because she “couldn’t decide what one to watch”. Yes, this is the world we live in but I’m keen to change it!


My new children’s show will be displaying the lives of other more disadvantaged kids around the world.
Read that again. Yes, through the medium of magic I’m set to be filming a new series at the extremes of the world to show kids like mine the “harsh realities” of life in other places. You may see me popping up in Argentina or Antarctica, Calcutta or Cuba.
We’re all in this parenting thing together and I’d like to feel we could all be in this series together. Which is why I’m selling magic tricks and experiences to raise 80k over the next month for this.
I’d love your support and more than that I’d like to impact our kids! Please jump onto my Indigogo platform below and see what you can do.
Can’t wait to show you all what we create as part of this!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $80,000 this will contribute towards

  • Film crew, post-production, scriptwriters, insurance, flights, equipment hire & music licencing.
  • You can help us reach our goal by purchasing one of our unique magic products
  • If we don't meet our budget this will limit the number of episodes we can film and locations we can visit. Our aim is to film 5 episodes in over 10 locations. 

THANK YOU - THANK YOU - THANK YOU!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends and share on social media - Thank you!!

story:
We want to challenge representation of South Asians in media with characters and stories covering the SPECTRUM of South Asian-Americans (Women, men, Sikhs, Hindus, Muslims, LGBTQIA, etc. they're all here!) and exploring their lives in a three-dimensional way.

Powered by rising South Asian-American comedians, artists, musicians, this series has been a grass-roots of independence and community to fight for the right to tell our own stories.

Unlike many other crowdfunding campaigns, we already have a finished Pilot episode. We are now looking to raise funds to produce the rest of the first season! 

Instead of hoping for the industry to tell these stories, we want to do it ourselves and deliver it directly to YOU! No censorship, no subscriptions, no dependency, just a show made BY the people and FOR the people.

Code-Switched is a comedy-drama series that follows the interconnected lives of five South Asian-American roommates and friends trying to blaze their own trails in a world of high-expectations, fleeting relationships, and gentrified workplaces.

The first group, Zara, and Priya, are career-focused women who aim to carve a life on their terms while juggling marriage proposals, thirsty men, and their male-dominant workplaces. The second group, Rahul, Krish, and Joe are ambitious, yet insecure men who try and carve their lines in the sand between parental expectations and their own desires. 

The Pilot episode just finished a very successful festival run of 7 SELECTIONS and 3 AWARDS including 'Best Web Series' at the Los Angeles Film Awards and TopShorts Online Film Festival! It received critical reception from festival judges and audiences who are excited to see more. 

Sonal Aggarwal - A stand-up comedian, performer, and fire-juggler (no joke) who can be seen performing around Chicago at several venues like The Laugh Factory, Zanies, and Comedy Bar. Sonal is also a producer on Congrats on Your Success, one of Chicago’s longest-running independent shows, and Spin-Off, a Chicago independent comedy collective. Sabeen Sadiq - A proud Pakistani-American stand-up comedian and improviser who performs nationally and has co-produced several shows at venues like Cobbs Comedy Club and the San Jose Improv. Sabeen has performed at several showcases around the country like Muslim Funny Fest NYC and San Francisco Desi Comedy Fest.  Saurabh Pande - A Chicago-based improviser who has performed all around the country with The Second City Touring Company and was selected for the prestigious Bob Curry Fellowship. Saurabh has written and performed in several sketch-shows including Cowboys and Immigrants and Fast, Loud, & Funny.  Vikram Pandya -  A stand-up comedian and improviser from Chicago who co-founded one of Chicago’s marquee production teams, 'Team Us Comedy'. Vik is a nationally-touring comic who was a Stand Up NBC 2017 quarterfinalist. He's also opened for Michelle Wolf & Roy Wood Jr. of The Daily Show and performs regularly at The Laugh Factory & Zanies Comedy Club.

Stephen George - A Chicago-based actor who is known for his recurring role on the Netflix series, Easy, as well as several award-winning short films and music videos like Broad Shoulders. Stephen has transferred his comedic style and performance into viral online videos by The Onion and Buzzfeed. 

 

 

With the creator taking $0 and the cast & crew taking minimal rates, the majority of the funds will be used towards production expenses.

   

This campaign will run for 5 weeks. Once funded, our schedule is:

  • Pre-Production: December 2017 - Mid-January 2018
  • Production: Late-January to Mid-February 2018
  • Post-Production: Late-February - Mid-March 2018
  • Release: Spring 2018! 

We will be releasing the entire season of the show in Spring 2018 for FREE STREAMING!

It all starts with our talented and hard-working team from Chicago. We're trying to make a show that reflects experiences we've all gone through while having a blast doing it! An all person-of-color producing team, many strong women, and a mix of passionate filmmakers, we are a reflection of the work we are making.

 

Karan Sunil, the writer/director of the series, has won several awards including 'Best TV/Web Screenplay' at the Los Angeles Independent Film Festival Awards for Code-Switched and has shown work at festivals around the country. Karan's dream is to make a show that reflects the multi-cultural world we live in.

"As a South Asian-American millennial myself, I've always wanted to contribute to how my people are depicted in media, and tackle issues of identity. There are so many more faces and stories yet to be shown on television and I believe comedy is a useful tool to tell these stories."

There are several ways you can help bring this show to life!

1. Donate to our campaign and get some sweet perks. 

Help us bring the season straight to you!

2. Share the campaign with your family and friends. 

Help us spread the word so we can all enjoy it together!

3. Follow the show on Facebook and Instagram.

Connect with us, we wanna hear from you!

Thank you so much for your support,

Let's make a show!

-- The Code-Switched Team

Karan's dream is to make a show that reflects the multi-cultural world we live in.

There are several ways you can help bring this show to life!
1. Donate to our campaign and get some sweet perks. 
Help us bring the season straight to you!
2. Share the campaign with your family and friends. 
Help us spread the word so we can all enjoy it together!
3. Follow the show on Facebook and Instagram.
Connect with us, we wanna hear from you!
Thank you so much for your support,
Let's make a show!
-- The Code-Switched Team

story:
Synopsis:

In a waiting room somewhere in the galaxy a soulful entity named Charlie tries to change an incorrectly placed decimal point on his paperwork so he can be assigned to his rightful planet. Stranded since the beginning of time, Charlie tries to unravel the incomprehensible rules and regulations which prevent him from correcting this minor error.  While other souls come and go, Charlie waits on the Blue Marble assignment line, a victim of the red tape that’s existed since the Big Bang and shows no signs of ever changing.

 

What We Need & What You'll Get:

$12,000 has already been raised and shooting starts in May. $15,000 more gets a whole season on the web.  The funds we raise will go towards pre-production & production for "The Blue Marble."  Think: locations, transportation, necessary bureaucracy (i.e. production expenses), art, visual effects, insurance, food, our lovely cast & crew!  

Any & all contributions you make will help us immensely... but there's also something in it for you!

Check out the right-hand sidebar for perks ------------>

We'll make as many episodes as we can w/ the funds available.  But, trust us, you're gonna wanna know how "The Blue Marble" ends!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, please help us get the word our there!  Here's a few ways:

  • Like & follow us on Facebook, Instagram & Twitter
  • Send this IndieGoGo page to friends & family: https://igg.me/at/thebluemarbleTV

AND that's all there is to it!

story:
With your generosity, Midday Productions will be able to complete Fauna, a twelve minute animated pilot about overcoming the obstacles of adolescence in a mysterious world that won’t stop growing.

Fauna follows Ava, a reserved 16-year-old spending her summer working outdoors at Hilltop Park. One day her work is interrupted by trees and plants bursting from the ground and covering the park in a dense forest, knocking her unconscious. When she wakes up, she finds herself in a world that seems like her own, but with a few strange differences... It’s a lot to handle, even with the help of co-worker Jax and stranded park-goer Calvin. Not to mention the piece of twig stuck deep in Ava’s arm and the strange purple fox following their every move.

Fauna’s main objective is to give young people who feel outcast or "different" something to connect to. The story explores the difficulties of being a teenager, from navigating new environments to dealing with complicated relationships, all while figuring out who you are. Our story is one that is widely relatable, but it is the non-binary, matriarchal and LGBTQ+ characters that set Fauna apart from your every day “coming-of-age” series. Fauna's larger story connects to themes of environmental responsibility and the importance of taking care of the world around you. Climate change has become an increasingly important topic and this series provides a new take on that dialogue.

As it explores the journey of Ava, Jax and Calvin, Fauna serves as a heartfelt love letter to anyone stuck in a place they feel they don’t belong and celebrates the strength and perseverance of learning to love yourself.

Midday Productions is a team of four students currently completing degrees in Media Production at Ryerson University.

Calvin Bakelaar Animation Director and Co-Producer

Calvin is a graphic designer, motion graphics artist, and musician. Always searching for creative outlets, Calvin is constantly working on some form of creative expression. Calvin was drawn to Fauna because of its characters and premise - the interactions between characters and the intriguing storylines they create.

Julia O’Connor Co-Producer

Julia is drawn to every aspect of production. She has worked on a number of projects in a multitude of roles, so it was only fitting that a producer role would fall into her lap. Having a hand in bringing the characters from Fauna to life has been one of her favourite accomplishments, and she can't wait to share it with the world.

Rachel Gordon Writer

Rachel is a freelance writer with a deep love of animation. She was inspired to write Fauna after working landscaping at a cemetery and gaining a new appreciation for how people interact with their environment. Rachel has always been highly influenced by her environment, and the question of how we function when the environment around us changes drastically is one she is excited to explore. She looks forward to bringing a fully realized version of this story to the screen.

Andrea Vahrusev Marketing Director

Andrea is a brand strategist by trade. She is consistently working on the visual identity and narratives of various brands. Andrea was drawn to Fauna because of the unique storyline - the way it touches on life and overcoming challenges, a mature take on an animation. As marketing director, she works on the technicalities of Fauna’s digital presence and helps keep the messaging concise.

You may be wondering at this point: if I’m donating all this money, where on earth is it going? Great question! With your help, Midday Productions will be able to fund the following necessary expenses to finish production of the pilot episode of Fauna: 

  • Craft Services
  • Honorariums for Assistants 
  • Animation Plugins
  • Marketing Initiatives 
  • Fauna Swag
  • Location Bookings 
  • Launch Party
  • Event and Competition Submissions - yes, there’s a fee!

Our goal is to raise a total of $3000 CAD. 

Have a question that needs answering? Feel free to reach out to middayproductionstoronto@gmail.com or find upcoming campaign initiatives at @faunaanimation.

story:
The Plot

THE CANDY STORE is the world's first mainstream TV series centered around crossdressing and gender non-conforming lifestyles. 

The series follows The Lacey Family, owners of a medical prosthetics shop that inadvertently becomes a shopping hub for crossdressers, trans women, and female led couples.  Now, in order to be successful, the Lacey's must understand the desires and risks of their clients, all while managing the secrets of the seemingly vanilla community. 

The characters will be from all walks of life as this topic is universal and ageless.

 

About the creators

The show is being created by a very unique pair.  MINDY is an actress and also the co- owner of a boutique that caters to crossdressers.  MICHAEL is a professional screenwriter that enjoys crossdressing.  One day Michael walked into Mindy's shop and - BAM! - a show was born. 

We each have our own reasons why we crossdress.  And we've seen crossdressing portrayed as a goof in film and tv time and time again.  We can all agree that...

No film or TV series has ever gotten it right. 

 

Our goal

This is a major TV series, staffed by Emmy Award-winning industry professionals that will feature an A-List or former A-List star and be presented to Netflix and Amazon Prime for worldwide distribution.  The only way to help society to understand and accept us is through maximum exposure in the mainstream. 

Our ultimate budget goal is $600,000.  This will enable us to produce the full, six episode first season.  We are seeking to raise a little bit more than half of that - $350,000 - through indiegogo.  The rest will be raised through private investments. 

 

Most crossdressers are in the closet.

Imagine a series as big as BREAKING BAD, BIG LITTLE LIES or THE SOPRANOS that helps everyone understand that crossdressing is not something to hide or be ashamed of.  Whether undergoing gender reassignment, living full time as a female, expressing a femme side occasionally, or simply being in a female led relationship - our diverse interests need to be represented in pop culture and met with the same acceptance as all other forms of diversity.  WE ALL NEED  TO BE COMFORTABLE AND HAPPY IN OUR OWN SKIN. This is mission of THE CANDY STORE.

 

Our Award-Winning Production Team

Because some of our team members have not yet come out publicly as crossdressers, we won't be listing their names until the show is complete.  However, THE CANDY STORE'S current crew has combined for 5 Emmy Awards, won top film festivals in NY and LA, and has been involved with major productions featuring stars such as JENNIFER ANISTON, DAVID SCHWIMMER, BRUCE WILLIS, HUGH GRANT AND SIR RICHARD ATTENBOROUGH.

The finished product will be of top quality in terms of camera, lenses, lighting, and talent. 

 

The Biggest Challenge

We are aware that there are people out there that may not want to watch 'a crossdressing show'.  But our experienced production team knows this and this is how we plan to mitigate this factor:

Did people watch BREAKING BAD because they were interested in Meth?  Did they watch ORANGE IS THE NEW BLACK because they were interested in prison?  In both cases, audiences found the characters interesting and decided to go with them on a journey - wherever it went.  We plan to do the same.  Audiences will fall in love with the Lacey Family and want to see them succeed.  The lessons we plan to teach will be carefully placed in increments that the public can digest as we help educate the world.  CROSSDRESSING IS ALL AROUND US...WE JUST DON'T SEE IT!

 

What You Get

Even though it's called a 'donation', you still get something for your money!  We have a really awesome list of rewards that come with each donation amount.  Please take a look at the rewards on the right because if you're looking to indulge your femme side, there just might be something worth checking out!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Production companies are interested in producing THE CANDY STORE, but if we accept their offers, they'll want to bring their team on board and we fear they won't understand the delicate nature of our individual stories.  That is why we want this show to be written and produced by people in our community - from the writers, to the crew, to those making contributions.  We want to keep it in the family!

We have everything in place.  All we need is the funding. 

Please make a contribution and share this link with anyone that you think would benefit from a show like this.

 

Discretion

We understand the importance of discretion, as many of us are closeted.  Please don't let that prevent you from being a part of our team.  Donations will appear on a credit card statement as: "CANDY STORE"  There will be nothing connecting you to the title or content of the show.  

 

Exposure

If you'd like the world to see your femme pics, you can email us your photo after making a donation and refer to our list of rewards for potential exposure. 

 

Investment Opportunities

Several people have reached out with inquiries about investing larger dollar amounts for a percent ownership of THE CANDY STORE'S first season.  Anyone interested in being an equity partner can email us at candystoreshow2020@gmail.com to request a copy of those deal structures.  

 

Contact Us

If you have any questions about donating, or about the project in general, please email us at candystoreshow2020@gmail.com.  Thank you!

story:
Get to know us:

Your Hunni is a nonbinary songwriter, recording artist, creative director and handpoked tattoo artist living in Toronto.  

Jaimee Quinn Vicente-Hall is a genderfluid creator who loves dogs, pasta and bringing people together.

Your Hunni and Jaimee Quinn Vicente-Hall are exes, lifelong friends and creative partners. 

Get to know our project:

IN THEIR ELEMENT is a five part video series intended to celebrate the joy, art, passions and existence of gender-nonconforming people in Toronto. In this project, we will delve deep with five different artists, talking about their gender journeys and gaining insight into their everyday lives. We will be shadowing tattoo artists, mural painters, musicians, and other creatives in order to shed light on their artistic processes. Further than focusing on gender and art, this project aims to honour vulnerability and illuminate small joys in the everyday lives of queer people.  

Where YOU come in:

We have an incredible cast & creative team and we need YOUR help bringing this project to life! Our costs include paying the artists and creative team involved, studio rentals, lighting/camera equipment, and promotional materials. As contributors, you'll help us make this important project the right way, allowing us to attain the exposure that this project deserves, as well as the ability to further normalize the existence of creative gender-nonconforming professionals in Toronto. 

We start shooting the first week of September, 2021! It would mean the world to us if you contributed to help our passion project make its mark on the Canadian media landscape. Any amount is greatly appreciated. We would love to see you sharing/reposting this campaign to get the word out as well!

story:
THE FAE series

BACKGROUND: FORMERLY FAEMILY STYLE

Last year, with the invaluable help of our supporters, we raised $4,000 to develop a queerly fantastical web series. Over the past year, we've been hard at work, drafting and revising scripts, plotting season arcs, organizing readings, building community interest, growing financial support, and assembling a formidable creative team. Originally conceived as a variety show called Faemily Style, the project has evolved into a high-concept fantasy dramedy: The Fae. This fall, working with our amazing community, we filmed the first two episodes of this exciting new series!

SYNOPSIS for THE FAE

Mixing trenchant realism with surrealist fantasy, The Fae celebrates queer flamboyance as a magical force to be reckoned with. Think The Outs meets Buffy and Harry Potter by way of Pink Narcissus. The series follows Mark (Shelton Lindsay), a gay millennial who possesses all the trappings coveted by mainstream gay culture, who suddenly learns of magically queer beings called faeries – and that he might be one of them!

The first season of The Fae explores Mark’s awkward first steps as he struggles to learn how to harness his faerie flamboyance in his everyday life. Just how much will Mark have to sacrifice to learn the true nature of his magical power?

TALENT for THE FAE

CREATORS: 

Shelton Lindsay (Creator, Writer, Show Runner, Production Designer): As designer and performer, Shelton has faeried up music videos, commercial shoots, professional film sets and T.V. (Catch him in Seasons 1, 2 of High Maintenance, Tales of the City and in Amy Miller Gross’ Accommodations).

Justin Taylor (Creator, Writer): Justin is a playwright and TV writer who has brought his fae spirit to numerous theatrical productions and TV pilots (including his musical Alien Love Child and work at Playwright’s Horizons, BRIC Arts Media, and Prospect Theater; MFA from Yale).

Joshua Fesi (Creator, Writer): Joshua is a playwright (Paradise Lost in Space) and visual artist, has a Ph.D. in English, and has been a mainstay in the Radical Faerie performance world.



CREW: 
Hanna Swayze (Producer)
Nessa Norich (Director)
Daniel Contaldo (Director of Photography)
Shelton Lindsay (Production Designer & Location Scout) 
Nancy The Girl (Costume Designer)
Trisha Bordeaux (Hair & Make-up)
David Quateman (Camera Operator)
Eamon Redpath (Sound Mixer & Boom Operator)
Dino Davaros (Key Grip)
Luke Carquillat (Gaffer)
Justin Taylor & Joshua Fesi (Script Supervisor)
Anne Cunningham (Costume Assistant)
Emma ZT (Art Department)
Gabriel Spector (Art Assistant)
Doug Dale (Art Assistant)
Miranda Schieving (Art Assistant) 
Odyssey Davies (Art Assistant) 
Young Sun Han (Production Assistant)
Max Neuman (Production Assistant)
Chris Wilmoth and Jason Mayernick (Catering)

CAST:
Shelton Lindsay (Mark Macintosh)
Eduardo Francisco (Derek)
Hunter Canning (Jake)
Katy McClellan (Caroline)
Seth Timothy Larson (Aaron)
Bizzy Barefoot (Puck, Methuselah)
Scott "Eve" Jackson (Incubus)
Diego Andres Barnes (Nancy 1)
Coleman "Judy Darling" Drew (Nancy 2)
Karen Light (Nancy 3)
L. Morgan Lee (Messy)
Donald Gallagher (Glorious Day)
Damani Moyd (Satyr)
Nancy Heyl (Beautiful Fae)
Elah Seidel (Madame)
Image Object (Storytime)
Lee Leberton (Patriarchy)
Mark Leydorf (Billydoll)
Jordan Sanford (Singing Fae)
Justin Taylor (Theophrastus Thrush)
Joshua Fesi (Parmenides Pigeon)
Jedd Cohen (Shadow)
Christopher Donahue (Passing Fae) 
Jonathan "Suburbia" Clarence (Passing Fae) 
Trisha Bordeaux (Passing Fae) 



GORGEOUS ON-SCREEN TALENTS
Anne Cunningham
Bloom Davis
Davide Chicamae
Dimitri Barcomi 
Donna Dolore 
Emma ZT
Gael Showers
Jack Jackson
Joseph Alexiou
Kalynda Klementis
Katya Stepanova
Krys Fox
Matty Glitterati
Nick Stryker
Norm Munoz 
Omri Navot
Victor Pivetta
Young Sun Han

The Goal: $10K for Finishing Episodes 1 & 2

We've (very nearly) finished filming our first 2 half-hour episodes and the footage looks gorgeous! We are raising funds for post-production so we can turn our footage into complete pilot episodes. Funding will go toward hiring experienced professionals to help us:

  • Film for one more day to pick up montage shots as scripted.
  • Pay for location rentals
  • Cut, organize, and edit our footage into 2 complete episodes.
  • Color the footage.
  • Mix dialogue and sound.
  • Purchase music rights.
  • Create a logo for THE FAE.
  • Create a credit sequence.
  • Build graphic design for a pitch deck.
  • Pay fees for multiple festival submissions
  • Special effects to elevate the magic sequences 

Stretch Goal: $15K for Special Effects & Music

We would love to make more money! More money means hiring professionals to add digital effects to make our magical moments pop! It also means we can hire a musician to arrange music!

  • Stretch Goal: Add post-production special effects for key magical moments.
  • Stretch Goal: Compose and add unique musical score.

The Impact

By broadcasting a world of uninhibited faggotry, THE FAE promises to fill a profound void in entertainment. As LGBT-content continues to reach out to mainstream audiences, now is our chance to feature an elaborate storyworld focused on the strengths and values of radical queer community. Showcasing queer style, queer art, queer spirituality, and queer love, THE FAE presents a unique vision of queer community as electrified with genuine magic. THE FAE demystifies difference while seducing the audience into its wild and wonderful world. What could it mean for socially isolated or remote queers - especially queer youth - to have this show in their home?

Ultimately the pilot episodes we are making will be used as leverage to gather more funding to produce the whole season we have planned with an aim to have it find a home on a digital streaming service. 

Risks & Challenges

We have gorgeous footage now and we want use it to make the best pilot episodes possible. Since production was such a success, we want to ensure that post-production is a success too. The biggest risk in this effort would be to try to do post-production on the cheap, and that's why we want to raise funds to hire the right editing professionals who can give this footage the treatment it needs to be as magical as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

As always, sharing is caring! Help us spread the word, as this art is for all of us. No One Turned Away For Lack Of Funds! We hope you enjoy what we make and invite you into our fold even if you can’t contribute coin.  

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

Morgan Lee (Messy)Donald Gallagher (Glorious Day)Damani Moyd (Satyr)Nancy Heyl (Beautiful Fae)Elah Seidel (Madame)Image Object (Storytime)Lee Leberton (Patriarchy)Mark Leydorf (Billydoll)Jordan Sanford (Singing Fae)Justin Taylor (Theophrastus Thrush)Joshua Fesi (Parmenides Pigeon)Jedd Cohen (Shadow)Christopher Donahue (Passing Fae) Jonathan "Suburbia" Clarence (Passing Fae) Trisha Bordeaux (Passing Fae) 
GORGEOUS ON-SCREEN TALENTSAnne CunninghamBloom DavisDavide ChicamaeDimitri Barcomi Donna Dolore Emma ZTGael ShowersJack JacksonJoseph AlexiouKalynda KlementisKatya StepanovaKrys FoxMatty GlitteratiNick StrykerNorm Munoz Omri NavotVictor PivettaYoung Sun Han

The Goal: $10K for Finishing Episodes 1 & 2
We've (very nearly) finished filming our first 2 half-hour episodes and the footage looks gorgeous! We are raising funds for post-production so we can turn our footage into complete pilot episodes. Funding will go toward hiring experienced professionals to help us:

Film for one more day to pick up montage shots as scripted.
Pay for location rentals
Cut, organize, and edit our footage into 2 complete episodes.
Color the footage.
Mix dialogue and sound.
Purchase music rights.
Create a logo for THE FAE.
Create a credit sequence.
Build graphic design for a pitch deck.
Pay fees for multiple festival submissions
Special effects to elevate the magic sequences 

Stretch Goal: $15K for Special Effects & Music
We would love to make more money! More money means hiring professionals to add digital effects to make our magical moments pop! It also means we can hire a musician to arrange music!

Stretch Goal: Add post-production special effects for key magical moments.
Stretch Goal: Compose and add unique musical score.



The Impact
By broadcasting a world of uninhibited faggotry, THE FAE promises to fill a profound void in entertainment. As LGBT-content continues to reach out to mainstream audiences, now is our chance to feature an elaborate storyworld focused on the strengths and values of radical queer community. Showcasing queer style, queer art, queer spirituality, and queer love, THE FAE presents a unique vision of queer community as electrified with genuine magic. THE FAE demystifies difference while seducing the audience into its wild and wonderful world. What could it mean for socially isolated or remote queers - especially queer youth - to have this show in their home?
Ultimately the pilot episodes we are making will be used as leverage to gather more funding to produce the whole season we have planned with an aim to have it find a home on a digital streaming service. 


Risks & Challenges
We have gorgeous footage now and we want use it to make the best pilot episodes possible. Since production was such a success, we want to ensure that post-production is a success too. The biggest risk in this effort would be to try to do post-production on the cheap, and that's why we want to raise funds to hire the right editing professionals who can give this footage the treatment it needs to be as magical as possible.


Other Ways You Can Help
As always, sharing is caring! Help us spread the word, as this art is for all of us. No One Turned Away For Lack Of Funds! We hope you enjoy what we make and invite you into our fold even if you can’t contribute coin.  

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

story:
the STORY

Hi, 

I'm Damon Faulkner, a screenwriter, director, and producer. Marvine High is the largest project I have worked on, and it is near to my heart because I wrote the story. The story came to me while I was sitting on the subway. This idea of a stolen test sparked into a web series now called Marvine High.

The story of Marvine High follows high school senior Jackie Carlton through her rigorous investigation into who stole the graduation test. Things become tricky when four of the school's star students are accused of the crime. Jackie and her close friend Maxine have to decipher who is lying, who is telling the truth, and who is guilty.

 

the BREAKDOWN

Our goal is $5,000! That being said, not a penny will be wasted. Our team has worked tirelessly to form a budget that is attainable and practical. We want to share our budget with you so that you know precisely where your money is going!

None of the money is going toward myself, the creator, or any of the producers or directors. This project means much more to us than a profit. 

Location: $2,500 (Our location is a key part of this project and consumes the majority of our budget)

Transportation: $250 (Getting our cast and crew to and from location)

Craft Services: $500 (Because we aren't paying our actors we want to make sure we are properly feeding them!)

Art Department: $550 (Achieving that 90s feel will take a skilled art team and supplies)

Music Rights: $400 (One of our characters is a musical star and we need the rights to her song for her storyline to make sense!)

Festival Fees: $300 (To be able to send our work to festivals around the United States!)

Promotional Items: $200 (Things like posters, stickers and t-shirts)

 

the WHY

Marvine High is a great project to donate to for many reasons. 

  • We are excited to be working with a local high school. The school is a vocational high school with students of many different backgrounds and interests. We are getting their students involved with hands-on experience in costuming, makeup and on set experience.
  • We are giving Temple University students hands-on experience as well, as most of our team members are currently in school themselves. 
  • This is the first project I have produced at this scale. I have produced a few short films outside of my academic career, with each I learned something new that I intend to bring to Marvine High!

the CHALLENGES

Transparency is one of our team's greatest values. We aim to be open and honest with our supporters about the risks and obstacles we may face on the way to achieving our goal.

  • With a project lasting 3 months of shooting, there are always risks, but what is art without a little risk?
  • Our team is dedicated and passionate about this project. The opportunity for error would most likely arise with timing, as we have allotted five weekends to film with no available dates for reshoots. However, that being said, our team is working tirelessly to make sure our planning is flawless. 
  • Actors are another worry for our team. We are looking for actors that have a connection with the characters and people that committed to their work, which could pose a challenge since these are unpaid positions. 

Ways You Can Help

  • Follow us on Instagram and twitter @marvinehigh
  • Spread the word about Marvine High
  • DONATE!!!

story:
Short Summary

The American Music television series was founded in 1985, by host and creator Randall Keith Horton, a noted musical scholar, composer, conductor and pianist, who began his musical career with the San Francisco Symphony Orchestra, later composing and conducting for Duke Ellington and Motown legends Marvin Gaye, Martha Reeves and The Jackson Five/Michael Jackson.

The American Music series has been produced intermittently for regional public television audiences for more than 30 years.  In the last 10 years, the American Music program has been aired on a monthly basis by PBS-member station KRCB-TV in the San Francisco Bay Area and CUNY-TV in New York City, and is the only regularly aired TV show that celebrates the creation, performance, scholarship and contributions of American Music...OUR MUSIC... in full historical context. 

 The American Music television series is a thirty-minute, talk show that celebrates all aspects of American music through:  Documentaries, Performances, Interviews, Scholarship and Children's Programming.   

It's now time for the series to be seen by a national audience!  The American Music Educational Television Project, along with EHB Productions, are asking for your help in funding two important initiatives that will help us achieve that goal!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $40,000 to...

1.)  To Improve a more sophisticated set.

2.) To produce two new episodes of American Music, featuring internationally-renowned guests.  In April, we will tape the first of these episodes, featuring the amazing Kirke Mechem, the “Dean of American Coral Composers”.  He has composed operas and other compositions that have been performed hundreds of times in more than 42 countries, and is also the author of the national, award winning book Believe Your Ears: Life of a Lyric Composer.   

We will be announcing the identity and taping schedule for our second exciting and internationally-renowned guest in the next few months over this Ingiegogo site! We will also share updates and behind-the-scenes photos, so stay tuned! 

 

BUDGET BREAKDOWN

PERKS

As a supporter of the campaign, you will help elevate the American Music TV program to a national calibre.  You'll enjoy behind the scenes updates, celebrity guest autographs, free swag, sneak peeks of the new episodes before they air publicly and maybe even YOUR NAME up in lights!  Check it out!    

The Impact

There is no other show like it!  The American Music television series,  part of the American Music Educational Television Program, strives to educate, enrich and enlighten the general public about the creation, performance, scholarship and contributions of AMERICAN MUSIC!   As funding for the Arts continues to be cut, YOUR support becomes critical.  

Make a cup of Joe at home and contribute what you would normally spend at the coffee shop, OR throw caution to the wind and contribute $15, $25 or more, knowing your money will go to a great cause with the power to "give back"!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money a little tight right now?  Here are a couple of no-cost ways you can support the American Music television program!

  • Share our Indiegogo campaign on your social media
  • Tune-in and watch the American Music television series on KRCB-TV (San Francisco Bay Area) and CUNY-TV (New York and surrounding cities)
  •  Call your local PBS television stations and let them know YOU want to view the American Music television series in YOUR area.

story:
Dear Universe,

Welcome to the Uranus Awards! These awards are here to recognize those films that expand our imagination through movie magic and storytelling that takes us into brand new worlds! Whether the films are adventures to other galaxies, a world with super heroes, or simply opening our minds to the possibility of magic and splendor outside of our little lives, we salute these films and hope you will participate in helping us decide which films deserve recognition for being the best at helping us escape into worlds where the supernatural is natural. Watch the eligible nominees, read our blog, The Probe: Exploring the Movie Universe, listen to our podcast; Going in Deep: Broadcast from Uranus, and vote for your favorites!

All of this leads up to the First Annual Uranus Awards, which will be live-streamed at Milliron Studios, in New York, NY. on January 14th, 2018.

By becoming part of our Indiegogo family, you'll be allowing us to do a weekly podcast, afford to go to the movies, make amazing video content, design merch, and so much more!

PODCAST
Every week, Going in Deep: Broadcast from Uranus, will be recorded at Milliron Studios, providing us with the best sound and equipment, to make sure that our listeners hear our opinions loud and clear!

By supporting us on Indiegogo, you can be featured on our podcast in many ways.

Receive a shoutout on the podcast for your social media accounts.

Advertise for your business on the podcast, as well as on social media.

We can give a shoutout on the podcast for your social 

We can share your Social Media information, share your opinion on specific topics, or even advertise your business.

 

OTHER WAYS TO SUPPORT US

Like us on Facebook
Follow us on Twitter, Instagram & Soundcloud
Subscribe to us on YouTube
